text: Good morning, Paranormal Investigations, I said in my best give-me-a-case-because-Im-broke manner.

Name: Book 16

text: Okay, I was used to that.
Name: Book 16

text: Its what you got when you claimed to investigate the paranormal.
Name: Book 16

text: I say claimed because I couldnt remember the last time I had actually investigated something, anything and all my so called paranormal cases tended to have rational explanations, even if cuckolded spouses believed enchantments were the root cause of infidelity I had to enlighten them that infidelity happens, suck it up buddy.
Name: Book 16

text: I pressed to end the prank call.
Name: Book 16

text: You may think its really cool to be proprietor and lead investigator of what amounts to a detective agency, its not.

text: I wish I could make it sound glamorous but normally Im too busy hocking bits of old jewellery to pay the rent.
Name: Book 16

text: Truth be told, this was not the life I had envisaged for myself.

text: I went to drama school dammit.

text: I hopped on the bus (cheaper than parking up there) and tried to sit with the least smelly people.
Name: Book 16

text: After a while you got to know the regulars on the bus; the lady with the baby carriage that actually contained a small Maltese Terrier (you should see peoples faces when they bent to fuss over a child and saw a dog), the man who talked to everyone as if hed known them for twenty years and the mother and daughter who looked like cockney elves.
Name: Book 16

text: What they thought of me, I dont know.
Name: Book 16

text: The PI office building is on a busy road leading up to the M25, it is a typical seventies office gulag although built on a slight curve although its no Royal Crescent.
Name: Book 16

text: Crossing the road from the bus stop can be tricky, some people really dont know when theyre not on the motorway anymore  normally knob-ends in sports cars who play for one of the big premiership football clubs around here.
Name: Book 16

text: Inside the building the lifts had long since ceased to work so I had to climb the stairs to the seventh floor.
Name: Book 16

text: From the lift there was a long corridor to our corner of the building, the floor tiles were those cream coloured plastic ones with designer grey smears, very 1970s.
Name: Book 16

text: Reggie was there, as always, polishing the floor.
Name: Book 16

text: I said hello and he ignored me, as always.
Name: Book 16

Name: Book 16

text: It was one of those with a half glass panel  Paranormal Investigations was painted on the door in gold paint.

text: GA Mildred had done it herself, it showed  the long letters had drips clinging to them that had long since hardened.
Name: Book 16

text: I sighed as my hand rested on the doorknob, this was not my life.
Name: Book 16

text: Every time I crossed the threshold I got a sense of unease, as if my life had gone off track and was now veering out of control and I was not sure how to reclaim it.

text: From the door I could hear Rose talking to GA Mildred on the phone, it was difficult not to with her voice.

Name: Book 16

text: Ill take it from here, I told Rose and put my hand out for the phone.
Name: Book 16

Name: Book 16

Name: Book 16

text: You might almost mistake it for a garden centre as she had different varieties of plants in pots all over the place.
Name: Book 16

text: I suspected some were plastic, but I had no proof.
Name: Book 16

text: Rose asked, proffering a plate of biscuits with one hand and passing me the phone with the other.
Name: Book 16

text: Honestly, sometimes I think she only worked at PI for the biscuits.
Name: Book 16

text: I shook my head.
Name: Book 16

text: Hello Auntie, I said with little enthusiasm into the phone.
Name: Book 16

text: Is it your birthday yet.
Name: Book 16

text: GA Mildred barked, cutting right to the point.
Name: Book 16

text: Where some elderly female relations obsessed about potential husbands and the pitter patter of tiny feet, GA Mildred was singularly obsessed with my twenty-fifth birthday.
Name: Book 16

text: She had one of those loud voices that demanded to be listened to, I think old boarding schools must have taught people to talk loudly and with confidence  shew your class gels.
Name: Book 16

text: You know my birthday is at the end of the month, the thirty first of October.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes I know, twenty five on the thirty first.
Name: Book 16

Name: Book 16

text: October fifteenth.
Name: Book 16

text: Oh.

text: Ive got Agatha Christie coming over for afternoon tea.

text: Like many of her generation she hung off without saying goodbye.
Name: Book 16

text: Stupid old bint, Agatha Christie had been dead since 1976.
Name: Book 16

text: My office had been built in the seventies, the decade that taste forgot.
Name: Book 16

text: It might have been quite stylish when GA Mildred first moved PI to Cockfosters.
Name: Book 16

text: Now it was as dilapidated as the building that surrounded it.
Name: Book 16

text: The furniture hadn't been new then and I suspected GA Mildred had herself inherited it.
Name: Book 16

text: Some of it was Victorian, other pieces heavy pre-war oak and the rest unidentifiable clutter.
Name: Book 16

text: GA Mildred didn't like to throw anything out and I didn't feel the business was sufficiently mine to do so myself.
Name: Book 16

text: On my messy desk I had a pot plant, a rubbery green thing which needed no watering as the leak in the ceiling above did that for me.
Name: Book 16

text: The plant was the only sign of life in the office - you couldn't really count Rose, she was pretty ancient and gave no indication of a beating heart and breathing lungs - unless there was a plate of biscuits in the offing and then she had the instincts of a ninja.
Name: Book 16

text: I went into my office and shuffled papers for a bit.
Name: Book 16

text: It did me good to make the office look used by moving things from one side of the desk to the other, in truth there was little work to do as the last case had been a missing cat three months ago and that situation had been wrapped up when I informed the client her cat had been adopted by, and was currently being overfed by, her neighbour.
Name: Book 16

text: The business should really be called Lost Cats and Errant Spouses rather than Paranormal Investigations.
Name: Book 16

text: There was no hope of things ever getting better.
Name: Book 16

text: You see, the problem is I dont believe in the paranormal.
Name: Book 16

text: It just doesn't exist.
Name: Book 16

text: Not ghosts, ghouls, demons, aliens or anything else that might be described as supernatural.
Name: Book 16

text: I think the name holds us back, but GA Mildred would not hear of changing it, its part of her legacy she says, and the name stays.
Name: Book 16

text: I hated the fact my work was a joke and there wasnt even a decent wage in it for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Two years ago I was a jobbing actor, busy failing at auditions and being told a size twelve was too fat to fit in the pre-made costumes.
Name: Book 16

text: I was used to rejection, poverty and defeat.
Name: Book 16

text: It was my way of life and strangely  I was happy.
Name: Book 16

text: For years GA Mildred had told me there was a place for me in Paranormal Investigations and for years I managed to put her off without offending her  she was practically my only family after all.
Name: Book 16

text: Then, two years ago, it had seemed everything was going wrong  the love of my life went to try his luck in Los Angeles and I crumbled.
Name: Book 16

text: I was not sure I had ever told Jez he was the love of my life and perhaps I should have, it might have made things take a different path.
Name: Book 16

text: Its hard though, when you fall into a relationship from a friendship, to make that leap into saying I love you whatever the comeback may be.
Name: Book 16

text: I had not taken the risk and had acted so cool at his leaving he left thinking I didnt care at all - see, those three years at drama school werent completely wasted.
Name: Book 16

text: Heartbroken and alone GA Mildred sucked me in.

text: "Help me out for a while," she had said and like a fool I had moved north to 'help her out'.
Name: Book 16

text: I started by watering the plants and doing the filing.

text: Then she had asked me to do more and more: answering the phones, meeting clients and finally stake outs when her 'varicose veins hurt too much'.
Name: Book 16

text: Last year she had retired and left me to it.

text: There was a wall around Princess Park Manor and I loitered behind it, hidden to anyone coming out of the large building but a curiosity to anyone on the other side at half six in the morning.

text: Princess Park Manor was a large and beautiful Victorian mansion - or so you would think to look at it.

Name: Book 16

text: Big enough to try it in a hospital filled with potential witnesses and guards.
Name: Book 16

text: The pain, no longer content to be ignored, returns with a vengeance and my knee buckles.
Name: Book 16

text: As I fall to the floor, I hear Kara say, "   Rest.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod and close my eyes with Karas thoughts to keep me company as I descend into the darkness.
Name: Book 16

text: "   You'll be free soon,    she says.
Name: Book 16

text: I open my eyes and immediately, I regret it.
Name: Book 16

text: I think hospitals and infirmaries have bright lights to torture their patients.
Name: Book 16

text: At least that's what it feels like.
Name: Book 16

text: I close my eyes again.
Name: Book 16

text: "   Rise and shine.
Name: Book 16

text: Ordinarily, I like hearing Kara's voice.
Name: Book 16

text: This time is no exception.
Name: Book 16

text: I smile and focus on her instead of the pain in my head.
Name: Book 16

text: I can tell shes relieved.
Name: Book 16

text: For several moments, I just lie there basking in the feeling before I ask the first of many questions troubling me.
Name: Book 16

text: "   How long have I been out.
Name: Book 16

text: "   Two days,   " She says.
Name: Book 16

text: I must have been worse off than I had thought.
Name: Book 16

text: It shouldnt surprise me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its been a rough week.
Name: Book 16

text: Rough enough for me to spend time in a hospital.
Name: Book 16

text: My buddy with the pillow and the knife didnt help matters.
Name: Book 16

text: "   They had to operate on your knee and stitch you up.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt want to wake you unless it was an emergency.
Name: Book 16

text: Nothing I can say to that.
Name: Book 16

text: I know how much she worries about me.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes it scares me that she cares so much about me.
Name: Book 16

text: It goes beyond just being my guardian angel.
Name: Book 16

text: You said that I would be free soon.
Name: Book 16

text: Are they going to let me walk out here.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt answer immediately.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes holding something back, deciding what to tell me.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes it bothers me but Ive learned to trust her.
Name: Book 16

text: When she does answer, she sounds tired.
Name: Book 16

text: More tired than I have ever heard her.
Name: Book 16

text: Trust your feelings.
Name: Book 16

text: They wont lead you astray.
Name: Book 16

text: Cryptic but sound advice for most occasions, Im not sure how much it will help me in this situation.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe she will tell me more later on, after I rest and heal.
Name: Book 16

text: I resist the urge to press her for details.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes always done right by me.
Name: Book 16

text: I would bet my last dollar shes probably been watching over me since the attack.
Name: Book 16

text: I can sense her nodding off before she is gone, off to wherever she goes when she is not with me.
Name: Book 16

text: One of the nurses gives me a curious look.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the sort of look someone might give a wild animal or crazy person.
Name: Book 16

text: I must have been talking out loud again.
Name: Book 16

text: At least this time, I can blame it on the meds and my injuries.
Name: Book 16

text: As the nurse leaves my room, she gives me another look.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant help but wonder what she might have heard.
Name: Book 16

text: I have more important things to think about.
Name: Book 16

text: I need some answers to the questions that are going to be tossed my way.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone tries to kill you, people ask questions.
Name: Book 16

text: You beat someone down; people ask why even if the reason is blatantly obvious.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell, Im surprised the police weren't at my bedside waiting for me to wake up.
Name: Book 16

text: They'll be here, it's only a matter of time and theyll ask the same questions I am asking myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Who wants me dead and why.
Name: Book 16

text: I admit I have a few enemies.
Name: Book 16

text: You cant go through life without making at least one enemy.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is that none of my enemies hate me enough to pull a stunt like this.
Name: Book 16

text: Sure, some of them would like to see me hurt or dead but they want to either do it themselves or in a way that wont attract attention.
Name: Book 16

text: The only one that comes to mind has been dealt with.
Name: Book 16

text: No, this has to be someone or something else.
Name: Book 16

text: It has to be.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, answering the why might give me a clue as to who wants me dead but Im coming up empty.
Name: Book 16

text: If Kara was here, I could bounce a few ideas off of her head.
Name: Book 16

text: Its just after I finish a blander than usual lunch when I learn my assailant is in a lot worse condition than I am.
Name: Book 16

text: I should feel bad but I dont.
Name: Book 16

text: Don't get me wrong, Im not jumping for joy either.
Name: Book 16

text: Hurting people isn't something I enjoy but I can only feel so broken up about someone who tried to murder me.
Name: Book 16

text: He pissed away any goodwill that I might have had towards him the moment he decided to kill me.
Name: Book 16

text: Granted, Im assuming he meant to kill me but its a safe bet.
Name: Book 16

text: Call me silly but knives and pillows arent the sort of tools you use in any civilized conversation, even in New York.
Name: Book 16

text: Some touchy feely types might not agree with me or call me a Neanderthal.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill be the first to admit my views arent main stream when it comes to a number of things.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesn't mean Im a nutcase who goes out of his way to pick fights.
Name: Book 16

text: Violence is a last resort.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem with last resorts is that if it doesnt work, youre officially out of options; thats why anything you are saving for that moment has to work.
Name: Book 16

text: After all, it is your last resort.
Name: Book 16

text: If you use it and it fails, youre done.
Name: Book 16

text: Its one of the reasons why I learned the martial arts.
Name: Book 16

text: If that makes me a throwback or worse, so be it.
Name: Book 16

text: What really bothers me is how much I have had to fall back on my last resort within the last few days.
Name: Book 16

text: I look up as the authorities arrive, trying to hide my surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: They definitely arent NYPD.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyone can see that.
Name: Book 16

text: The three of them, two men and a woman, look too clean cut and regular, as if carved from the same mold.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Their look and demeanor scream the word Fed.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure if it is a good thing or not.
Name: Book 16

text: They introduce themselves: Special Agent Lynch, Special Agent Marino and Doctor Bolland.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive never been good with names.
Name: Book 16

text: In this case the names arent as important as the titles: two special agents and one doctor.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite popular belief, FBI special agents aren't called in for just any case.
Name: Book 16

text: Sure they investigate a lot of crimes but most of their work deals with national security and cases where local law enforcement need assistance.
Name: Book 16

text: After some meaningless chitchat about my stay here and my health, we get down to brass tacks.
Name: Book 16

text: Theyre all business and little warmth, especially Agent Lynch.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems like he is going out of his way to distance himself from me as he verifies my contact information.
Name: Book 16

text: Its nothing that he says, it's what he does.
Name: Book 16

text: He stands there at the foot of my bed with his arms folded across his chest.
Name: Book 16

text: No, it goes deeper than that.
Name: Book 16

text: Something is bothering him.
Name: Book 16

text: Not just him, all of them.
Name: Book 16

text: I see it in the little things they do and the looks they give one another.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever game plan or strategy they had went out the window some time ago.
Name: Book 16

text: Even without Kara being here, alarm bells start to ring.
Name: Book 16

text: They didnt come here about the orderly.
Name: Book 16

text: No, they had scheduled this visit before I was attacked.
Name: Book 16

text: That puts things in a new and dangerous light.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a chance and break the routine to ask a question.
Name: Book 16

text: Whats this all about.
Name: Book 16

text: Who knows, I might even get a straight answer.
Name: Book 16

text: The main thing is to get them talking.
Name: Book 16

text: I need to know whats going on.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant afford to be in the dark.
Name: Book 16

text: Several moments go by before one of them speaks, the woman.
Name: Book 16

text: I struggle to remember her name, Marino.
Name: Book 16

text: Albritton, are you acquainted with Scott Dorward.
Name: Book 16

text: I could lie, but whats the point.
Name: Book 16

text: Lying to federal agents carries a lot more risks than rewards.
Name: Book 16

text: Odds are they already know the answer.
Name: Book 16

text: Its an interviewers trick.
Name: Book 16

text: You ask a question you already know the answer to.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives you the opportunity to gauge the person youre talking to and measure their response.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a tactic Ive used from time to time when Im working a case.
Name: Book 16

text: More often than not, it opened up a line of investigation that hadnt occurred to me before.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to go with the truth.
Name: Book 16

text: Most people would be a bit surprised that I know Scott.
Name: Book 16

text: Granted, he gets a lot more press coverage in Europe, but his name and face pop up from time to time either in the tabloids or on one of those entertainment programs.
Name: Book 16

text: What he lacks in looks, he makes up for with his sharp wit and killer British accent.
Name: Book 16

text: Not to say he is ugly or anything like that, but he's no golden boy.
Name: Book 16

text: A bit too pale, his hair and eyes are just a little too dark to be considered attractive in most circles.
Name: Book 16

text: Personality goes a long way and Scott has plenty of that.
Name: Book 16

text: It and his father's connections helped him become a minor celebrity.
Name: Book 16

text: What the media doesn't know is that Scott Dorward is probably one of the most knowledgeable men on the planet when it comes to the occult and magic.
Name: Book 16

text: If it's been researched or studied, Scott knows something about it.
Name: Book 16

text: He believes the old adage 'knowledge is power' and it's something he has plenty of.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott is a sorcerer, meaning he is able to use magic and cast spells.
Name: Book 16

text: Sorcerers are a lot like doctors.
Name: Book 16

text: Most are general practitioners.
Name: Book 16

text: They know a little bit about everything.
Name: Book 16

text: Others are specialists who choose to concentrate on or study one area.
Name: Book 16

text: Witches and warlocks study witchcraft.
Name: Book 16

text: Ritualists are sorcerers who specialize in ritualistic magic, the kind that needs a lot of preparation.
Name: Book 16

text: You get the idea.
Name: Book 16

text: Marino smiles, its the same sort of smile I wear when I am working on a case and feel like I am on the right track.
Name: Book 16

text: I think I know where she might be going with this.
Name: Book 16

text: This isnt my first time being interviewed by the authorities.
Name: Book 16

text: How would you characterize your relationship with him.
Name: Book 16

text: Were friends but not close, I reply.
Name: Book 16

text: I had the good fortune to met Scott back when I got started in this business.
Name: Book 16

text: We've been friends ever since.
Name: Book 16

text: Not best friends, but good enough to be able count on one another.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes, he tosses work my way, extremely well paying work though I prefer to work for Solomon the Wise.
Name: Book 16

text: Even sorcerers of Scott and Sols caliber need a little help from time to time.
Name: Book 16

text: When Scott needs help, he is willing and able to pay well for it.
Name: Book 16

text: Such jobs are never dull but after everything is said and done, you feel like you were underpaid.
Name: Book 16

text: The last little favor I did for him resulted in this hospital stay and a few other far reaching consequences.
Name: Book 16

text: And what is his involvement with Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: she asks.
Name: Book 16

text: I open my mouth then close it.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is someone I would like to forget.
Name: Book 16

text: By all rights, he should be in no position to do no harm.
Name: Book 16

text: He was the first person to come to mind when I was thinking about who wanted me dead.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, the Feds are here asking questions about him and Scott.
Name: Book 16

text: What and how much do they know.
Name: Book 16

text: They probably know more than they should.
Name: Book 16

text: It also means I could be in a lot more trouble than I thought.
Name: Book 16

text: They could probably figure everything out, but odds are they will jump to the wrong conclusion.
Name: Book 16

text: So what do I tell them.
Name: Book 16

text: I look at Agent Marino and try to get a feel for her.
Name: Book 16

text: My instincts battle with the cold rational part of me.
Name: Book 16

text: I should ask for a lawyer and keep my mouth shut.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be the smart thing to do, but it doesnt feel right.
Name: Book 16

text: Marino and her partners are here for answers, no matter how strange they might sound.
Name: Book 16

text: If they dont get them then no lawyer in the world will be able to save me.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe I should start at the beginning.
Name: Book 16

text: Go on, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: First off, Im not crazy.
Name: Book 16

text: Okay, I know it looks bad and that popular opinion is probably against me, but what I have to say is the truth.
Name: Book 16

text: It all started last Tuesday.
Name: Book 16

text: My last case paid surprisingly well.
Name: Book 16

text: For the first time in weeks, my creditors were not a problem.
Name: Book 16

text: I could actually afford to take a night off and relax.
Name: Book 16

text: As I got ready to go out, the evening news plays in the background.
Name: Book 16

text: The news of the day washes over me, not making an impact.
Name: Book 16

text: It is seen and heard but not felt.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure if its just me or if this is something were all guilty of.
Name: Book 16

text: No matter the source of the news, be it television, radio, the newspaper, internet or word of mouth, I receive it with a sense of detachment.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe its a defense mechanism to cope with all the information at the tip of our fingertips.
Name: Book 16

text: Im desensitized to the news and its relevance unless it affects me in some tangible way.
Name: Book 16

text: Is it human nature or is it just a character flaw too many people possess.
Name: Book 16

text: Tragedy mixes with peppy human interest stories designed to put a happy face on another all too bleak day.
Name: Book 16

text: An earthquake rocks the Philippines.
Name: Book 16

text: A fire guts an apartment building in Brooklyn.
Name: Book 16

text: Another body turns up in Alphabet City.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the second one this week and its only Tuesday.
Name: Book 16

text: The Mass Transit Authority announces more cutbacks making the threat of a transit strike all the more likely in the not too distant future.
Name: Book 16

text: Entrepreneur Jack Meredith is being interviewed about his plan to revitalize the South Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: You learn something new every day.
Name: Book 16

text: I never knew revitalizing a neighborhood meant kicking people out onto the street and turning their homes into condos.
Name: Book 16

text: If that wasnt bad enough, he makes a point to mention all of his accomplishments and his plans for the future.
Name: Book 16

text: He calls it a better tomorrow, one where he is undoubtedly richer and more powerful.
Name: Book 16

text: It goes on and on.
Name: Book 16

text: I nearly miss it, a break in at 25 Sutton Place.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara catches it a second before I do,    Isnt that Scotts building.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn up the sound as a picture of Scott at a recent charity event is flashed across the screen.
Name: Book 16

text: He seems completely at ease, standing amid some of New Yorks other philanthropists in one of his Neo-Victorian suits.
Name: Book 16

text: The newswoman recites a blurb about Scott before moving on to details about the attempted robbery.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt have any real details, just enough to peak ones interest.
Name: Book 16

text: If I want to learn anything, I need to get over there.
Name: Book 16

text: Calling Scott wont work.
Name: Book 16

text: He has this thing about phones, he doesnt like or trust them.
Name: Book 16

text: Its one of the quirks that make him Scott Dorward.
Name: Book 16

text: I remember asking him about it, He merely said anything important enough to tell someone is better done in person or by messenger.
Name: Book 16

text: In a day and age where communication on the go is getting easier and easier, Scott clings to the habits of the past.
Name: Book 16

text: Course, he isnt stupid.
Name: Book 16

text: He does have a cell phone which he will only use in the direst of emergencies.
Name: Book 16

text: I have the number.
Name: Book 16

text: Thankfully, Ive never had to use it.
Name: Book 16

text: I finish pulling on my long coat and check my pockets for the few tools I always carry, before I head out the door.
Name: Book 16

text: At this time of night, I shouldnt have any trouble getting a cab cross town.
Name: Book 16

text: A half an hour and twelve dollars later, I wonder what Ive gotten myself into.
Name: Book 16

text: I never should have come here.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a detective.
Name: Book 16

text: Its something I always try to remind myself whenever I think about taking a case.
Name: Book 16

text: I let my concern get the better of me, something that happens too often when one of my few friends is in trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite my feelings about sorcerers, I consider Scott a friend.
Name: Book 16

text: Like I said before, Im no detective.
Name: Book 16

text: I call myself a paranormal investigator.
Name: Book 16

text: I even have a piece of paper to prove it.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont be too impressed by that.
Name: Book 16

text: The damn thing isnt worth the paper its printed on.
Name: Book 16

text: It does come in handy especially around tax time.
Name: Book 16

text: The IRS likes to be able to link your income with some sort of profession.
Name: Book 16

text: If you think I chase UFOs, investigate haunted houses or hunt monsters, you would be half-right.
Name: Book 16

text: I leave that stuff to the professionals.
Name: Book 16

text: Most of my fellow PIs use scientific method and technology to help them investigate the paranormal.
Name: Book 16

text: My way is a lot different.
Name: Book 16

text: I always thought using mundane methods and tools put you at a disadvantage when dealing with the supernatural.
Name: Book 16

text: Its why ghost hunters and other paranormal investigators have such a hard time proving the existence of something supernatural.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not out to prove or disprove anything.
Name: Book 16

text: Early on, I realized people go to the authorities for assistance with something they think is supernatural or related to it.
Name: Book 16

text: You might be surprised by how often this happens.
Name: Book 16

text: Their reasons for doing so vary.
Name: Book 16

text: It could be something as simple as a strange sound in their home to a mother afraid her son is involved with a cult conducting human sacrifice to a woman who thinks she is being stalked by a vampire.
Name: Book 16

text: Most of the time, the authorities turn them away.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats where I come in.
Name: Book 16

text: These people dont need the help of a sorcerer or a ghost hunter.
Name: Book 16

text: They need someone who knows, or at least has an idea about, whatever might be going on and how to solve the problem.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if I cant solve the problem, Im fairly good at research and I probably know someone who can help them.
Name: Book 16

text: After a lot of trial and error, I developed a knack for the cases that need someone with my talents.
Name: Book 16

text: Something jumps out at you when you hear the details.
Name: Book 16

text: Something says, Pick me, Monty.
Name: Book 16

text: It also helps having Kara around to guide me.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes she can pick up on things I miss.
Name: Book 16

text: Nine times out of ten, I end up referring my potential clients to someone else who can help them.
Name: Book 16

text: The rest keep life interesting and pay the bills.
Name: Book 16

text: With the police combing the scene, there is no way I am getting up to Scotts apartment.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if I could, its unlikely I would be able to talk to him in private.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about ready to leave when I notice Hagan standing off to the side, well away from the police and the crowds.
Name: Book 16

text: Depending on how you translate it, his name means the youthful one or highborn.
Name: Book 16

text: He says he is immortal.
Name: Book 16

text: I say hes crazy, not that Im a great judge of such things.
Name: Book 16

text: Still the big man does come in handy from time to time.
Name: Book 16

text: He has a love of battle and adventure which reminds me of the warriors of old.
Name: Book 16

text: So does his skill with weapons.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan, I say, trying not to smile as I give him the quick once over.
Name: Book 16

text: Still looking to go to Valhalla.
Name: Book 16

text: He laughs before replying with his usual counter, Still hearing voices, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan also knows a lot more than he should.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes one of the few people who know about Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: As he puts it, one of the perks of immortality is being able to learn a little about everything.
Name: Book 16

text: In his case that includes at least six languages and enough history to lend credence to his claims.
Name: Book 16

text: I think he spends too much time reading when hes not out bouncing or busting heads.
Name: Book 16

text: That was how we met, he was bouncing in a bar and I was working on my first case when literally all hell broke loose.
Name: Book 16

text: He had the time of his life while I was scared to death.
Name: Book 16

text: Since then, weve helped each other out on occasion.
Name: Book 16

text: His muscle and willingness to use it, as well as his talent for languages, have made the difference.
Name: Book 16

text: When I asked him why hes always willing to lend me a hand, he told me I was his ticket to Valhalla.
Name: Book 16

text: That worries me more than his presence here or the fact he is armed.
Name: Book 16

text: Only Hagan would be crazy enough to carry a weapon around this many police.
Name: Book 16

text: The spiked club hanging from his belt might be more legal than a sword or axe.
Name: Book 16

text: Even with my untrained eye, I can tell the weapon has been used recently despite Hagans attempt to clean it.
Name: Book 16

text: Crazy or not, like me, Hagan connected to the paranormal.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes not a sorcerer or anything like that, but he can hold his own against almost anything that lurks in the shadows.
Name: Book 16

text: His presence here tells me what I already know.
Name: Book 16

text: This isnt a normal burglary.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara laughs at the two of us as we go through our ritual greeting, probably wondering if the two of us will ever grow up.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure Hagan thinks Im as crazy as he is, and Kara, well Kara has her own ideas about the two of us and our little quirks.
Name: Book 16

text: Tell tall, blond, and handsome, hello.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, Kara says hello, I leave out the compliment.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt pay to boost Hagans ego and its one of my quirks.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont call other men handsome.
Name: Book 16

text: Certain guys are a bit touchy about that sort of thing and might take it the wrong way.
Name: Book 16

text: He turns and starts walking downtown, probably heading for one of the many bars he knows.
Name: Book 16

text: I fall into step next to him, not bothering to ask why hes here.
Name: Book 16

text: I learned not to rush Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell say whats on his mind when hes good and ready, not a moment sooner.
Name: Book 16

text: Its another one of those so-called perks immortality has given him, the ability to waste time.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan stops outside a bar with no name.
Name: Book 16

text: Looking at the place brings to mind the phrase Two men enter, one man leaves.
Name: Book 16

text: The front is decorated with twisted bits of scrap metal and things that would be more at home in a junkyard than the streets of Manhattan.
Name: Book 16

text: Even with the door closed, I can hear the driving beat and lyrics of Rammstein.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about to open the door to see what the inside is like when Hagan reaches into a pocket for something.
Name: Book 16

text: Dorward is going to be busy explaining things to the police.
Name: Book 16

text: Theyre going to ask him how his visitors ended up in critical condition.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure you had nothing to do with that.
Name: Book 16

text: By way of reply, Hagan shrugs.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt look the least bit guilty or burdened by the fact that he bludgeoned several people nearly to death a short time ago.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyway, when Dorward was done ranting at me, he told me to give you this.
Name: Book 16

text: When I see his hand again, it is holding an antique gold ring.
Name: Book 16

text: The stone is dark green and from memory, I remember the red spots resembling drops of blood that decorate its face.
Name: Book 16

text: I make no attempt to reach for the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: I had told Scott this thing was dangerous and I wanted no part of it.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure if Hagan can feel the power locked within it.
Name: Book 16

text: For me, touching it is like dipping my hand into greasy water.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats nowhere near as bad as tapping into its power.
Name: Book 16

text: As far as I know, I am the only person in recent memory to do so and its not an experience I want to repeat.
Name: Book 16

text: Reluctantly, I accept the damn thing and Hagan looks relieved.
Name: Book 16

text: As expected, the greasy sensation is there, yet this time its stronger.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara likes it less than I do and doesnt hesitate to share her thoughts on the matter.
Name: Book 16

text: Im inclined to agree with her.
Name: Book 16

text: I glance back at Hagan waiting for the rest of it.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont give me that look.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what he was trying to do with it.
Name: Book 16

text: He just hired me to play bodyguard, Hagan says.
Name: Book 16

text: The fact Scott wanted backup doesnt surprise me.
Name: Book 16

text: A while back I heard he tried to do some sort of summoning and it didnt go as planned.
Name: Book 16

text: Since then, he prefers to have some backup when he experiments.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes, he works with Sol, another sorcerer and someone else I consider a friend.
Name: Book 16

text: Most people call him Solomon the Wise because of his extensive library and knowledge when it comes to the practical uses of magic.
Name: Book 16

text: The fact he chose Hagan does surprise me.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott would only hire Hagan if there was a need for cold steel and the willingness to use it.
Name: Book 16

text: He was expecting trouble Hagan says The three gents who kicked down his door while he was doing his magic thing didnt expect me to be there.
Name: Book 16

text: Two of them were pushovers, the other one was an ogre.
Name: Book 16

text: He took a little longer to deal with.
Name: Book 16

text: It must not have been a very good workout for him but the ogre concerns me.
Name: Book 16

text: There arent too many of them around.
Name: Book 16

text: They tend to shy away from big cities.
Name: Book 16

text: The ones that call the cities their home are rough customers who lurk in the back alleys and seedier parts of town.
Name: Book 16

text: They possess a wide range of magical powers for blending in with their surroundings.
Name: Book 16

text: Most like playing at being gang leaders or hired muscle.
Name: Book 16

text: After the ogre took off, Dorward told me to get out of there with the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I think he was afraid the police might confiscate it or something.
Name: Book 16

text: He said you would take care of it.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan steps into the bar, not bothering to say good bye or say what I already know.
Name: Book 16

text: Call him if I need him.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes me feel better, despite the vibes I keep getting from the ring and this whole deal.
Name: Book 16

text: What the hell has Scott gotten himself into.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever is going on, Im now involved in it.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara remains silent as I flag down a cab.
Name: Book 16

text: Jakes will be the perfect place to enjoy whats left of my night and maybe have a few questions answered.
Name: Book 16

text: If Im going to play babysitter with this thing, I want to know more about it.
Name: Book 16

text: Only one person can help me with that.
Name: Book 16

text: Jakes manages to steal the attention and clientele from all the other bars along this stretch of Amsterdam Avenue.
Name: Book 16

text: Its dark interior sports a younger crowd but the scenery is to die for.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only are the bartenders extremely well endowed.
Name: Book 16

text: They also know how to make a killer margarita.
Name: Book 16

text: The lower level has a huge dance floor where a DJ works his magic.
Name: Book 16

text: It even earns bonus points for its lounge where you can talk and enjoy the company of friends without losing your hearing.
Name: Book 16

text: Tuesday night is a quiet night.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no line to get in or cover charge.
Name: Book 16

text: Its still pretty crowded but not crowded enough that I have to fight my way to the bar or battle for the attention of the bartender.
Name: Book 16

text: All in all, its a good place to hang out in.
Name: Book 16

text: Tonight, I have an ulterior motive for coming here.
Name: Book 16

text: This is one of Nervas favorite hangouts.
Name: Book 16

text: I can usually find her here, breaking hearts and stealing souls on the dance floor.
Name: Book 16

text: She collects dance partners and playmates like young boys used to collect baseball cards, always increasing her collection while discarding or trading away the ones who no longer interest her.
Name: Book 16

text: She says she is a vampire and I believe her.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont deal much with vampires.
Name: Book 16

text: Its unhealthy to hang around anyone or thing that views you as a potential meal.
Name: Book 16

text: I also steer clear of most lawyers and landlords for the same reason.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, vampires do exist.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont ask me how many there are.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldnt tell you.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a great authority on them but Ive had enough encounters with them to know a few things about them.
Name: Book 16

text: First off, you have to forget about all that nonsense you might have seen in the movies or on television.
Name: Book 16

text: Contrary to popular belief, most vampires don't dress in black capes and tuxedos or sound like Bela Lugosi.
Name: Book 16

text: They may or may not fit the more fashionable stereotypes of handsome men and beautiful women dressed in stunning black outfits.
Name: Book 16

text: They can look like anyone you might meet on the street and they dress to individual taste.
Name: Book 16

text: A select few are blood drinkers but that isn't the norm.
Name: Book 16

text: Simply put, a vampire is any being who draws life and energy from another living person.
Name: Book 16

text: Every culture has stories about vampires and the undead, each one with different powers and abilities.
Name: Book 16

text: Some can feed from you without your ever knowing about it.
Name: Book 16

text: These vampires will either feed off a lot of people at once, taking a little energy from each victim or they feed very slowly from a single person.
Name: Book 16

text: Others can and will leave you bone tired - or worse a burned out corpse to be found by the authorities.
Name: Book 16

text: What they feed on also varies; some absorb what I like to call life energy through close, sometimes intimate contact while others feed off of emotions or even dreams.
Name: Book 16

text: The few blood drinkers Ive run into resemble the vampires most depicted by the media.
Name: Book 16

text: Each vampire also has some way or talent to make sure they can attract potential meals without much of a fuss.
Name: Book 16

text: Many are extremely charismatic while others gravitate to professions and lifestyles where they can feed without attracting attention.
Name: Book 16

text: There was a vampire I met in St.
Name: Book 16

text: Louis who fed on grief.
Name: Book 16

text: He worked as a funeral director.
Name: Book 16

text: Are they alive, dead or something else.
Name: Book 16

text: It depends on the vampire.
Name: Book 16

text: Most of them are alive but not in the same way you and I are.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva is more alive than anyone I know.
Name: Book 16

text: Too bad, she isnt here yet.
Name: Book 16

text: Its only a matter of time before she puts in an appearance.
Name: Book 16

text: Waiting here for her is better than trying to chase her down.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me a chance to relax and digest everything Hagan told me.
Name: Book 16

text: I do some of my best thinking in bars.
Name: Book 16

text: The steady supply of alcohol helps.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite the noise and crowds, I can turn my thoughts inward to solve a problem with the people and events around me to serve as inspiration.
Name: Book 16

text: I keep saying Im no detective, but I do have some experience when it comes to solving mysteries and problems.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone has their own style and way of doing things.
Name: Book 16

text: I like to look at the facts and people involved to see how they fit.
Name: Book 16

text: The trick is to answer the big questions.
Name: Book 16

text: What happened and where.
Name: Book 16

text: Who was involved and why.
Name: Book 16

text: How did it happen.
Name: Book 16

text: For problem solving, I add another question.
Name: Book 16

text: What is the best way to solve this.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes I have to answer a few smaller questions to get the answers to the bigger ones.
Name: Book 16

text: I think about everything I know about my friend.
Name: Book 16

text: He knows the ring is dangerous and hes good enough at what he does not to take any chances.
Name: Book 16

text: So why would he mess with the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara chimes in,    He had no choice.
Name: Book 16

text: That isnt a comforting thought.
Name: Book 16

text: It causes me to flag down the bartender to make sure my next margarita is given an extra topping of tequila.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott had no choice.
Name: Book 16

text: It might explain why the Bloodstone feels so tainted.
Name: Book 16

text: You should have kept it,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Weve been through this before.
Name: Book 16

text: I have no business carrying around something like this, let alone using it.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott felt you should, otherwise you wouldnt have it now.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes, there is no arguing with her.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan said Scott was worried about the police confiscating the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: Why give it to me and not Sol or another sorcerer.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a sense of satisfaction from across the link but no answer to my question.
Name: Book 16

text: I pull out the Bloodstone to take a better look at it.
Name: Book 16

text: The antique gold ring was made for a man.
Name: Book 16

text: When I gave the ring to Scott, he said it was made during the Victorian era but the stone was much older.
Name: Book 16

text: Looking at it now, I wonder how much older.
Name: Book 16

text: The dark green bloodstone mounted on the ring looks different, not like how I remembered it.
Name: Book 16

text: The red drops of color are more prominent on the stones surface.
Name: Book 16

text: I feel dirty just touching the thing.
Name: Book 16

text: It is enough to make me shudder.
Name: Book 16

text: Still it had to be done.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas senses are better than mine, or more accurately, she knows what to look for since she is using my senses when we are linked this way.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever sensations I am getting from the ring are probably worse for her.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive known Kara long enough to catch the sense of worry and unease she is trying to hide from me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its been a little over an hour since Hagan gave me the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I can see why Scott was worried, but why give it to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill have to ask him about it when I see him.
Name: Book 16

text: I put the ring away and try to forget about it.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara relaxes a bit while I sip my drink.
Name: Book 16

text: There is just enough salt around the rim of my glass to do my margarita justice, then its time for another one.
Name: Book 16

text: By the third, Ive washed the rings feel from my memory.
Name: Book 16

text: I can almost feel Karas lips brush my cheek.
Name: Book 16

text: So what do we do about it.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not safe for you to use.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want to use it,    I take a deep breath, grateful the bar is smoke- free.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill talk to Sol and learn a little more about it.
Name: Book 16

text: I want to take things slow till I know what I am dealing with.
Name: Book 16

text: I was going to say destroy, it but I have no idea what might happen if I was able to do so.
Name: Book 16

text: Destroying a powerful item like the Bloodstone could have serious repercussions.
Name: Book 16

text: No, it is better to err on the side of caution.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara breathes a sigh of relief.
Name: Book 16

text: She was afraid I might do something rash.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know why she thinks I need the thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Whenever I ask her why, I never get a straight answer.
Name: Book 16

text: Worse comes to worse, I could have someone drop it in the middle of the ocean.
Name: Book 16

text: Its almost 2 am when Nerva finally arrives.
Name: Book 16

text: A flicker of jealousy and wariness comes across the link from Kara as I catch her attention.
Name: Book 16

text: The vampire rushes over and hugs me.
Name: Book 16

text: During the brief moment of contact, Kara hisses spitefully.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva must have taken a tiny taste of me.
Name: Book 16

text: As usual, I didnt feel a thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Im too distracted by her presence.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre looking good, I say with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: The tiny Brazilian bombshell is dressed to impress in a slinky black outfit and high heels.
Name: Book 16

text: It shows off her body without being tight enough to interfere with dancing.
Name: Book 16

text: She laughs as if she doesnt have a care in the world.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva knows Im fairly good at resisting her charms but Im not immune to them.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont think any man could be.
Name: Book 16

text: It's part of the game we play whenever we meet.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt like it and I cant really blame her.
Name: Book 16

text: The link has its downsides.
Name: Book 16

text: She can tell Im physically attracted to Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: I know it bothers her.
Name: Book 16

text: Even a guardian angel, no matter how patient and caring, has her limits.
Name: Book 16

text: She fumes in silence as Nervas teeth nip at my earlobe.
Name: Book 16

text: Uh huh, you want me.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva doesnt wait for an answer.
Name: Book 16

text: She takes the drink out of my hand.
Name: Book 16

text: Her tongue flicks out to lick the salt from the rim of my glass before drinking the rest of my margarita.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is beside herself with anger.
Name: Book 16

text: I nearly forget why I wanted to speak to her.
Name: Book 16

text: It wasnt for a night of dancing and wild sex, though the thought does cross my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats part of danger when dealing with Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: So far, Ive managed to avoid that particular fate because no matter how much fun it would be, its not worth giving up what I have with Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: I need to see Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva nods slowly, releasing her hold on me.
Name: Book 16

text: Is he expecting you.
Name: Book 16

text: I shake my head.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol is a hard man to see but if anyone would know more about the ring, it would be him.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva acts as his personal secretary and sometime bodyguard.
Name: Book 16

text: There are rumors their relationship is far from platonic.
Name: Book 16

text: She knows I would only go through her if it was important.
Name: Book 16

text: I could arrange a meet without her but it would take longer.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesnt stop her from enjoying herself at my expense.
Name: Book 16

text: She sets the empty glass down and takes my hand, leading me onto the dance floor.
Name: Book 16

text: I do a lot of things well but dancing isnt one of them.
Name: Book 16

text: Im good enough not to embarrass myself on most nights.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes having a good partner can make you seem ten times worse or a hundred times better.
Name: Book 16

text: With Nerva, its the latter.
Name: Book 16

text: I follow her lead and the beat of the music.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes having fun, Kara isnt.
Name: Book 16

text: After the third song, I feign tiredness and Nerva lets me get away with it.
Name: Book 16

text: I buy her a drink and start to fill her in on the details now that she is ready to listen.
Name: Book 16

text: The news catches her by surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: Not the part about someone breaking into Scotts apartment, by now, most of the major movers and shakers in the city should have heard about that.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the part about Hagan and the ring that blindsides her.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about to start rattling off more details that dont interest her when she holds up a hand to silence me.
Name: Book 16

text: He can see you the day after tomorrow around 4 pm.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill make the arrangements, she says.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have to say the next few words but I say them anyway, Thanks, I owe you one.
Name: Book 16

text: The way she licks her lips makes me wonder how she plans on collecting.
Name: Book 16

text: I spend the next hour watching Nerva dance while I start to sober up.
Name: Book 16

text: It feels like Im making progress.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to leave before last call is announced.
Name: Book 16

text: I want to get in some practice time at the dojo, so that means I cant afford to stay out much later.
Name: Book 16

text: Outside, I nod to the bouncers then turn the corner.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a nice night for a walk and my apartment isnt far.
Name: Book 16

text: The exercise will do me some good.
Name: Book 16

text: I am two blocks away from my building when it happens.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though its late, there are plenty of people on the street.
Name: Book 16

text: Like me, most of them are returning from a busy night on the town.
Name: Book 16

text: Unlike me, they only see two men step out of the coffee shop and walk in my direction.
Name: Book 16

text: One is tall and handsome with strong Germanic features.
Name: Book 16

text: He could have been a model or a movie star with his good looks.
Name: Book 16

text: His dark grey suit is tailored.
Name: Book 16

text: The outfit would have put me back in debt.
Name: Book 16

text: It was probably pocket change for him.
Name: Book 16

text: I had never met the man before but I knew who he was.
Name: Book 16

text: He made me feel uneasy, like I should know him from someplace other than television.
Name: Book 16

text: His name is Meredith, Jack Meredith, a high wheeling and dealing real estate developer who has been making waves recently.
Name: Book 16

text: The same Jack Meredith I saw on the news earlier tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: To everyone else, the man next to him looked like a mook from a gangster film.
Name: Book 16

text: To me, the grey-skinned humanoid crammed into a less than stylish suit looked like trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: This had to be the ogre Hagan was talking about.
Name: Book 16

text: It wasnt the largest I had ever seen, but big enough to be a problem if I had to fight him.
Name: Book 16

text: At least, he wasnt armed and from the way he moved, Hagan had put a hurting on him.
Name: Book 16

text: This cant be a coincidence or anything good.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara gives me some more bad news as I take a closer look at Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Careful, hes a sorcerer.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith looks and moves like a man half his age, far younger than he appears on television but still recognizable.
Name: Book 16

text: Its obvious he takes good care of himself.
Name: Book 16

text: It could be a product of magic but I doubt it.
Name: Book 16

text: He moves like a fighter, someone who isnt afraid to get his hands dirty.
Name: Book 16

text: The smile he favors me with is an empty thing lacking in warmth and friendship but its his eyes that worry me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a person; Im an obstacle that is in his way.
Name: Book 16

text: So youre the one who got away, He says more to himself than me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im confused and Im not the only one.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is also wondering about that remark.
Name: Book 16

text: One of my teachers once told me no question is stupid, but this one sure does sound the part.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths laughter stings me.
Name: Book 16

text: Youve come full circle and dont even realize it.
Name: Book 16

text: The answer doesnt help clear things up.
Name: Book 16

text: Im at a disadvantage here and operating in the dark.
Name: Book 16

text: So what does the great Jack Meredith want with me.
Name: Book 16

text: You have something that doesnt belong to you.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about to make a smart comment about stereotypes and clichs when his next words slam into me.
Name: Book 16

text: Albritton, you will give me the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: He says it like I have no choice in the matter.
Name: Book 16

text: I risk a glance at the ogre who seems more than ready and willing to break me in two but he makes no move towards me.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs,    Hes good.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt even know he was using magic until the spell touched you.
Name: Book 16

text: If he just tried to use magic on me then it means he doesnt know as much about me as he thinks.
Name: Book 16

text: When I dont respond to his words, Merediths smile falters.
Name: Book 16

text: I can almost smell the wood burning between his ears as he starts running down all the possible reasons why his spell might have failed.
Name: Book 16

text: Even when you do everything right, spells like anything else, can fail, especially now.
Name: Book 16

text: Magic isnt as powerful as it used to be.
Name: Book 16

text: Its another thing the books, movies and television get half right.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott told me a while back magic, like science, follows certain laws.
Name: Book 16

text: All spells and magical powers take energy.
Name: Book 16

text: You can find this energy in people, places and things to varying degrees.
Name: Book 16

text: Most supernatural and magical beings draw this energy from within themselves to do magic, while others are tied to a place or an object.
Name: Book 16

text: Sorcerers dont have it that easy.
Name: Book 16

text: They have to harness this energy using complex spells or rituals to work their magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes the person or thing they draw the energy from is destroyed in the process.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats what a sacrifice is.
Name: Book 16

text: Death and destruction can liberate all the magical potential in someone or something.
Name: Book 16

text: Thankfully, human sacrifice isnt practiced like it was in past.
Name: Book 16

text: When you draw energy, you can draw attention.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyone able to use magic might be able to sense someone else tapping into an energy source if they are close enough.
Name: Book 16

text: This is especially true if they are sharing a power source such as a ley line, item of power, or whatever.
Name: Book 16

text: This can be enough warning to defend his or herself, maybe even enough time to counter whatever is being done.
Name: Book 16

text: Another rule or law is that all spell casting also takes time and effort.
Name: Book 16

text: You cant just snap your fingers and make magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes its quicker and easier to use more mundane methods than to use a spell.
Name: Book 16

text: This is also why most magic is very subtle.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no room for wasting energy on special effects.
Name: Book 16

text: When magic has a visible or dramatic effect, it takes far greater energy, time, and effort time than a more subtle spell.
Name: Book 16

text: For example, the energy used to shoot a jet of flame from your fingertips is far greater than just causing a target to spontaneously combust.
Name: Book 16

text: The results are the same but in the first case you use a lot of energy producing the flame.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe in the old days, flashy magic was the norm.
Name: Book 16

text: These days magic works almost invisibly.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths expression hardens as he looks at me.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont need Kara to tell me what happened, he tried another spell to find out why his command didnt work.
Name: Book 16

text: It failed just like the first spell did.
Name: Book 16

text: His mouth opens and then closes; I can tell he wants to ask me how Im doing this.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the same reason why the ogres illusion doesnt fool me.
Name: Book 16

text: Most magic targeting me is redirected elsewhere.
Name: Book 16

text: Only the most powerful spells and magical abilities can touch me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a very good trick for someone to have in my line of work.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara knows what I am going to do next.
Name: Book 16

text: Its one of my guilty pleasures.
Name: Book 16

text: Whenever I have the chance to poke fun at someone who is giving me a hard time, I take it.
Name: Book 16

text: I admit its a little petty of me.
Name: Book 16

text: It is useful for keeping people off balance.
Name: Book 16

text: This is one of those occasions.
Name: Book 16

text: This is a very public place for a mugging and thats the only way youll get anything out of me.
Name: Book 16

text: And dont think the ogre in the monkey suit will help you.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell screw up again like he did at Dorwards place.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a risk letting him know the ogres masking spell isnt working on me, but it has the desired effect.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith doesnt bother to hide his surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: I want him thinking about what else I might be able to do.
Name: Book 16

text: On the other hand, the ogre takes an angry step forward, one of his large hands reaching out to maim me when Meredith says, Grstaka, no.
Name: Book 16

text: The ogre obeys reluctantly.
Name: Book 16

text: It proves beyond a shadow of a doubt Meredith is the one in charge here.
Name: Book 16

text: As I watch the two of them, Kara remains silent.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt want to distract me unless there is something important to tell me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im still in a bad position here.
Name: Book 16

text: Neither one of these two mean me any good.
Name: Book 16

text: His smile is the same one he uses when speaking in front of the masses.
Name: Book 16

text: Its too late for that.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not going to be fooled by it or his words.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only is he a sorcerer, I can tell he follows a far darker path than Scotts or Sols.
Name: Book 16

text: You just dont walk up to someone on the street and do this sort of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: You have a rare talent, Count Albritton.
Name: Book 16

text: Damn right, its rare.
Name: Book 16

text: According to Sol, Im the only person he knows of with this sort of power and he knows a lot of people.
Name: Book 16

text: Too bad I cant control it.
Name: Book 16

text: It works against all magic spells and abilities, baneful as well as beneficial.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to favor him with a smile of my own and a nod.
Name: Book 16

text: Youve come farther than I ever imagined, but that does not change anything.
Name: Book 16

text: You have something I want.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah well, in a perfect world we would all get what we deserve.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, youll get whats coming to you.
Name: Book 16

text: The ogre reacts more to my veiled threat than Meredith so I push a little harder, You must not be too bright to send an ogre to rob someone.
Name: Book 16

text: G'rstaka wasnt there to steal the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: My eyes narrow slightly.
Name: Book 16

text: Its obvious he knows something I do not.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no way I am going to get any straight answers out of him.
Name: Book 16

text: This is all a game to him, one where he has all the cards.
Name: Book 16

text: Why is he wasting time.
Name: Book 16

text: The ogre should be all over me.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara says via our link,    The ring draws magical energy and stores it.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith was able somehow able to activate it.
Name: Book 16

text: How do you know that.
Name: Book 16

text: I ask, not bothering to internalize the question.
Name: Book 16

text: Inadvertently, my words manage to confuse Meredith and Grstaka again.
Name: Book 16

text: He's feeding more energy into the Bloodstone as we speak.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is leaving something out but I cant worry about it right now.
Name: Book 16

text: From experience, I know the Bloodstone can store magical energy.
Name: Book 16

text: What happens when it reaches its maximum capacity or exceeds it.
Name: Book 16

text: Something bad happens to most objects that store energy when you overcharge them.
Name: Book 16

text: That explains why Scott was messing with the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: It also explains why Meredith sent the ogre to do his dirty work.
Name: Book 16

text: A flash of anger leaps across the link as Kara sees my line of reasoning.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a win-win situation for Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Best case scenario, the ogre gets the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if the ogre doesnt get the ring, he throws a monkey wrench into the works since Scott would have to deal with the NYPD and a mountain of paperwork.
Name: Book 16

text: He wouldnt be able to stop Meredith from using the Bloodstone especially if the ring was in police custody.
Name: Book 16

text: His laughter mocks me and I realize Im the one playing the part of the fool.
Name: Book 16

text: While I stood here and baited him, he was using the time to mess with the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what he hopes to accomplish but the fact he only needs to be close to Bloodstone to manipulate it worries me.
Name: Book 16

text: Then it hits me, the picture of Scott on the news earlier tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith was there at the charity ball.
Name: Book 16

text: That picture was taken weeks ago.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith, stop whatever it is youre doing.
Name: Book 16

text: You cannot beat me.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seven have seen to that.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont like the sound of that, not one bit.
Name: Book 16

text: I like Merediths triumphant smile even less.
Name: Book 16

text: I disobey my rule about violence and last resorts.
Name: Book 16

text: My fist forever alters his smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure Meredith will look just as good with a gold or false tooth to replace the one I knock out.
Name: Book 16

text: Me, I have another problem.
Name: Book 16

text: Ogres are very good at hurting people.
Name: Book 16

text: Grstaka doesnt waste a second; he leaps at the chance to tear me into bloody chunks.
Name: Book 16

text: He comes in hard and fast using his size and weight.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan would have met him head on.
Name: Book 16

text: Me, I use whats called the C to step to the side and launch a counter.
Name: Book 16

text: My hand is still hurting from punching Meredith in the face.
Name: Book 16

text: I shouldnt have done that, I let my temper get the better of me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not the way I do things.
Name: Book 16

text: I make my second mistake of the night.
Name: Book 16

text: I am thinking about the ring and everything but the mass of muscle looking to fit me with a toe tag.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I duck away from the grapple attempt, I am off-balance.
Name: Book 16

text: The kick I should have avoided with ease lands dead center on my right knee.
Name: Book 16

text: The pain is exquisite and I am officially hosed.
Name: Book 16

text: A clubbing overhead right catches me though its more luck than skill which allows me to roll with the blow as Meredith climbs to his feet.
Name: Book 16

text: This is not good.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara screams a warning in my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: I move, throwing myself down and to the side away from Meredith, not trusting my gift to save me.
Name: Book 16

text: The only words I could make out were death and spell, two words that should never be together in the same sentence.
Name: Book 16

text: A spell like that should be impossible to cast on such short notice.
Name: Book 16

text: The energy, effort and time required to actually kill someone with a spell is staggering, yet somehow Meredith does it.
Name: Book 16

text: For a moment, the pain in my chest surpasses that of my knee.
Name: Book 16

text: My gift saves me, but a passerby isnt so lucky.
Name: Book 16

text: The redirected spell catches the man.
Name: Book 16

text: I know he is having a heart attack without even looking at him.
Name: Book 16

text: Another casualty is the ogre.
Name: Book 16

text: Grstaka is gone, consumed by the spell Meredith had cast, a sacrifice.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes time for me to pull myself together.
Name: Book 16

text: Not enough time for Meredith to take the ring from me or to finish me off but long enough for him to get away.
Name: Book 16

text: I force myself to look at the victim of his spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone is trying to help him, I hope he pulls through, but I cant stay here.
Name: Book 16

text: I stagger to my feet and limp the rest of my way home to escape the scene, if not the blame for this.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a morning person.
Name: Book 16

text: After a late night, I can be downright irritable.
Name: Book 16

text: After a night of drinking and a fight with an ogre, Im dangerous to awaken.
Name: Book 16

text: So why is my studio apartment filled with the morning light and two unexpected guests.
Name: Book 16

text: My bloodshot eyes focus on Hagan helping himself to my stash of Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee.
Name: Book 16

text: For his sake, I hope the bastard had the decency to make a cup for me as well.
Name: Book 16

text: My other visitor has not taken such liberties.
Name: Book 16

text: He sits in the studios only chair, an old dime store novel lies open in his lap.
Name: Book 16

text: Only when he sees I am awake enough to understand him, does Scott speak in his clipped and precise British accent.
Name: Book 16

text: Its easy to forget I am older than him.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the way he carries himself that makes everyone around him feel like his junior.
Name: Book 16

text: The morning light makes Scott seem paler than usual.
Name: Book 16

text: He looks far more like a stereotypical vampire than Nerva ever will.
Name: Book 16

text: Though his clothing is tailor made and expensive, he wears it differently than Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: For Scott, its not about showing off or wearing the latest fashions.
Name: Book 16

text: He likes dressing in his suits and he wears them well, even the ones that are out of style.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont remember giving either of you a key to my place.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan laughs at that.
Name: Book 16

text: The man has no shame.
Name: Book 16

text: No need for a key when you have such a crappy lock.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown, sitting up in my futon.
Name: Book 16

text: As I draw the covers around me, I realize Kara is not here to greet me.
Name: Book 16

text: The link connecting us is quiet.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown at that as I take stock of the situation.
Name: Book 16

text: At least I dont have a hangover.
Name: Book 16

text: My right knee is pain free but that might change when I get out of bed.
Name: Book 16

text: The only mark on me from last night is a bruise on my chest and a cut on one knuckle of my left hand.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: I got off lucky considering the way I handled things.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott sounds apologetic when he speaks.
Name: Book 16

text: Forgive me for invading your privacy but this is important.
Name: Book 16

text: His words and the situation are enough for me to forgive and forget this.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont invite many people here.
Name: Book 16

text: My studio apartment, though spacious, has little in the way of furniture.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not that I dont enjoy company but I like to have plenty of warning beforehand.
Name: Book 16

text: The fact that the two of them are here uninvited speaks volumes.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is much the same way, while Scott is too polite to break into someones home on a whim.
Name: Book 16

text: The man considers it impolite just dropping by unannounced.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Tell me, youve come for the ring, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sorry, Count but that would be a lie and I never play games with the truth.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan hands me a cup of coffee.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a sip.
Name: Book 16

text: Its just the way I like it, light and sweet.
Name: Book 16

text: The coffee clears away some of the cobwebs, but none of my confusion.
Name: Book 16

text: Right now, you are the only one who can handle the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: He smiles as if he is giving a lecture in a college auditorium instead of sitting in my home.
Name: Book 16

text: If you can hold off on the one syllable questions till I am done, this will be much easier.
Name: Book 16

text: When I learned someone had tampered with the ring, I tried to set things right.
Name: Book 16

text: I tried and failed because of Merediths interference.
Name: Book 16

text: His gesture towards Hagan is almost bird-like, filled with suppressed energy.
Name: Book 16

text: I had the foresight to have Hagan present.
Name: Book 16

text: He was able to keep my guests from drastically shortening my life expectancy from a good century to a pain filled hour in intensive care.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, I was forced to spend the evening in the company of your citys finest.
Name: Book 16

text: I made sure Hagan got the ring to you before I was detained.
Name: Book 16

text: This time Hagan asks the question Im thinking.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott fixes him with a steady glare that causes the big man to mumble something.
Name: Book 16

text: He considers them a breech of courtesy, especially when he is trying to explain something.
Name: Book 16

text: Satisfied that neither one of us are going to interrupt him again, he continues.
Name: Book 16

text: Your peculiar gift for resisting magic is redirecting most of the energy Meredith is sending into the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I daresay you are the only reason why the ring has not reached its maximum potential.
Name: Book 16

text: He waits, making sure I have plenty of time to follow him and interrupt.
Name: Book 16

text: I almost open my mouth.
Name: Book 16

text: A look from Scott silences me more effectively than any verbal command would.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, I know what youre thinking, but it wont work.
Name: Book 16

text: Your talents are wild and unrefined.
Name: Book 16

text: The last time you used the ring it was more a matter of luck than skill and I do not like to take chances.
Name: Book 16

text: A misstep could result in a rather large boom.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, the last time I used the ring was to save both of our lives, but that is another story.
Name: Book 16

text: The fact Scott has just validated a number of my fears does little for my piece of mind.
Name: Book 16

text: There, now you are free to ask questions, engage in wild speculation or panic.
Name: Book 16

text: What does this have to do with the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott stiffens in his chair.
Name: Book 16

text: Its Hagans wolf-like grin that disturbs me.
Name: Book 16

text: Whoever or whatever the Seven are, it cant be good.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan only gets that look when he is there is a prospect of an epic and insanely dangerous battle in the not so distant future.
Name: Book 16

text: He would call it another opportunity for glory.
Name: Book 16

text: There are rumors, myths, dark whispers.
Name: Book 16

text: They are too numerous to discount but too fantastic to believe.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seven are like the Boogeyman.
Name: Book 16

text: They exist to frighten and warn us practitioners of the arts.
Name: Book 16

text: If you believe in them, you also have to believe in dragons.
Name: Book 16

text: This proves even the most knowledgeable sorcerer on the planet doesnt know everything.
Name: Book 16

text: Scotts belief in the supernatural doesnt extend to magical creatures such as unicorns and dragons.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though there are myths and legends about these creatures, he tends to discount them.
Name: Book 16

text: It reminds me of how most scientists regard monster hunters and crypto zoologists.
Name: Book 16

text: This quirk reminds me, Scott has far more theoretical knowledge than he has practical experience.
Name: Book 16

text: There are a lot of things the books leave out.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats the difference between him and Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol has far more practical knowledge and experience when it comes to magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes probably encountered a dragon or even one of these Seven sometime in his life.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats another reason why people refer to him as the Wise.
Name: Book 16

text: Its one thing to know the theory and history but another thing to actually be able to say, Yes, thats the way it worked the last time I did it.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to break the news to Scott before Hagan can.
Name: Book 16

text: Um, dragons do exist.
Name: Book 16

text: I saw one a while back.
Name: Book 16

text: I pause a moment to smile and add, The jury is still out on the Boogeyman.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes about ready to question me when he notices Hagans look.
Name: Book 16

text: His voice drips with disgust as he remembers even he can be wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: I suppose youre going to tell me youve fought one before.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan merely pulls up his pants leg to reveal one of his leather boots.
Name: Book 16

text: It could be alligator or snake skin but the scales are larger and darker.
Name: Book 16

text: I resist the urge to get in a small dig.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no need.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott is willing to accept the word of a friend or respected colleague without hard evidence.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell save his arguments, if any, until after he spends some time researching the knowledge imparted to him.
Name: Book 16

text: In two months time, hell probably know more about dragons and the Boogeyman than me or Hagan ever will.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott straightens his tie as he speaks.
Name: Book 16

text: It is obvious he is not too happy with the direction this conversation has gone.
Name: Book 16

text: Well, that does change things.
Name: Book 16

text: I will need to research a bit more about the Seven and their servants.
Name: Book 16

text: If they are real, the danger is greater than I imagined.
Name: Book 16

text: In the meantime, you and the ring will have to stay out of trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: That earns a laugh from Hagan which I try to ignore.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott continues, favoring me with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: I will also keep the authorities off of your back until we can deal with this situation.
Name: Book 16

text: Oh, dont mention it.
Name: Book 16

text: I am happy to help, but in the future, avoid punching anyone else famous.
Name: Book 16

text: I hate paying off so many witnesses.
Name: Book 16

text: After Scott and Hagan let themselves out, I decide now is the time to do a little research.
Name: Book 16

text: I had planned on going to karate class and working out.
Name: Book 16

text: Any research into the Bloodstone will have to wait till my meeting with Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: If Scott had any more information on the ring, he would have told me.
Name: Book 16
