text: There is also the Seven and Meredith to learn about.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill leave the Seven to Scott, but that wont stop me from pumping Sol for information on them.
Name: Book 16

text: That leaves me with Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: As far as Im concerned, he is the root of the problem.
Name: Book 16

text: The sooner I get a handle on him, the better.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I would rather lie in bed and rest, I get dressed.
Name: Book 16

text: I take the train down and cross town.
Name: Book 16

text: Its my first and hopefully only mistake of the day.
Name: Book 16

text: Though it is just after rush hour, the trains are still crowded.
Name: Book 16

text: I spend the entire trip standing, feeling my knee get worse with each passing minute.
Name: Book 16

text: By the time I get off the train, my knee is beginning to bother me more than Karas absence.
Name: Book 16

text: She stayed with me long enough to see me safely home.
Name: Book 16

text: I had hoped she would be back by now.
Name: Book 16

text: She could help me fill in a few blanks concerning the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: I could tell something was troubling her in addition to everything that happened last night.
Name: Book 16

text: I would really like to know what.
Name: Book 16

text: Libraries have always been a magical place for me.
Name: Book 16

text: As a boy, I learned to appreciate my neighborhood library and all it held.
Name: Book 16

text: I spent more time there than I did at the playground.
Name: Book 16

text: Among the stacks, I could find endless hours of adventure or the cold hard truths of the universe.
Name: Book 16

text: I could glimpse into the hearts and minds of scholars and poets and see the world through their eyes.
Name: Book 16

text: The New York Public Library system is one of the best in the country.
Name: Book 16

text: You would be surprised by the amount and type of information you can dig up here.
Name: Book 16

text: If there is a book you need and they dont have it, the librarys database will tell you where to find it.
Name: Book 16

text: Periodicals from all over the world are stored in PDF files and on microfiche ready to be perused.
Name: Book 16

text: You can even find archived and historical records without making an extra trip to city hall.
Name: Book 16

text: That is why the central library on Fifth Avenue and 40th Street is one of my first stops whenever I start working on a case.
Name: Book 16

text: This will be the best place to learn a little background on Jack Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Like many of the rich and famous, Meredith has an autobiography.
Name: Book 16

text: There are also numerous newspaper articles and exerts from magazines to read.
Name: Book 16

text: It only takes two hours and a small fortune to copy it all.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes longer to sift through all the information and organize it.
Name: Book 16

text: I could have done this at home but the time I spend now will save me a trip back here.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me a chance to make sure I have everything I need.
Name: Book 16

text: On the way home, I stop and grab some Chinese take out.
Name: Book 16

text: I could have had it delivered but once I get started on this, I dont want any interruptions.
Name: Book 16

text: When I finally get home, I turn on my CD player before sitting down on my futon.
Name: Book 16

text: Smooth jazz fills the studio apartment helping me focus on the puzzle that is Jack Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: A lot of it is stuff I already knew, others I had assumed.
Name: Book 16

text: My first assessment is that the man is part magician, part tactician, and part ruthless business man.
Name: Book 16

text: All of the press he has gotten has been good despite the rumors of misconduct and wrongdoing that hover around his business dealings like flies on a rotting corpse.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith seems to have mastered the art of letting people see what he wants them to see while hiding the ugly truth behind smoke and mirrors.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem with being a magician is that you always have something to hide.
Name: Book 16

text: If youre not careful, someone might see past your illusions.
Name: Book 16

text: Nothing leaps out at me during my first pass through the information.
Name: Book 16

text: There are no hidden messages or codes like The duck is on the pond but things fit together too easily for my liking.
Name: Book 16

text: Its too neat and hints at something more.
Name: Book 16

text: The articles and book seem designed to craft an image.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith appears to be a philanthropist interested in giving back some of his riches to the community.
Name: Book 16

text: This facade doesnt fool anyone with half a brain.
Name: Book 16

text: It wasnt meant to.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyone who digs a little deeper would see the same thing I see now; a money grubbing real estate tycoon.
Name: Book 16

text: Many would be satisfied and stop digging but I know there is something more.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith wants people to see that part of him.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not all that he is.
Name: Book 16

text: I caught a glimpse of the real Jack Meredith when he cast his first spell on me.
Name: Book 16

text: Here is a man who is all about power.
Name: Book 16

text: I could see it clearly in his eyes.
Name: Book 16

text: Its his hobby, his passion, his addiction and he is willing to do whatever it takes to achieve his ends.
Name: Book 16

text: There are business rivals and enemies who suddenly decided to retire or just disappear.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not hard to imagine him sending his ex-bodyguard to make deal with his more troublesome opposition for him while he hides safe behind the mask of a philanthropist.
Name: Book 16

text: Every calculated act of charity and compassion is designed to reap some benefit.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe thats why he gravitated toward business, where such characteristics are more times than not, an asset, and then finally to magic.
Name: Book 16

text: That raises other questions.
Name: Book 16

text: What kind of sorcerer is he.
Name: Book 16

text: When did he learn magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Where did he learn it.
Name: Book 16

text: Nothing here will answer those questions but there might be a clue to point me in the right direction.
Name: Book 16

text: I shift my attention from the news and magazine articles to his autobiography, Survival of the Fittest.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives a sanitized account of his life and how he managed to survive in the dog eat dog world of real estate, reinforcing my opinion of him.
Name: Book 16

text: There isnt much here.
Name: Book 16

text: One tidbit raises my suspicions.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths teenage years are only mentioned in passing.
Name: Book 16

text: The rest of the book rambles on about all of Merediths accomplishments but there is nothing in his book about those years where he did well enough in school to get into Dartmouth.
Name: Book 16

text: Was this when he learned about magic.
Name: Book 16

text: I dig a little deeper and find what could be a clue.
Name: Book 16

text: In his sophomore year, he transferred mid-term from Fordham Prep to an exclusive boarding school in Massachusetts.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont need to be a detective to know something happened, something conveniently edited out of his life story.
Name: Book 16

text: This is part of what hes hiding.
Name: Book 16

text: It will take more digging to find out what it is, but its a start.
Name: Book 16

text: The rest of the information I have concerns his holdings, at least the ones known to the general public.
Name: Book 16

text: All of them, I remember from his brief television interview, except one.
Name: Book 16

text: The building is on 168th Street in the Bronx, well away from his other projects.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown, filing away the location in my memory.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill check this out after I see Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: Most likely, it is nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: My instincts tell me otherwise.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the only property that he isnt developing into a condo.
Name: Book 16

text: There has to be a reason for that.
Name: Book 16

text: I stretch and yawn.
Name: Book 16

text: Today has been productive but I find myself wishing for Karas comforting presence.
Name: Book 16

text: Its strange for her to be gone for so long without a word.
Name: Book 16

text: I know she cant be with me every minute of the day.
Name: Book 16

text: She has a life of her own, one I am getting more and more curious about.
Name: Book 16

text: I just hope shes all right.
Name: Book 16

text: My dream of Kara and room service in a five star hotel is rudely interrupted.
Name: Book 16

text: The scene changes and spins out of control.
Name: Book 16

text: The fantasy breaks apart under the stress, but I dont wake up.
Name: Book 16

text: It is replaced by another far less pleasant dream.
Name: Book 16

text: I find myself standing in Tompkins Square Park, near the dog run.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks exactly like the original except things are a bit too perfect, a bit too clean.
Name: Book 16

text: This is all a cover for something dark and twisted.
Name: Book 16

text: It lurks just out of sight, ready to swoop down on me.
Name: Book 16

text: More smoke and mirrors for the man sitting on the park bench feeding the pigeons.
Name: Book 16

text: I say his name as if it were a curse.
Name: Book 16

text: He looks up at me with his perfect smile, though I imagine it is not so perfect in the waking world.
Name: Book 16

text: He acts like he is in complete control of the situation.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure he isnt.
Name: Book 16

text: Just how much power does this bastard have.
Name: Book 16

text: No one wastes this kind of time, effort and energy on a dream sending.
Name: Book 16

text: Not when it so easy to communicate.
Name: Book 16

text: Why use a complex time consuming and exhausting spell when you can pick up a phone and call someone, or better yet set up a video conference.
Name: Book 16

text: Even Scott with his eccentricities regarding phones usually doesnt indulge himself like this.
Name: Book 16

text: Albritton, he says, trying to sound friendly.
Name: Book 16

text: He hasnt forgotten what I did and Im glad.
Name: Book 16

text: If he were here in the flesh, I would knock out a few more teeth for his trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: We have unfinished business, you and I.
Name: Book 16

text: His laugh, not the one he uses at award banquets hints at what I have already knew.
Name: Book 16

text: Not crazy like Hagan or even me but totally nuts.
Name: Book 16

text: You have cost me.
Name: Book 16

text: If I had known how much you would try me, I would have put you down years ago.
Name: Book 16

text: You will give me the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown at this.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes still not making sense.
Name: Book 16

text: I have no idea what the hell he is talking about and there is no use getting him to enlighten me.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats not the purpose of this visit.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a warning and a threat.
Name: Book 16

text: He is already fading away, leaving me alone in the park among the pigeons that now stare at me expectantly.
Name: Book 16

text: They look very hungry, ready to swarm all over me in a scene from a Hitchcock movie.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats when I hear Merediths voice on the wind.
Name: Book 16

text: This is what awaits you at the end of the Longest Road.
Name: Book 16

text: A moment later, something snakes around my neck, too fast for me to avoid, but slow enough for me to get my fingers in the way.
Name: Book 16

text: The silken cord tightens, choking the life out of me.
Name: Book 16

text: I struggle and fight, knowing I cant win.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no escape from this.
Name: Book 16

text: I bolt awake in my futon gasping for air.
Name: Book 16

text: My heart beats like it wants to pop out of my chest like an alien horror in some B movie.
Name: Book 16

text: I am unharmed but there is no way Ill be able to get back to sleep again.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want to.
Name: Book 16

text: The only thing I want to do is to kill Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: The name on the lease and books is Upper West Side Karate, but everyone just calls it The Dojo.
Name: Book 16

text: That name invoked the true feel of the place and a warm feeling in the hearts of all those who trained there.
Name: Book 16

text: The other name was just the one we used when we wrote checks to cover our tuition.
Name: Book 16

text: For me, it is my second home, the place I could always go to when I needed to get away from it all.
Name: Book 16

text: This was one of those times.
Name: Book 16

text: Shihan, my teachers title as well as the name all the students referred to him by with affection, had been a world champion.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, he was content to teach, passing along all he had learned to his eager students.
Name: Book 16

text: I remember when I first thought about training here, before Kara stepped back into my life again.
Name: Book 16

text: One of my friends suggested I watch a few classes and see if this was for me.
Name: Book 16

text: As luck would have it, the first class I saw was the advanced fighting class held every Friday night.
Name: Book 16

text: In the tiny confines of this dojo, I saw something special.
Name: Book 16

text: It was one of the most intense things I had ever witnessed.
Name: Book 16

text: Black, brown, green and even a few yellow belts fought their private wars.
Name: Book 16

text: On the surface it looked like no one was taking any prisoners.
Name: Book 16

text: If you looked deeper you could tell something else was going on.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite the violence and brutality, there was also an element of control, respect, and above all friendship.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though there were a few injuries, no one was actually trying to hurt, kill or maim anyone.
Name: Book 16

text: These people were brothers and sisters, each here to perfect their art and in a way themselves through this trial by fire.
Name: Book 16

text: When it was all over, there were no hard feelings.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone shook hands and bowed.
Name: Book 16

text: After class, some continued to train while others went out on the town together.
Name: Book 16

text: That night, I said to myself, this is something I want to be a part of.
Name: Book 16

text: Fifteen years later, I havent regretted my decision.
Name: Book 16

text: Shihan didnt just teach his students how to kick and punch.
Name: Book 16

text: That was the easy part.
Name: Book 16

text: You could learn that anywhere.
Name: Book 16

text: No, he saw it as his responsibility to give his students something more.
Name: Book 16

text: He taught the harder lessons, giving each of his students the tools they needed to make themselves better in and out of class.
Name: Book 16

text: For some, this was a sense of discipline and control, while others found direction and purpose, but the one thing everyone learned was responsibility.
Name: Book 16

text: Under his guidance, my natural gifts were refined and developed.
Name: Book 16

text: My mind developed far more than my body.
Name: Book 16

text: It was sharpened to a razor edge, allowing me to think clearly in a crisis.
Name: Book 16

text: I made up for what I lacked in raw power with skill and trickery.
Name: Book 16

text: After the dream sending, I feel the need to do something physical.
Name: Book 16

text: I have enough time for a workout in the dojo before Nerva comes to pick me up.
Name: Book 16

text: As expected, my knee starts to hurt the more I use it.
Name: Book 16

text: The short walk and climb up to the third floor where the dojo is located is an exercise in masochism.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of taking a formal class, I work on my kata.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesnt stop Shihan from glancing my way from time to time to give me instructions and helpful advice.
Name: Book 16

text: The katas name I am practicing translates loosely as "Breaking Down the Large Fortress" though the only thing breaking is my concentration.
Name: Book 16

text: Emotion clouds my vision as I struggle through the movements.
Name: Book 16

text: Im lucky the ogre didnt shatter my kneecap.
Name: Book 16

text: Though the more I practice, the more I realize the damage is pretty extensive.
Name: Book 16

text: When this is all over, I will have to get my knee looked at.
Name: Book 16

text: Until then, Im going to have to deal with the pain.
Name: Book 16

text: I switch to the heavy bag for a while, venting my anger and frustration.
Name: Book 16

text: This is insane, a nightmare.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is willing to hurt and kill me, for what.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, just maybe, I would feel better if I knew what he wanted the Bloodstone for.
Name: Book 16

text: Somehow, I doubt it.
Name: Book 16

text: I picture Merediths smug expression as I slam my fist into the bag again.
Name: Book 16

text: Im angry at him as well as myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone got hurt, maybe killed, and I am partly to blame for it.
Name: Book 16

text: Add to that, Karas continued absence has me frustrated and worried.
Name: Book 16

text: She still hasnt come back and its been over a day.
Name: Book 16

text: Something is bothering her.
Name: Book 16

text: Does it have to do with what Meredith said.
Name: Book 16

text: What is she hiding from me.
Name: Book 16

text: There are too many questions that need to be answered.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite the furious combination I unleash on the heavy bag, the answers arent to be found here.
Name: Book 16

text: That is why I need to see Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: I hope he has some answers for me.
Name: Book 16

text: I shower and change, ready for my meeting with Sol.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva is waiting for me downstairs.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not hard for her to make the tight jeans and white t-shirt look sexy.
Name: Book 16

text: Sporting the casual look today, I say with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: She takes a moment to stick out her tongue at me before getting into her car.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no hiding my limp as I get into the passenger seat.
Name: Book 16

text: And you should take it easy in class.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont tell her about Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: There will be time for that later.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill be more careful.
Name: Book 16

text: With that said, we hit the road.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva drives a powder blue 76 Buick Skylark.
Name: Book 16

text: The car is a classic.
Name: Book 16

text: Its built like a tank compared to the other cars on the road, while still handling like a dream.
Name: Book 16

text: Her rides sound system, to put it bluntly, is kick ass.
Name: Book 16

text: It pumps out hits from groups and artists Im unfamiliar with.
Name: Book 16

text: She drives like she dances, seemingly wild and carefree but shes takes her entertainment and driving seriously.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know where she is taking be but I can tell Nerva is taking the scenic route.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I said it was important, her enjoyment comes first.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, it doesnt take long to reach our destination.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive been to Solomons library before.
Name: Book 16

text: Each time, it is someplace different.
Name: Book 16

text: This time its in Flushing above the T-Bone Bar and Grill.
Name: Book 16

text: As I get out of the car, Nerva steals a kiss, one that would make Kara angry if she were here.
Name: Book 16

text: Remember, you owe me.
Name: Book 16

text: Sols library is more magical than most.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though he has moved it a dozen times that I know of, it still has the same look and feel.
Name: Book 16

text: It is Sols work of art, a labor of love and his most prized possession.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only did he have an immense collection of magical tomes, his library also included books on the arts, sciences, history, philosophy, poetry, and fiction.
Name: Book 16

text: Each book, scroll and tablet in his collection is somehow protected from the ravages of time.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol stands next to his poor overworked wooden desk.
Name: Book 16

text: Unlike the sturdy bookshelves lining the walls which house his collection, the desk looks like it is on the verge of collapse.
Name: Book 16

text: It is piled high with stacks of papers and books Sol is in the midst of studying.
Name: Book 16

text: His chair is equally overworked.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol isnt a small man, not big like Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: Picture a beardless Santa Claus with black silver streaked hair and you come close to what Sol looks like.
Name: Book 16

text: Not quite so large but you get the idea.
Name: Book 16

text: As always, he dresses for comfort.
Name: Book 16

text: Today is no exception.
Name: Book 16

text: The grey sweats he wears have seen better days.
Name: Book 16

text: The remains of his gourmet lunch could be seen on his shirt, but it did not stop him from sounding any less imperious.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, he is glad to see me.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though Sol makes it difficult for people to see him, the man likes company.
Name: Book 16

text: As he puts it, no one would waste their time jumping through his hoops if they didnt need or truly want to see him.
Name: Book 16

text: No one could just drop by for the hell of it or because they happened to be in the neighborhood.
Name: Book 16

text: This gives Sol more time to do what he likes doing best, reading and enjoying the finer things in life.
Name: Book 16

text: Albritton, Im disappointed in you, He gestures to one of the reading chairs.
Name: Book 16

text: I would have come to you if I knew you were hurt.
Name: Book 16

text: And here I am apologizing for not inconveniencing him.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sorry but I have a big problem and not a lot of time.
Name: Book 16

text: A raise of one eyebrow is Sols only reaction.
Name: Book 16

text: Its seldom I actually need to use his library or pick his brain for information.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a sorcerer or anything like that.
Name: Book 16

text: If I were, this would be the perfect place to research little known spells and incantations.
Name: Book 16

text: I usually visit Sol to chew the fat with him or listen to one of his stories about the good ole days.
Name: Book 16

text: Other times, he invites me here to discuss doing some work for him.
Name: Book 16

text: Only on the most difficult cases will I drop by to talk shop or find out about some esoteric fact you probably couldnt find elsewhere.
Name: Book 16

text: I reach into my pocket and pull out the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: I try to ignore the way the ring feels in my hand.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not as bad as last night.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe I have gotten used to it but the feeling is bad enough.
Name: Book 16

text: Its about this, I say as I give Sol a good look at the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: His eyes widen in alarm and instinctively, he takes a step back, nearly upsetting the books on his desk.
Name: Book 16

text: What the hell have you done.
Name: Book 16

text: You fool, youve killed us all.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what I was expecting him to say but that wasnt it.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes, Sol likes to joke and use old clichs.
Name: Book 16

text: He also has a tendency to exaggerate.
Name: Book 16

text: This time he is serious.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone named Meredith did it.
Name: Book 16

text: Sols hand moves swift and sure in what could be a sign of protection.
Name: Book 16

text: If Meredith were here, I am sure Sol would have more than a few words for him after he throttled the life out of him.
Name: Book 16

text: Usually, you cant speak to someone after theyre dead.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol is one of few who know the steps necessary to do so.
Name: Book 16

text: With a scowl, he says, It shouldnt surprise me that another of my esteemed colleagues lacks a sense of self-preservation.
Name: Book 16

text: Let me guess, he said something about the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, he did, Sol knows all about the break-in at Scotts house but not the details.
Name: Book 16

text: If he didnt find out from the news or Nerva, he would have heard it through the grapevine.
Name: Book 16

text: He keeps track of that sort of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Some might call him paranoid, but he prefers the term hyper-vigilant.
Name: Book 16

text: It is why he keeps moving his library and dwelling.
Name: Book 16

text: I add the detail he is probably missing.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith was the one behind the break-in at Scotts.
Name: Book 16

text: Then he is even more the fool, but a dangerous fool nonetheless.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol pauses a moment, motioning me to put away the ring before continuing.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes a certain degree of power, skill and insanity to delve into the First Magics.
Name: Book 16

text: If he thinks it is bad then there has to be a good reason for it.
Name: Book 16

text: Odds are Sol tried to study it in the past and learned the hard way how dangerous they can be.
Name: Book 16

text: This brings up another question.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol, Im not exactly a new kid on the block, but this is the first time Ive ever heard of this stuff.
Name: Book 16

text: Want to enlighten me.
Name: Book 16

text: Sols smile returns now that the ring is out of sight.
Name: Book 16

text: With it, so does some of his good humor.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes o seeker of knowledge.
Name: Book 16

text: The First Magics, as many of us in the trade call them, are the magic of the Dragons and their enemies the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: You've never heard about them because the few of us who know about the First Magics discourage others from studying them.
Name: Book 16

text: We go out of our way to keep it a secret.
Name: Book 16

text: I look at Sol and wonder just how many people he has discouraged.
Name: Book 16

text: He likes to use euphemisms when talking about something unpleasant, especially when it involves violence or anything he might be prosecuted for in a court of law.
Name: Book 16

text: They are uniquely dangerous.
Name: Book 16

text: So dangerous that we try and confiscate anything related to them.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, every once in a while someone stumbles upon a way to tap their power.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is that there are usually spectacular consequences for doing so.
Name: Book 16

text: Tunguska is a good example of that.
Name: Book 16

text: I see, And I do, all too clearly.
Name: Book 16

text: Like Sol said, you would have to be a fool to mess with something that dangerous.
Name: Book 16

text: No one knows what caused the Tunguska event in 1908.
Name: Book 16

text: Some scientists theorize it could have been anything from an asteroid or comet air bursting above Siberia to a micro black hole opening up.
Name: Book 16

text: There are even wilder theories.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like Sol has his own ideas about what happened.
Name: Book 16

text: No matter what you think caused the event, Tunguska is as a good example of what ground zero at doomsday would look like.
Name: Book 16

text: So we need someone skilled in the use of First Magic or a dragon to defuse this thing.
Name: Book 16

text: The mischievous twinkle that is usually in Sols eyes is replaced by a more calculating look.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes weighing the odds here.
Name: Book 16

text: Dragons and their servants are harder to arrange an appointment with than me.
Name: Book 16

text: To be honest with you, I dont know any personally but there is something we can try.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure whether I am relieved or not.
Name: Book 16

text: For the most part, dragons dont have a very good reputation.
Name: Book 16

text: You can find more stories about a dragon razing the countryside and eating young maidens than you can stories where they act as protectors and guardians.
Name: Book 16

text: One thing all the stories have in common is that they are all extremely powerful and prefer not to be disturbed.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol walks over to one of the bookshelves.
Name: Book 16

text: He quickly finds the tome he is looking for.
Name: Book 16

text: Its old, nothing more than a collection of dried parchment tied together with a string.
Name: Book 16

text: He sets it down with care on a nearby table, his fingers spreading out the pages gingerly.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive deciphered a few pages from this collection.
Name: Book 16

text: It has a drawing of the ring youre carrying.
Name: Book 16

text: Take a look at this page and tell me if you can make anything out of it.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, looking down at the page.
Name: Book 16

text: There are no words, just tiny lines and scratches among pictures and diagrams.
Name: Book 16

text: All of it written in a reddish brown liquid whose origins I try not to think about.
Name: Book 16

text: I shouldnt be able to understand any of this, but slowly, the chicken scratch starts to make sense.
Name: Book 16

text: Its still a jumbled mess in my mind, too much for me to truly understand without more time, time which is in short supply, but there is one thing is painfully apparent.
Name: Book 16

text: If I read this right, were screwed.
Name: Book 16

text: Sol leaves me alone to call Dorward while I see if I can make any more sense out of the parchment.
Name: Book 16

text: It poses as many questions as it answers.
Name: Book 16

text: At least we learned something new about my little talent.
Name: Book 16

text: Its connected to the First Magics.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats why I am able to read the parchment without years of study.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, being able to read it is a far cry from understanding what I am reading.
Name: Book 16

text: Some concepts dont translate into words.
Name: Book 16

text: The little I do understand doesnt cheer me up.
Name: Book 16

text: My connection to the First Magics makes it possible for me to attune myself to Bloodstone and use its powers safely, whatever they are.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, the parchment doesnt state how to go about attuning myself to the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I could try to use the Bloodstone without attuning myself to it but I run the risk of nuking myself and everyone around me.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be like trying to disarm a bomb with sledgehammer.
Name: Book 16

text: The only other person we know who might be able to use the Bloodstone safely is Meredith, and the Lord only knows what he would use it for.
Name: Book 16

text: I already know what Scott will say when Sol gives him the news.
Name: Book 16

text: Well then put him on a plane to Antarctica and well hope for the best, Yeah, it sounds cold and heartless.
Name: Book 16

text: It is but thats the sort of person Scott can be.
Name: Book 16

text: If its a choice between lots of dead people and one person then the poor sap is going to lose.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant really blame him, but I can be a little bitter about this and the fact that I would let him put me on that plane before I let the ring do something spectacularly bad in a place like New York.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, there has to be a way out of this, something Im missing.
Name: Book 16

text: I just need some time to figure this out before push comes to shove.
Name: Book 16

text: Luckily, Sol and the rest are willing to take a chance and trust me enough to make the call without forcing the issue.
Name: Book 16

text: Something about Meredith and the ring doesnt fit.
Name: Book 16

text: From what Ive seen of him thus far, the usual rules dont seem to apply to him and that worries me.
Name: Book 16

text: His spells are too fast, too powerful and cast without effort or energy which puts me at a disadvantage, despite my own talents.
Name: Book 16

text: There is also the matter of all the energy he has poured into the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: Where is he getting it from.
Name: Book 16

text: The more and more I think about it, I decide the answers are in the Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: I put aside the parchment.
Name: Book 16

text: Staring at the thing is beginning to give me a headache, and headaches dont help me think.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats when I feel Karas thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: And I can tell she actually is.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt come across as empty words.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldnt think of a way to tell you.
Name: Book 16

text: Its all right.
Name: Book 16

text: The silence is comfortable and welcome, just having her here is enough for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its always like this after weve been apart for even a little while.
Name: Book 16

text: This time, Im first to break the mood.
Name: Book 16

text: If Im to get out of this, I need answers.
Name: Book 16

text: I can sense her nodding, waiting.
Name: Book 16

text: Tell me about the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: A sense of barely suppressed revulsion and horror jumps across the link.
Name: Book 16

text: The images are raw and ugly, far from the beauty Ive come to associate with Karas thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: When she regains her composure, her voice is strained.
Name: Book 16

text: Y   ouve encountered demons in the past.
Name: Book 16

text: You know what they are like.
Name: Book 16

text: My last encounter with a demon left me with an ardent desire to steer clear of them or anything remotely resembling demonic possession.
Name: Book 16

text: I still have nightmares about that case.
Name: Book 16

text: There are all sorts of spirits and Ive dealt with more than my fair share of them.
Name: Book 16

text: Demons are the most malevolent and powerful.
Name: Book 16

text: They have no qualms about possessing people.
Name: Book 16

text: Some of the more dangerous ones can inhabit places and even objects.
Name: Book 16

text: Once they have a home, they make life extremely short, painful and miserable for anyone who has the bad luck to stumble across them.
Name: Book 16

text: I leave them to the numerous bible thumpers, exorcists and spiritualists who specialize in dealing with them.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seven are far more powerful.
Name: Book 16

text: They are like spirits but they arent from the spirit world, they originate from this one.
Name: Book 16

text: That means they cant be exorcised or banished.
Name: Book 16

text: Long ago, they fought the Dragons and the First Magics were used to defeat them.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seven were bound tight in a dreamless sleep, but if someone were to awaken them.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no need for her to finish the thought.
Name: Book 16

text: I have a vivid imagination.
Name: Book 16

text: It comes in handy in this sort of lifestyle.
Name: Book 16

text: Right now, I wish it wasnt quite so vivid.
Name: Book 16

text: The picture Kara has painted doesnt leave any doubt in my mind about how bad things will get if the Seven are awakened.
Name: Book 16

text: They are dangerous on a scale Im not comfortable thinking about.
Name: Book 16

text: Demons revel in spreading fear, madness and corruption.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be hell on Earth if enough demons were let loose and these Seven sound far worse.
Name: Book 16

text: There would be no easy way to get rid of them.
Name: Book 16

text: No matter what, someone is going to have to discourage Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: My little trick is related to the First Magics, right.
Name: Book 16

text: Another nod as she murmurs softly,    Its not a trick but yes.
Name: Book 16

text: Your connection to the First Magics makes it difficult for all lesser magics to affect you.
Name: Book 16

text: This connection lets you understand the parchment.
Name: Book 16

text: It is also how our link works.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have to think my next question for Kara to know what it is.
Name: Book 16

text: Some are born with the power, others can learn it and in some rare cases the ability is given as a gift.
Name: Book 16

text: The dragon you saw, she is the one who gave you your gift.
Name: Book 16

text: On some level, I had always known my little talent was a gift.
Name: Book 16

text: People just dont pick up magical abilities or weird talents.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is leaving something out, as if she is unsure or unable to say it.
Name: Book 16

text: I let her off the hook.
Name: Book 16

text: Can you tell me how to attune myself to the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: Her reply is sad, as if she were a doctor telling me I have a terminal case of cancer.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, but it obeys the laws of time and effort.
Name: Book 16

text: Given time, you could do it but that would take weeks.
Name: Book 16

text: You could learn to do so sooner but with great effort and risk.
Name: Book 16

text: In other words, I dont have enough time to learn how to use the ring unless I want to try something suicidal.
Name: Book 16

text: So, how much time do I have, doc.
Name: Book 16

text: You have until the end of next week.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith shouldnt be able to tamper with the Bloodstone again as long as you keep your guard up.
Name: Book 16

text: I realize how hard this must be for her, hard enough that I have to give her a little hope.
Name: Book 16

text: Two weeks isnt much time but it is better than nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: So we have some time to figure something out.
Name: Book 16

text: We have a chance,    I say, meaning it.
Name: Book 16

text: I just hope we come up with something before I take what will probably be a one way trip to the boondocks.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the next day when I leave Solomons library.
Name: Book 16

text: I think Im the only person he has ever allowed to crash there, besides Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of going home, I take the number 5 train into the Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: My destination is only a few blocks away from where I grew up.
Name: Book 16

text: A lot has changed for the better.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths property is the exception to the rule.
Name: Book 16

text: It stands there as a monument to a past best forgotten.
Name: Book 16

text: I look at the building and frown.
Name: Book 16

text: Something is not right here.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara can feel it too.
Name: Book 16

text: The South Bronx is in the midst of a minor renaissance.
Name: Book 16

text: Real estate is at a premium.
Name: Book 16

text: The abandoned buildings and junkyards of yesteryear are a thing of the past.
Name: Book 16

text: New housing is rising from the ashes.
Name: Book 16

text: The slums have given way to the promise of a better tomorrow, everywhere but here.
Name: Book 16

text: What made 168th Street and Forest Avenue different.
Name: Book 16

text: Why would Meredith let this building sit and rot.
Name: Book 16

text: With only with a little work, he could make a killing here.
Name: Book 16

text: On the surface, everything looked normal.
Name: Book 16

text: The front of the building was old and run down, a shadow of its former glory.
Name: Book 16

text: Wooden boards were nailed over the windows and doors.
Name: Book 16

text: Granted, the neighborhood could be better.
Name: Book 16

text: It could be closer to the subway, but that wasn't a reason to let good real estate go to waste.
Name: Book 16

text: Its one of those buildings,    Kara says, and shes right.
Name: Book 16

text: If youre not looking for them, you can miss the little clues and details that act as a warning.
Name: Book 16

text: The building was free of the graffiti and posters that decorate most other abandoned buildings and construction sites.
Name: Book 16

text: In this day and age, people jump at the chance for free advertising or to show off their art, but not here.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone and thing avoided this place.
Name: Book 16

text: Not even a pigeon could be seen roosting on the building.
Name: Book 16

text: People took the extra effort to cross the street instead of walking past the place.
Name: Book 16

text: The more and more I see, the less and less I like this set up.
Name: Book 16

text: This is one of those buildings.
Name: Book 16

text: What do I mean by that.
Name: Book 16

text: You ever wonder why some buildings, no matter how many housing violations they have, are never condemned.
Name: Book 16

text: Meanwhile other buildings are closed for seemingly trivial matters.
Name: Book 16

text: I used to chalk it up to bribery, corruption, incompetence, or the warped thinking of bureaucrats, but there was a much simpler reason I learned when I started working as a paranormal investigator.
Name: Book 16

text: This may sound old and tired.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesn't stop it from being another one of those universal truths that pop up in my line of work.
Name: Book 16

text: There are things that shouldn't be disturbed.
Name: Book 16

text: There are people who shouldn't be bothered.
Name: Book 16

text: There are places that shouldn't be entered.
Name: Book 16

text: That's the way things are.
Name: Book 16

text: That's the way they have always been.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone knows it, even if it's only on a subconscious level.
Name: Book 16

text: Some choose to ignore their gut feelings, especially those who have more greed than they do common sense.
Name: Book 16

text: Real estate agents and developers are notorious for this.
Name: Book 16

text: This building is one of those places.
Name: Book 16

text: I know it, Kara knows it and so does Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: It was abandoned but not for any mundane reason.
Name: Book 16

text: That's why he brought the place.
Name: Book 16

text: That is why he is content not to have any work done on it.
Name: Book 16

text: Okay, so what am I dealing with.
Name: Book 16

text: I could check it out now in the light of day, but too much can go wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: Rushing headlong into the unknown is a good way to end a career, especially with someone like Meredith in the mix.
Name: Book 16

text: I opt for the safer course of action.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill come back later after I make a few preparations.
Name: Book 16

text: It might be more dangerous to explore the place at night but it will still be safer than going in blind.
Name: Book 16

text: Also, there will be fewer potential witnesses.
Name: Book 16

text: I like to travel light.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a good habit I picked up in my youth.
Name: Book 16

text: I find it easier to move around when Im not loaded down with a lot of excess baggage, especially if I need to move fast.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale
Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Ordinarily, I would bring a few more items with me, but Im trespassing and have a strong aversion to jail.
Name: Book 16

text: The canvas messenger bag is just big enough to hold everything I need and small enough to stay out of my way.
Name: Book 16

text: If I was actually on a case and doing this legally, I would have a floor plan of the building.
Name: Book 16

text: I wouldnt have to worry about breaking in.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, I look for the best way to do this.
Name: Book 16

text: As I hoped, I dont have to worry about witnesses.
Name: Book 16

text: The criminal element is smarter than me.
Name: Book 16

text: They steer clear of this block.
Name: Book 16

text: At eleven pm, the street is deserted.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone even took the liberty to shatter all of the street lights, casting the block into shadows.
Name: Book 16

text: I am alone here and the vibe coming from the building reinforces my belief.
Name: Book 16

text: I make a quick circuit of the building.
Name: Book 16

text: Despite the lack of work done on the place, it looks quite secure.
Name: Book 16

text: The wooden boards covering the ground floor windows have been replaced recently.
Name: Book 16

text: The front, back, and basement doors sport brand new padlocks on them.
Name: Book 16

text: I wont be going in through one of the doors.
Name: Book 16

text: Picking locks is not one of the skills I have mastered.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara cant sense any magic or spirits from outside the building, just the same sense of uneasiness I feel.
Name: Book 16

text: I still dont know what I might be facing in there.
Name: Book 16

text: Is it worth going in there.
Name: Book 16

text: You shouldnt be doing this by yourself, Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: She is probably right.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont bother answering her with words.
Name: Book 16

text: I just try to reassure her with my confidence.
Name: Book 16

text: This is important, I just know it.
Name: Book 16

text: I would lose time if I tried to get Hagan or one of my other friends to help me.
Name: Book 16

text: Time is something I dont have.
Name: Book 16

text: The left side of the building looks promising.
Name: Book 16

text: There are no doors but a fire escape ladder is within easy reach.
Name: Book 16

text: I reach into my bag and pull on my black gloves.
Name: Book 16

text: They are made for climbing and handling sharp objects.
Name: Book 16

text: No need to risk cutting myself on a rusty piece of metal or getting a splinter.
Name: Book 16

text: I have enough problems with my knee.
Name: Book 16

text: A quick climb and I am through a second floor window.
Name: Book 16

text: My knee only murmurs in discontent once I am inside.
Name: Book 16

text: The living room is empty of furniture, cleaned out long ago.
Name: Book 16

text: It is dark and empty except for that cold and humid abandoned building smell.
Name: Book 16

text: The glow stick I pull out and drop next to the door marks the apartment in case I need to get out of here in a hurry.
Name: Book 16

text: I check my bag, eyeing the rest of my equipment: a filtered mask, a small crowbar and eleven more glow sticks are all that remain after I pull out the flashlight.
Name: Book 16

text: Its illumination does little to pierce the gloom as I move deeper into the building.
Name: Book 16

text: I have to be careful of my footing since I didnt bring a rope or safety harness.
Name: Book 16

text: I also left my hard hat behind.
Name: Book 16

text: Most of the metal has been stripped from the building for scrap.
Name: Book 16

text: Gaping holes can be seen where radiators and pipes are missing.
Name: Book 16

text: A misstep might result in a sprained ankle or broken leg, neither of which would be good.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I have my cell phone with me, I would rather not have to use it.
Name: Book 16

text: There would be a lot of questions, questions that arent easily answered.
Name: Book 16

text: There are no scavengers, human or rodent.
Name: Book 16

text: Another oddity is the lack of trash and debris in the hallway.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes the surroundings even more destitute than they should be.
Name: Book 16

text: The stairs are an accident waiting to happen.
Name: Book 16

text: Some of the steps are missing, making the descent treacherous in the darkness.
Name: Book 16

text: The first floor apartments and lobby are just as barren as the ones upstairs.
Name: Book 16

text: There are no clues as to why this place makes me and Kara feel so uncomfortable.
Name: Book 16

text: The stairs leading down to the basement are particularly dark and uninviting.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though these stairs have been repaired recently, I descend carefully.
Name: Book 16

text: This is the kind of place where bad things happen to people.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometime in the past, part of the basement was walled off.
Name: Book 16

text: Boxes are stacked up haphazardly against the walls, making the large central room seem cluttered.
Name: Book 16

text: The smell and humidity arent as bad down here.
Name: Book 16

text: From somewhere in the darkness, I can hear the sound of something humming, a machine of some sort.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe it is a heater or a dehumidifier on its last legs.
Name: Book 16

text: That means the power is still working.
Name: Book 16

text: What used to be the laundry room is exceptionally disturbing.
Name: Book 16

text: The washers and dryers are long gone but strong ropes have been strung out across the room, presumably for hanging laundry.
Name: Book 16

text: I can see more rope coiled neatly in one gloomy corner of the room before Kara directs my attention to the hooks set in the ceiling at odd intervals.
Name: Book 16

text: What the hell is this place being used for.
Name: Book 16

text: The crowbar finds its way into my hand.
Name: Book 16

text: It does little to ease my mind as I continue my exploration.
Name: Book 16

text: I follow the sound of machinery and find a door through to other side of the walled off area.
Name: Book 16

text: Unlike the rest of the basement, the floor is gone.
Name: Book 16

text: The foundation and natural stone are exposed.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a sense of age and something else.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara whispers,    People have died here.
Name: Book 16

text: Death has a smell all its own.
Name: Book 16

text: It comes in more flavors than ice cream, but it is always unpleasant and never welcome.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no altar or the usual occult trappings, just a feeling to the place.
Name: Book 16

text: This is a place of pain and suffering.
Name: Book 16

text: It is probably Merediths work, but that isnt enough to make this building stand out.
Name: Book 16

text: There is something else, something I cant place a finger on.
Name: Book 16

text: Why would Meredith rip up the floor and dig down to the bare stone foundation.
Name: Book 16

text: I kneel down to touch the stone, feeling the coldness through my gloves.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara screams a warning as something makes contact with me through the stone.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes all of my willpower to jerk my hand away and fight against the mind numbing sensation that grip me.
Name: Book 16

text: I stumble out of the room, desperate to get away from the stone and whatever is in it.
Name: Book 16

text: This is an experience I could have done without.
Name: Book 16

text: I fall to my hands and knees in the supers apartment and decorate the warped wooden floor with the contents of my stomach.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara answers with an unending stream of emotional babble.
Name: Book 16

text: She is thinking and speaking too fast for me to keep up with her.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes a lot to rattle her this badly.
Name: Book 16

text: The only word I catch is Servitor and a sense that it shouldnt be here.
Name: Book 16

text: I wait for her to calm down.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me time to get my guts under control.
Name: Book 16

text: My head is still reeling from the brief moment of contact with whatever that thing was.
Name: Book 16

text: I spit, trying in vain to clear the sour taste from my mouth when I realize I am not alone.
Name: Book 16

text: I move quietly to the door of the apartment and use the peephole to see what is going on.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone has turned on the lights in the main room.
Name: Book 16

text: Even so, I cant see much.
Name: Book 16

text: I can tell there are at least three people moving around.
Name: Book 16

text: For a brief moment, I catch a glimpse of two men.
Name: Book 16

text: They drag a third figure into the room I recently vacated.
Name: Book 16

text: There is the sound of talking, more like orders being given.
Name: Book 16

text: Like an idiot, I slip out of the apartment and into the light.
Name: Book 16

text: This is beyond stupid but I have to see, I have to know.
Name: Book 16

text: I hold my breath not daring to make a sound as I peak into the room.
Name: Book 16

text: There are five men there, one of which I recognize as Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know who the others are but one of them definitely doesnt want to be here.
Name: Book 16

text: He struggles in the grip of two men dressed in what has come to be known as business casual.
Name: Book 16

text: Another man is lighting candles and incense, following Merediths orders to the letter.
Name: Book 16

text: A canvas drop cloth, painted with intricate symbols, has been spread across the dark stone floor.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: I dont recognize any of the symbols, but my eyes hurt just looking at them.
Name: Book 16

text: They remind me of Sols book but worse.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is smart, Ill give him that.
Name: Book 16

text: Most sorcerers make their drawings in charcoal or burning oil.
Name: Book 16

text: This way saved time.
Name: Book 16

text: There was no risk of accidentally rubbing out a line or drawing the pattern wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: It also enabled him to transport it wherever he needed to take it.
Name: Book 16

text: After the last candle is lit, I know whats coming.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt stop me from watching.
Name: Book 16

text: I hope in vain things will turn out differently.
Name: Book 16

text: As Meredith begins to chant, he reaches into his pocket for something.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont understand the words, for that I am grateful especially when he pulls out the length of cord from his pocket.
Name: Book 16

text: As his chant becomes louder, nearing its inevitable conclusion, his helpers force the victim to his knees.
Name: Book 16

text: In one deft motion, Meredith wraps the cord around the hapless mans neck.
Name: Book 16

text: This sort of thing shouldnt be happening, not even in a place like New York.
Name: Book 16

text: You just dont grab people off the street and drag them off to be sacrificed.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn away from the sight and sound, trying to shut it out.
Name: Book 16

text: The memory of another time and place assaults me as the smell of death fills the room once more.
Name: Book 16

text: It was summer time.
Name: Book 16

text: The sun was shining, the pigeons were scavenging for food and the heat was oppressive.
Name: Book 16

text: All in all, it was another fun-filled day in the South Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: I was only a little boy, no older than ten or eleven.
Name: Book 16

text: My cousins and I had decided to use the abandoned lot next to our apartment building for our playground.
Name: Book 16

text: Each of us was a hero in our own right but together we were unstoppable.
Name: Book 16

text: Our adventures were larger than life.
Name: Book 16

text: It was a good time.
Name: Book 16

text: The temperature rose and my cousins went to cool off in the spray from a fire hydrant.
Name: Book 16

text: I sought out adventure on my own.
Name: Book 16

text: There behind our apartment building, I saw her.
Name: Book 16

text: She shouldnt have been in a neighborhood like this.
Name: Book 16

text: She looked like a princess and she was in need of a hero.
Name: Book 16

text: The boy who had punched her was older and bigger than me.
Name: Book 16

text: That didnt stop me from racing to the rescue.
Name: Book 16

text: Even back then, I was something of a fighter.
Name: Book 16

text: I put fear into the neighborhood toughs and bullies who thought me and my cousins were an easy mark.
Name: Book 16

text: They knew I wasnt afraid to play rough.
Name: Book 16

text: This time I was way out of my league.
Name: Book 16

text: I landed on the boys back as he leaned over the girl, catching him off guard.
Name: Book 16

text: He shook me off and sent me flying.
Name: Book 16

text: When I hit the ground, I couldnt move.
Name: Book 16

text: It felt like something was broken.
Name: Book 16

text: The boy looked down at me and laughed before kicking me hard.
Name: Book 16

text: The only thing I could do was lie there, curled up in a little ball as I tried to breathe.
Name: Book 16

text: Satisfied, he turned away from me and back to the girl.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew he was doing something to her but I didnt know what.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldnt comprehend what he was doing.
Name: Book 16

text: It scared me out of my wits.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew when he was done with whatever he was doing; he was going to kill her then me.
Name: Book 16

text: Somehow, I managed to find the strength to throw myself at his knees.
Name: Book 16

text: I was too weak and too late.
Name: Book 16

text: I wasnt a hero.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldnt save her or myself.
Name: Book 16

text: She was dead, a length of extension cord wrapped around her neck.
Name: Book 16

text: I screamed long and loud.
Name: Book 16

text: It and my struggling didnt stop him from putting his hands around my throat.
Name: Book 16

text: Im back in the basement, standing there unable to move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: When I was a child, I remember being put in the hospital.
Name: Book 16

text: I could never remember how I got there.
Name: Book 16

text: Was this what happened to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Did he try to kill me when I was a boy.
Name: Book 16

text: This is a nightmare.
Name: Book 16

text: The crowbar drops from my nerveless fingers.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara snaps me out of it.
Name: Book 16

text: All eyes look in my direction.
Name: Book 16

text: They dont have a clear view of me but they know someone is here.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn to run.
Name: Book 16

text: I make it to the stairs as the first man runs out into the main room.
Name: Book 16

text: My hand slaps the light switch, plunging the basement into darkness then I am taking the steps two at a time, fleeing this insanity.
Name: Book 16

text: They stumble behind me in the dark as I emerge onto the first floor.
Name: Book 16

text: I am not alone.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a man in the lobby guarding the now open front door.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt see me yet but he has heard the commotion.
Name: Book 16

text: His flashlight begins to traverse in my direction as he yells for me to stop.
Name: Book 16

text: No chance of that happening, especially after what Ive seen.
Name: Book 16

text: If I do that, Ill end up just like the rest of Merediths victims.
Name: Book 16

text: I bolt for the next set of stairs.
Name: Book 16

text: I opt for speed instead of caution.
Name: Book 16

text: I have an edge.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is here to warn me when I am about to make a misstep.
Name: Book 16

text: She saves me from a broken leg.
Name: Book 16

text: Behind me, one of my pursuers isnt so lucky.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, the rest dont waste time to help their friend out.
Name: Book 16

text: They continue the chase.
Name: Book 16

text: I was an idiot to come here.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only did I come alone.
Name: Book 16

text: I also brought the Bloodstone with me.
Name: Book 16

text: In my haste, I almost miss the glow stick marking my exit.
Name: Book 16

text: I duck into the apartment then out the living room window.
Name: Book 16

text: The fire escape shifts with my weight.
Name: Book 16

text: I half fall and jump from the thing before it gives way.
Name: Book 16

text: My knee pays the price when I land.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know how I do it but I manage to rise and limp away before anyone appears in the window.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive bought myself some time.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe its enough to get out of here.
Name: Book 16

text: The subway isnt that close, and at this time of night it will be the first place they will look for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Catching a cab isnt an option and the buses dont run frequently this time of night.
Name: Book 16

text: I have to get away on foot or far enough away so I can call for a cab or catch a train.
Name: Book 16

text: I might have escaped but Im still in big trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: I walk, I dont run.
Name: Book 16

text: Running down the street in the middle of the night in a bad neighborhood is the worst thing you can do.
Name: Book 16

text: It screams out to any opportunist, Mug me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im scared and not afraid to show it.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if I wanted to run, Im not sure my knee would cooperate.
Name: Book 16

text: Its been hurting a lot after my little gymnastics routine, taking every opportunity to remind me of its displeasure.
Name: Book 16

text: I pause to catch my breath in the shadow of a building that has been renovated recently.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt know,    Kara says and I believe her.
Name: Book 16

text: I know she doesnt tell me everything.
Name: Book 16

text: If she knew about this, she would have shared that bit of knowledge with me.
Name: Book 16

text: She knows what it means to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a hell of a thing to be without a chunk of your memory, especially when it concerns an event that changed your life.
Name: Book 16

text: With the bad, there was a lot of good.
Name: Book 16

text: Whoever hurt me is responsible for me meeting Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesnt mean Im going to forgive them for it.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill be fine, I say and she knows Im lying.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not going to be anything close to okay or fine till I deal with whoever killed that girl and tried to kill me.
Name: Book 16

text: They taught me Im not a hero.
Name: Book 16

text: Heroes arent about revenge.
Name: Book 16

text: My goal is in sight.
Name: Book 16

text: The train station is less than a block away.
Name: Book 16

text: This close to the station there are bars, restaurants and convenience stores that are still open.
Name: Book 16

text: There arent a lot of people on the street, too few for me to blend in with if someone was on the lookout for me.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to take it slow and easy.
Name: Book 16

text: With the cutbacks in service, there is only one entrance to the station open at this time of night.
Name: Book 16

text: As usual, there are a couple of people hanging around, probably waiting for someone or looking for the best time to hop the turnstile.
Name: Book 16

text: I detour into a coffee shop when they are joined by a fourth person.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I didnt get a good look at him, I remember him from the basement.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes one of Merediths men.
Name: Book 16

text: I get a booth in the back of the coffee shop, one that gives me a view of the door.
Name: Book 16

text: This night keeps getting better and better.
Name: Book 16

text: I walked the extra distance to avoid this sort of thing and now Im stuck.
Name: Book 16

text: I could probably hang out here and call for a cab, but something tells me I would end up in a limo with Meredith instead of in a car heading for home.
Name: Book 16

text: I pull out my cell phone and turn it on.
Name: Book 16

text: The first person I try is Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: The phone rings for an eternity before I am shunted to his voice mail.
Name: Book 16

text: I know he always keeps his phone on so he must either be distracted or someplace where it is too noisy for him to hear the phone ringing.
Name: Book 16

text: I try Nerva next and, as expected, her phone is off.
Name: Book 16

text: I go right to voice mail.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont bother leaving a message.
Name: Book 16

text: It wont do me any good unless she checks her messages in the next five minutes and my luck isnt that good.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva checks her voice mail once a year, if at all.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a deep breath and dial Scotts number.
Name: Book 16

text: He picks up after the second ring.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew he would be up, Scott keeps the same sort of hours I do but there is no hello or customary greeting.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, I hope you arent calling my home from a cell phone.
Name: Book 16

text: I wince at the tone, remembering his quirks about phones and cell phones in particular.
Name: Book 16

text: One day when Im not afraid for my life, I will have to ask him about that.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure it will be one hell of a story.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott, Im in trouble here.
Name: Book 16

text: That gets his attention.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about to tell him whats going on without going into the details.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt want to hear it.
Name: Book 16

text: After all I am talking on a cell phone in a public place.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill come get you.
Name: Book 16

text: This wouldnt be happening if you just learned how to drive.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott doesnt give me a chance to reply with a snappy comeback.
Name: Book 16

text: He hangs up the phone.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, I dont drive, not because I cant.
Name: Book 16

text: I just dont like being behind the wheel.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont really need to drive or own a vehicle when you live in a place like New York.
Name: Book 16

text: It usually doesnt cause me any problems but when it does, the problems are big.
Name: Book 16

text: I put it out of my head and signal the waitress.
Name: Book 16

text: Dorward will be here in twenty or thirty minutes tops.
Name: Book 16

text: That gives me enough time to grab some food.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara gives me the bad news after I place my order.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone just cast a tracking spell.
Name: Book 16

text: I almost laugh out loud.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith must have forgotten his earlier attempt to use magic on me or hes getting desperate.
Name: Book 16

text: And I should be worried.
Name: Book 16

text: Its been cast on the ring, not you.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont bother standing up or trying to make it to the door.
Name: Book 16

text: From here, I can see three of Merediths men position themselves just outside the door.
Name: Book 16

text: The fourth is probably around back covering the kitchen exit.
Name: Book 16

text: Thankfully, they dont come in.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me a chance to enjoy the scrambled eggs and bacon I ordered.
Name: Book 16

text: In retrospect, maybe I should have chosen the steak.
Name: Book 16

text: This might actually be my last meal.
Name: Book 16

text: All things considered, Im not in that bad of a position.
Name: Book 16

text: They dont seem willing to drag me out of here in front of witnesses.
Name: Book 16

text: If they wait too long, Scott will be here to get me out of this.
Name: Book 16

text: I try to relax.
Name: Book 16

text: Eating gives me something to do.
Name: Book 16

text: The food is good, not the best but far from the worst.
Name: Book 16

text: The eggs arent too runny and the bacon is just right.
Name: Book 16

text: The meal is ruined by Merediths arrival.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara gives me enough warning so I can look up at him as he enters the coffee shop with one of his men.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not surprised he would come here in person.
Name: Book 16

text: They walk straight towards my booth.
Name: Book 16

text: I have no quips or jokes ready when Meredith slides in across from me.
Name: Book 16

text: I am not in a joking mood, not after what Ive seen tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: His friend slides into the booth next tome.
Name: Book 16

text: I confess, I didnt think we would meet again so soon.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith smiles at me.
Name: Book 16

text: In his mind, this is all a forgone conclusion.
Name: Book 16

text: He might be right.
Name: Book 16

text: You must know far more than I realized.
Name: Book 16

text: You will have to tell me how you found out about my little hobby.
Name: Book 16

text: The man calls ritual sacrifice a hobby.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes the one behind all the bodies that have been turning up in Alphabet City.
Name: Book 16

text: How many has he killed.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont say a word as the waitress comes over and takes away the dishes.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith takes the liberty to order a cup of tea.
Name: Book 16

text: If there is any justice in the world, hell choke on it.
Name: Book 16

text: With the way my luck is going, I will probably end up picking up the tab.
Name: Book 16

text: I debate lunging across the table when I hear the click and hum of a stun gun.
Name: Book 16

text: His new bodyguard must have heard about what I did to Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: All three of us know theres no place for me to dodge or avoid its touch in the booth.
Name: Book 16

text: Its only a matter of time before Meredith asks me to hand him the Bloodstone and step outside.
Name: Book 16

text: Theyll be a car waiting to drive us back to his building.
Name: Book 16

text: Well head downstairs and no one will know whatever happened to Count Albritton.
Name: Book 16

text: Im in no rush to take that trip.
Name: Book 16

text: I remain silent and let Meredith speak while Kara points out what I already know.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott better get here soon,    she says.
Name: Book 16

text: Hopefully, he'll bring help.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not going to lie to you, Albritton.
Name: Book 16

text: You, my friend, are a failure.
Name: Book 16

text: Its ironic that your greatest failure will allow me to succeed in bringing about the next golden age of magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Do you mean one where you get to murder and kill at will.
Name: Book 16

text: He favors me with a patronizing smile.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont understand and he knows it.
Name: Book 16

text: I hope my mind never gets that bent out of shape where I can see the world as Meredith does.
Name: Book 16

text: When the Seven and their servants awaken, it will usher in a new day.
Name: Book 16

text: Even you would welcome it.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe he will talk me to death.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt laugh at my little joke.
Name: Book 16

text: For what its worth, his henchman looks just as confused as I feel.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know whether or not I should be comforted by that.
Name: Book 16

text: Magic and technology have never been balanced.
Name: Book 16

text: One has always been stronger than the other.
Name: Book 16

text: When the Seven awaken, the balance will swing back in favor of magic.
Name: Book 16

text: It will be a return to glory days when magic held dominion.
Name: Book 16

text: I think about the idea and it does sound tempting, but the price is too high.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be like Meredith says.
Name: Book 16

text: There would be a new golden age of magic, a renaissance.
Name: Book 16

text: If Meredith is telling the truth about then technology would lose much of its power.
Name: Book 16

text: That wouldnt have been so bad a millennium or two ago but today, it would amount to the end of the world.
Name: Book 16

text: There would be panic in the streets as things we take for granted just stopped working.
Name: Book 16

text: The death toll would make the various world wars seem like border skirmishes.
Name: Book 16

text: To make matters worse, the Seven would be free to do as they please.
Name: Book 16

text: Who could stop them.
Name: Book 16

text: Only a handful of people can use magic.
Name: Book 16

text: From what Sol tells me, most of those dont know anything about the First Magics.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith takes my stunned silence as encouragement.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew you werent as short-sighted as some of the others.
Name: Book 16

text: You can see the possibilities.
Name: Book 16

text: The world would be free of the technology that is slowly killing it.
Name: Book 16

text: Magical beasts long thought extinct would return.
Name: Book 16

text: There would be a need for heroes again.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, there would be a need for heroes to replace all of the short-sighted individuals, like myself, who will be hunted down like animals.
Name: Book 16

text: We would be the only ones besides the Seven, Meredith and his allies who could use magic.
Name: Book 16

text: For them to have absolute power, we would need to die.
Name: Book 16

text: I was wrong about Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt factor in the possibility that he was a raving madman when I made my original assessment of him.
Name: Book 16

text: I mean I knew he was insane but this is way out in La La land.
Name: Book 16

text: A thousand phrases come to mind.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont say any of them.
Name: Book 16

text: I want to call him insane.
Name: Book 16

text: I want to say he wont get away with this.
Name: Book 16

text: He could do it.
Name: Book 16

text: Whos to stop him.
Name: Book 16

text: One thing, one question must be answered.
Name: Book 16

text: Are you the one who tried to kill me.
Name: Book 16

text: He laughs at me.
Name: Book 16

text: I do a poor job at hiding my anger.
Name: Book 16

text: His bodyguard takes this moment to remind me of his presence.
Name: Book 16

text: The stun gun is close enough to raise the hairs on the back of my neck and arms.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont doubt the mans willingness to use it.
Name: Book 16

text: Is that whats on your mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Excuse me if I dont confess in public, He pauses for a moment, considering me.
Name: Book 16

text: Dying in ignorance is a fitting punishment for you.
Name: Book 16

text: Now Albritton, I want you to give me the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt pipe up with any advice.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt have any.
Name: Book 16

text: We both know Im not about to give him the ring, especially now that I know what is at stake.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell have to kill me first.
Name: Book 16

text: Too bad, Meredith doesnt have a problem with that.
Name: Book 16

text: I am so intent on him and his man I dont notice Scotts arrival until he speaks.
Name: Book 16

text: And why should he give you my property.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew he was coming and I, like Meredith, am still surprised by his sudden appearance.
Name: Book 16

text: He stands there leaning on his silver tipped walking stick, making him seem more like a product of the old world than this day and age.
Name: Book 16

text: The coat he wears reminds me of something from the turn of the century.
Name: Book 16

text: His arrival gives me hope, not just of getting out of here but of stopping this maniac.
Name: Book 16

text: I risk a glance at the door and window where I see his limo.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no sign of Merediths men.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara answers my question before I can ask it.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan isnt here.
Name: Book 16

text: If he is, I cant sense him.
Name: Book 16

text: Ah, Dorward, Its been a long time, Merediths surprise gives way to confidence.
Name: Book 16

text: He slides over to make room for Scott as if he were expecting him.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott declines the invitation with a shake of his head.
Name: Book 16

text: I meant to call you after the break-in.
Name: Book 16

text: I hope you werent hurt.
Name: Book 16

text: If you were familiar with Scott, you could tell just how angry he is.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt raise his voice.
Name: Book 16

text: That would be impolite.
Name: Book 16

text: No, its his eyes that convey his feelings.
Name: Book 16

text: They have nothing but contempt for Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: I am doing tolerably well.
Name: Book 16

text: Far better than the individuals who disturbed my privacy or for that matter the ones who accosted me outside.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone laughs, a chilling sound filled with hate and malice.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes me a moment to realize the laughter came from the innocuous looking walking stick in Scotts hands.
Name: Book 16

text: I press myself deeper into the booth and away from it, not worrying about embarrassing myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith does the same while his bodyguard gets up and heads to the restroom.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont blame him, not one bit.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont let it touch you.
Name: Book 16

text: ever, Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a warning I plan on heeding.
Name: Book 16

text: I also resolve never to ask Scott where he got that thing from and exactly what it does.
Name: Book 16

text: I am sure I wont like the answer.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is about to tell me something else when she hisses a warning.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no fire or lightning, just a sense of tension in the air as Meredith and Scott regard one another.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a contest taking place and I dont want to interfere.
Name: Book 16

text: Seconds go by before Scott finally speaks.
Name: Book 16

text: I think it is time for you to go, before my friend here feels like having desert.
Name: Book 16

text: I know Scott isnt talking about me.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt help my frame of mind.
Name: Book 16

text: This is the first time I ever saw an object look eager.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith appears calm though his hand shakes as he reaches for his tea.
Name: Book 16

text: After taking a sip, he murmurs, It seems that I have underestimated the two of you.
Name: Book 16

text: I will withdraw for the time being.
Name: Book 16

text: Scott nods, stepping aside so Meredith can slip out of the booth.
Name: Book 16

text: As Meredith rises, he places a card on the table.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, its not a credit card, which means I get to foot the bill for his tea.
Name: Book 16

text: I'm about to toss an insult at Meredith when Kara fills me in on what just happened.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith tried to cast a spell and Scott countered it.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont think it was easy for him.
Name: Book 16

text: They seemed evenly matched.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats how most of these things go.
Name: Book 16

text: To most people, it would have looked like nothing more than a heated conversation or a stare down until someone passed out, or in those rare cases died.
Name: Book 16

text: It usually doesnt go that far.
Name: Book 16

text: Most sorcerers who are losing a magical battle will relent before it comes to that.
Name: Book 16

text: Usually, the victor doesnt press the issue.
Name: Book 16

text: Its frowned upon by the community when you do.
Name: Book 16

text: It also means if you are ever losing a fight and your opponent heard about your last battle, you will come away with more than a headache.
Name: Book 16

text: I wonder why Scott didnt use the walking stick.
Name: Book 16

text: Actually, Im glad he didnt.
Name: Book 16

text: I really dont want to see it in action.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith pauses in the doorway to give me the evil eye.
Name: Book 16

text: Albritton, you want answers.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill give them to you in exchange for the ring, He smiles, confident he has found my price.
Name: Book 16

text: You have my card, call me.
Name: Book 16

text: The offer is open for a limited time.
Name: Book 16

text: He leaves before I can hurl a curse his way.
Name: Book 16

text: Damn him and damn me for being tempted to take his offer.
Name: Book 16

text: Scotts limo isnt very big.
Name: Book 16

text: It is only able to fit four passengers in decadent comfort with room for two more people up front with the driver.
Name: Book 16

text: What it lacks in size, it makes up for in style.
Name: Book 16

text: His XCalibre is a classic.
Name: Book 16

text: Its smooth lines and polished chrome bring to mind a different time and place where people were supposedly more genteel.
Name: Book 16
