text: Meditation is also not one of my strong suits.
Name: Book 16

text: Some practice it for health reasons, while others for personal development or religious reasons.
Name: Book 16

text: It usually involves turning your attention and thoughts inward, something I have a lot of practice doing.
Name: Book 16

text: When I try to focus on my breathing or clear my mind, a million little details usually rise up to distract me.
Name: Book 16

text: What I do now is different.
Name: Book 16

text: I close my eyes and take a few deep breaths, falling into a steady rhythm.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of meditating, I focus my thoughts on Kara and the link we share.
Name: Book 16

text: The link is still there and unbroken, a pleasant reminder of just how close the two of us have become over the years.
Name: Book 16

text: I remember the first time I saw her.
Name: Book 16

text: I was in the hospital just after my accident.
Name: Book 16

text: At the time, I didnt know what had happened to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe it was too traumatic for me to remember.
Name: Book 16

text: For all I know, Meredith or his father used some sort of spell to make me forget.
Name: Book 16

text: The oxygen tent and IV frightened me but not as much as waking up alone in an unfamiliar place.
Name: Book 16

text: I was in pain, the most pain I had ever felt in my young life.
Name: Book 16

text: That wasnt the worst part.
Name: Book 16

text: The worst part was I couldn't speak.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldn't even scream for help.
Name: Book 16

text: It was the first time in my life I was truly and utterly afraid.
Name: Book 16

text: This was no boogey man or nightmare that on a subconscious level I knew wasnt real.
Name: Book 16

text: No, this was frighteningly real, as real as the hands that had tried to crush my throat.
Name: Book 16

text: Then I saw her.
Name: Book 16

text: She didn't have wings or a halo but she was a dark haired angel.
Name: Book 16

text: Her smile put me at ease.
Name: Book 16

text: A smile I knew was only for me.
Name: Book 16

text: "Don't be afraid, she said.
Name: Book 16

text: Those simple words made everything all right.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara stayed with me that long first night.
Name: Book 16

text: To pass the time, she told me stories about knights in shining armor and heroes.
Name: Book 16

text: I soon forgot my pain as the fear gave way to wonder.
Name: Book 16

text: As dawn approached, she shared a secret with me.
Name: Book 16

text: Magic was still alive in the world.
Name: Book 16

text: Myth and legend still walked the Earth.
Name: Book 16

text: If I wanted it to, I could walk in that world.
Name: Book 16

text: As I regained my strength and healed, I didnt tell my mom or relatives about Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: She said they wouldnt understand and I believed her.
Name: Book 16

text: As I grew older, I always remembered her and the stories she told me though the secret was lost to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Years later, I saw her again.
Name: Book 16

text: I was twenty five and fresh out of college.
Name: Book 16

text: I thought I knew all there was to know about life, the universe, and everything.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, I wasn't too bright back then.
Name: Book 16

text: I like to think Ive gotten smarter.
Name: Book 16

text: You might not be able to tell with the way things have been going for me lately.
Name: Book 16

text: I had gone down to Oklahoma City on short notice.
Name: Book 16

text: The promise of an exciting job and romance were enough to lure me out of New York City.
Name: Book 16

text: Needless to say, things did not go as planned.
Name: Book 16

text: With little money and less choice, I was forced to take the bus back to New York.
Name: Book 16

text: Like most bus terminals, the one in Oklahoma City looked like it belonged to another time.
Name: Book 16

text: It fit the lone ticket master who worked there perfectly.
Name: Book 16

text: Like the vending machines that lined the walls, he appeared old and weathered.
Name: Book 16

text: As I stepped up to buy my ticket, I saw through the illusion he projected.
Name: Book 16

text: There was nothing weak or decrepit about the man.
Name: Book 16

text: His eyes seemed wise to the world and all the tricks it might have in store for the unwary.
Name: Book 16

text: After checking my ID, he wasted little time booking my trip.
Name: Book 16

text: It felt like he knew far more about me than he should have.
Name: Book 16

text: I dismissed the thought.
Name: Book 16

text: Since then, Ive learned to pay a bit more attention to my instincts.
Name: Book 16

text: Not the best time of year for a bus trip, he said.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, he was right about that.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though it was only Mid-November, winter had come early.
Name: Book 16

text: A long bus ride was not going to be pleasant.
Name: Book 16

text: "Are you sure about this.
Name: Book 16

text: You could wait till the weather gets a little warmer.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe things will turn around for you.
Name: Book 16

text: The question should have bothered me.
Name: Book 16

text: This time was different.
Name: Book 16

text: I was at a crossroads.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt have to scurry back home.
Name: Book 16

text: There was an alternative.
Name: Book 16

text: I could tough it out down here a while longer.
Name: Book 16

text: In a week, I could fly back home in style.
Name: Book 16

text: No, the road called to me.
Name: Book 16

text: The long bus ride would give me time to think.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes I wonder what things would have been like if I had stayed in Oklahoma City the extra week.
Name: Book 16

text: I paid for my ticket with cash.
Name: Book 16

text: You're going to do fine.
Name: Book 16

text: An odd thing to say, then again the whole trip was odd.
Name: Book 16

text: It felt like fate had conspired to get me down to Oklahoma City only to take a crap on me.
Name: Book 16

text: I looked back only once as I boarded my bus but the old man was nowhere to be seen.
Name: Book 16

text: The trip was worse than I thought it would be.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only did the bus stop at every small town in Oklahoma, the temperature dropped to an all time low.
Name: Book 16

text: Not even the body heat from all the people crammed into the bus with me made it feel any warmer.
Name: Book 16

text: At night, my fellow passengers held snoring contests.
Name: Book 16

text: During the day, they seemed to take pleasure in having loud conversations about nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: It wouldnt have been so bad if there were something to do besides look out the window.
Name: Book 16

text: I hadnt even packed a book or brought a magazine to read.
Name: Book 16

text: Things changed the next night.
Name: Book 16

text: Everything had become so surreal.
Name: Book 16

text: The stars came out to play, lighting the ocean of darkness the world had become.
Name: Book 16

text: The towns and intersections had become islands of light.
Name: Book 16

text: Cars and trucks passed us by like ships in the night heading for distant far away lands.
Name: Book 16

text: At a rest stop in the middle of nowhere, I got off the bus to stretch my legs and to look up at the night sky.
Name: Book 16

text: There under the stars, I saw it.
Name: Book 16

text: A shape and form from legend peered at me from the shadows as if it had been waiting there all these years for me to wander this way.
Name: Book 16

text: As the dragon took flight, it came to me in a rush, the secret I had forgotten.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe it wasnt real, maybe it was just a product of my imagination.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever it was, it opened my eyes.
Name: Book 16

text: For the first time in a long time, I saw the world through the eyes of a child.
Name: Book 16

text: I felt the magic in the air and could sense what lurked in the shadows.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, I know it sounds crazy.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell, I was there and it still doesnt make any sense to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats how these things work.
Name: Book 16

text: Very few revelations make sense.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, this one had its price.
Name: Book 16

text: The fear had returned.
Name: Book 16

text: Fear I had not known since childhood.
Name: Book 16

text: It was never about pain.
Name: Book 16

text: It was fear of the unknown and of being alone.
Name: Book 16

text: There I was, feeling more alone than I had ever felt before, with no rudder or compass to guide me in a world I didnt know as well as I had thought.
Name: Book 16

text: I could feel my hold on reality weakening when I heard her voice again.
Name: Book 16

text: "Don't be afraid, she said.
Name: Book 16

text: And just like that, everything was all right.
Name: Book 16

text: My fear and doubt disappeared as I saw her.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara hadn't changed a bit.
Name: Book 16

text: She was just as beautiful as I remembered her.
Name: Book 16

text: It was impossible but that didn't matter.
Name: Book 16

text: I felt the link and the warmth of her thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew she wouldnt be leaving me.
Name: Book 16

text: Even after all this time, I still have trouble putting it into words.
Name: Book 16

text: I let my thoughts and feelings for Kara flow into the link.
Name: Book 16

text: Its easy and its not easy.
Name: Book 16

text: The link doesnt allow for anything but the truth and sensations.
Name: Book 16

text: There is still a sense of privacy.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara cant read my mind unless I let her and vice versa.
Name: Book 16

text: It lets us keep the things we want private.
Name: Book 16

text: There are parts of me I never want anyone to see but whatever we share across the link has to be honest and open.
Name: Book 16

text: Tonight, I do the unthinkable and think the words that come so hard to me.
Name: Book 16

text: I hear her voice again and I know its not a dream or a memory.
Name: Book 16

text: "I'm sorry, she says.
Name: Book 16

text: With the hard part out of the way, it gets easier.
Name: Book 16

text: We share with each other why we got angry and did what we did.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara says I have been reckless and taking more chances than usual.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes afraid, Im not ready for whats coming while I think she has been a little overprotective and doesnt trust me with the information she has been holding back.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt matter who is right or wrong, we compromise before spending the rest of the night renewing our partnership and just enjoying each others company.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith, the quest, the DIA, everything, it can all wait.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Two.
Name: Book 16

text: The demands of work force Jennifer to leave me to my own devices.
Name: Book 16

text: When did that change.
Name: Book 16

text: When did I start thinking of her as Jennifer instead of Marino.
Name: Book 16

text: When you decided to trust her,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: I smile, glad for her company and the chance to take a break from my exercises.
Name: Book 16

text: The weights and exercise bike that Jennifer had delivered to the apartment are a good alternative to visiting my physical therapist.
Name: Book 16

text: It allows me to work out each day and to set my own pace instead of two or three times a week.
Name: Book 16

text: The exercises are painful and tend to wear me out, but after a week I notice the difference they have made.
Name: Book 16

text: I still need the knee brace but the crutches are a thing of the past.
Name: Book 16

text: Tell me about the Awakening.
Name: Book 16

text: I hate asking, maybe as much as she hates answering.
Name: Book 16

text: It feels like I am dredging up something best left in the past but I need to know whatever it was Scott had to tell me.
Name: Book 16

text: Some believe that its inevitable.
Name: Book 16

text: When the Seven awaken, a new age will begin.
Name: Book 16

text: Are you saying I cant beat Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt answer immediately.
Name: Book 16

text: No, Im saying there are people out there who think its only a matter of time before they awaken.
Name: Book 16

text: Those arent the ones to worry about.
Name: Book 16

text: The dangerous ones are people like Meredith who work to hasten their return.
Name: Book 16

text: I consider her words.
Name: Book 16

text: Oceans rise and civilizations fall.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the way of things.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is people like Meredith who want to hasten the fall.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, the only reason for not sharing this with me is because Kara thinks that day might be close.
Name: Book 16

text: Over the years, magic has become weaker; the same magic holds the Seven at bay.
Name: Book 16

text: There might not be a way to stop them.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara shakes her head.
Name: Book 16

text: Even I can get a little scared.
Name: Book 16

text: It caused me to doubt you, us.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, knowing exactly how she feels.
Name: Book 16

text: There have been times when it seemed smarter to bet on the other side.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be too easy if everything was preordained and written in stone.
Name: Book 16

text: Everything is a product of our actions or inaction.
Name: Book 16

text: True, there are things that are out of our control.
Name: Book 16

text: You can call it luck, destiny or the universe conspiring against you.
Name: Book 16

text: These events might create opportunities or take them away from you but it all comes down to what you do in that moment.
Name: Book 16

text: So where do seers, prophets and prophecy fit in.
Name: Book 16

text: Its like dealing with your average stock market analyst.
Name: Book 16

text: He or she isnt always correct but the good ones can tell you what is most likely to happen with the market based on current events and trends.
Name: Book 16

text: The important thing is what you do with that information.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara believes in me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not going to dwell on it.
Name: Book 16

text: There are other matters to think about.
Name: Book 16

text: Y   ou smell,    she says.
Name: Book 16

text: I get the distinct image of Kara wrinkling her nose and waving a hand to ward me off.
Name: Book 16

text: I stop pedaling and dismount from the exercise bike.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe it is time for a break.
Name: Book 16

text: I have to be careful not to overdo it and stick to the program the therapist gave me.
Name: Book 16

text: Too much exercise is as bad as too little.
Name: Book 16

text: You need a shower,    she adds.
Name: Book 16

text: Is it that bad.
Name: Book 16

text: I take another sniff and frown.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes it is.
Name: Book 16

text: I can almost forget Meredith is still out there, almost.
Name: Book 16

text: A walk down the street or a visit to the store reminds me of how much things have changed.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a climate of fear.
Name: Book 16

text: Most still think its a simple matter of terrorism.
Name: Book 16

text: Others have made wilder claims that come closer to the truth.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if we caught Meredith tomorrow, things will never go back to the way they were.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes left his mark on the city.
Name: Book 16

text: No one can be trusted.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith was considered a philanthropist and an upstanding member of the community.
Name: Book 16

text: If he could be a mass murder and a terrorist, who else could be.
Name: Book 16

text: Does that guy next to you have some dark secret to hide.
Name: Book 16

text: Different is now a synonym for suspicious.
Name: Book 16

text: You cant blame yourself for this,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have an answer for her.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not the one who let the Servitor loose but I did contribute to the problem.
Name: Book 16

text: The signs were there and none of us heeded them until it was too late.
Name: Book 16

text: Things shouldnt have gotten this far.
Name: Book 16

text: Now the powers that be, both mundane and magical, flail about looking for Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: It wont correct our earlier mistakes.
Name: Book 16

text: Whats done is done.
Name: Book 16

text: He needs to be found before he can do something else.
Name: Book 16

text: The longer he is on the loose the more dangerous he becomes.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive seen his handiwork.
Name: Book 16

text: I know what he is capable of.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, I ask the question.
Name: Book 16

text: What is he up to.
Name: Book 16

text: The only thing he has tried to do since disappearing is try to have me killed and make life difficult for my friends.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats bad enough, but not the worst he could be doing.
Name: Book 16

text: Is he that petty to waste time with me.
Name: Book 16

text: Is it a simple matter of revenge or something else.
Name: Book 16

text: He thinks you can stop him from awakening the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith didnt act like it before.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems like the only thing Ive done is delay him.
Name: Book 16

text: I think it over some.
Name: Book 16

text: A lot of magic comes down to timing.
Name: Book 16

text: Some spells can only be cast at certain times and in certain places.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes me feel all warm and fuzzy inside when the opposition thinks youre actually a threat.
Name: Book 16

text: When the moment passes, I remember the downside.
Name: Book 16

text: The bad guys tend to make eliminating you a priority.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is no exception.
Name: Book 16

text: I was a lot safer when he thought I was a minor annoyance.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes going to keep sending people my way till one of them succeeds.
Name: Book 16

text: That makes it even more important to find him.
Name: Book 16

text: What are you going to do.
Name: Book 16

text: Im going to use my head and find him.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt say anything.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes not sure what I have planned.
Name: Book 16

text: I can sense her relief when I start pulling out the research I did on Meredith weeks earlier.
Name: Book 16

text: Before, I had just been going through the motions, not accomplishing a damn thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Now its time to get to work.
Name: Book 16

text: For a moment, I thought you were going to pound the pavement and look for him.
Name: Book 16

text: You think I should.
Name: Book 16

text: I smile, already knowing the answer without her having to voice it.
Name: Book 16

text: I try to learn from my mistakes, not repeat them.
Name: Book 16

text: I really dont want to run into Meredith or any of his friends by myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara remains silent as I thumb the information I got from the library.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt want to disturb me as I re- familiarize myself with the information and the notes I made.
Name: Book 16

text: I still dont have a complete picture of the man and who he is but I have enough for my purposes.
Name: Book 16

text: I close my eyes and do the unthinkable.
Name: Book 16

text: I put myself in Merediths shoes.
Name: Book 16

text: It is a frighteningly and surprisingly easy fit.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is committed to awakening the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: In his mind, its the only way to create a better tomorrow.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes willing to tear down the world as we know it.
Name: Book 16

text: Nothing is going to stand in his way.
Name: Book 16

text: It meant crossing a line most sorcerers were unwilling or unable to cross.
Name: Book 16

text: Even so, he has been thwarted but he cant give up.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith has to stay the course.
Name: Book 16

text: His survival depends on it.
Name: Book 16

text: He has to try again.
Name: Book 16

text: How he does it and his next step depends on information thats not in my file.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn my thoughts and questions to Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: Can he awaken the Seven without the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt answer immediately.
Name: Book 16

text: She knows Im not going to like the news and she is right.
Name: Book 16

text: It wouldnt be easy, even for him, but yes he could do it.
Name: Book 16

text: I thought that might be the case.
Name: Book 16

text: The Bloodstones ability to store magic makes it a valuable tool for any sorcerer or magic user.
Name: Book 16

text: It would make any major undertaking easier, but its more than that.
Name: Book 16

text: The ring was made to do this sort of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Without it, Meredith has to do things the hard way.
Name: Book 16

text: That gives me hope.
Name: Book 16

text: Why are you smiling.
Name: Book 16

text: Stop me if something sounds out of whack here.
Name: Book 16

text: If Meredith wants to awaken the Seven, it means casting a complex spell or some kind of ritual.
Name: Book 16

text: How does this help us.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is going to need everything working in his favor.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes only going to get one chance at this.
Name: Book 16

text: Too many people are after him.
Name: Book 16

text: That means hes going to try his ritual when magic is at its peak.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara nods in agreement.
Name: Book 16

text: So hell make his attempt during the next full moon at the height of the Witching Hour.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, if we give him that much time.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes not about to wait longer than that.
Name: Book 16

text: The longer he does, the more likely it is someone will find him.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, we still dont know where he will be.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if he had the Bloodstone, it wouldnt do him any good in the short term.
Name: Book 16

text: We drained the stone of its energy.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith needs to power his spell some other way.
Name: Book 16

text: There are a lot of ways he can do it.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith is fond of sacrificing people and things.
Name: Book 16

text: When he needed to cast his tracking spell, one of his own men became the fuel for the spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith could have gotten the power another way but he didnt.
Name: Book 16

text: For all his skill and power, its a habit he always falls back on.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, thats all he knows.
Name: Book 16

text: He would have to kill a lot of people to gather the energy needed for his purposes.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith would need a way to store the energy until he was ready to use it.
Name: Book 16

text: If he had a way of doing that, he wouldnt have needed the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara fills my mind with a replay of the tape Jennifer had shown me.
Name: Book 16

text: A mass sacrifice just before he cast his spell might work.
Name: Book 16

text: No, if it was that easy he would have done it already.
Name: Book 16

text: My instincts tell me I am on the right track.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith will have to cast his spell in a place of power.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the only way to get the energy he needs.
Name: Book 16

text: Even then, it might not be enough.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara looks for a hole in my theory.
Name: Book 16

text: She cant find any.
Name: Book 16

text: She does point out a problem.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats a lot of ground to cover,    She says.
Name: Book 16

text: A city the size of New York has many places where it is easier to work magic.
Name: Book 16

text: These are the places with a rich history.
Name: Book 16

text: Each has a unique vibe or feeling.
Name: Book 16

text: Even the mundanes can feel the energy.
Name: Book 16

text: Its this intangible force a talented sorcerer or mage can draw upon to aid him.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately for Meredith and fortunately for us, many of those places are public.
Name: Book 16

text: He cant go to Lincoln Center and hope to cast his spell, even with the Servitor as his bodyguard.
Name: Book 16

text: Too much can go wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: All it will take is one bullet to stop him.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure the authorities will have no qualms about shooting to kill after what happened in the Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell have to use some place private.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, youre assuming he is still in the city.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes not about to leave.
Name: Book 16

text: Its too risky with all the people looking for him.
Name: Book 16

text: Contrary to popular belief, the authorities make it real difficult for wanted criminals to flee the city, let alone the country.
Name: Book 16

text: In this case, his fame and love for publicity are working against him.
Name: Book 16

text: Famous people have a harder time running and hiding than us no names.
Name: Book 16

text: Okay but where is he.
Name: Book 16

text: The list of places Meredith can use is actually quite short.
Name: Book 16

text: The public ones are too dangerous for Meredith to use.
Name: Book 16

text: That leaves the privately owned ones.
Name: Book 16

text: Only a few of those will have enough energy for Merediths needs and all of them will be closely guarded.
Name: Book 16

text: Their owners would fight anyone tooth and nail to prevent someone from using their place of power without permission.
Name: Book 16

text: He has a Fae helping him.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats a good place to start.
Name: Book 16

text: Im betting Meredith will use one of their places of power but well cover the others, just in case.
Name: Book 16

text: I can sense her smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Yep, this feels right.
Name: Book 16

text: I can ask Jennifer to have her people stake out the public places.
Name: Book 16

text: For the rest, I need to cash in a few favors.
Name: Book 16

text: I pick up the phone and start making calls.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Three.
Name: Book 16

text: When I call my friends, it soon becomes apparent we need a place where we can sit down and talk.
Name: Book 16

text: Meeting in public is out of the question.
Name: Book 16

text: Its going to be one of those conversations that would be sure to turn heads.
Name: Book 16

text: We usually used Scotts apartment for this type of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: It had everything one could want; space, luxury, convenience, and privacy.
Name: Book 16

text: With Scott out of the country, its not an option.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not about to call him and ask to use his apartment.
Name: Book 16

text: There is the chance he might say yes but I would never hear the end of it.
Name: Book 16

text: The next logical place to meet is Sols library.
Name: Book 16

text: His library is well suited to meetings even if it isnt as luxurious or convenient as Scotts place.
Name: Book 16

text: Any information we might need would be close at hand and within easy reach.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, Sol is incommunicado.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no way to get to his library until he is down handling that other problem Scott mentioned.
Name: Book 16

text: That doesnt leave too many other options.
Name: Book 16

text: My studio apartment is a bit too small for what I had in mind.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont think anyone would appreciate being packed into my apartment like sardines.
Name: Book 16

text: Nervas place is roomy with plenty of style and creature comforts.
Name: Book 16

text: Too bad our little tussle wrecked the place.
Name: Book 16

text: It will be days before it will be fit for company.
Name: Book 16

text: So it falls to Hagan to play host.
Name: Book 16

text: When I first visited Hagans apartment, it wasnt what I had expected.
Name: Book 16

text: His apartment wasnt small, messy, or in shambles like many so called bachelor pads.
Name: Book 16

text: True, housekeeping wasnt something he did a lot of but he didnt let things get out of hand.
Name: Book 16

text: His place rides that fine line between lived in and neat.
Name: Book 16

text: There are bits and pieces of the mans history scattered about the apartment, assuming you buy into the whole immortality thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Amid the artwork and other collectibles is an impressive array of weaponry, all of it kept in perfect and lethal condition.
Name: Book 16

text: Some of his things are probably worth a fortune.
Name: Book 16

text: You wouldnt know it from the way Hagan treated them.
Name: Book 16

text: To him, they arent antiques or pieces of art.
Name: Book 16

text: Its just stuff he has picked up over the years.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt mistreat them but they arent treated like showpieces.
Name: Book 16

text: It reminds me of the tiny figurine I keep on my desk at home.
Name: Book 16

text: I brought it when I was a kid for five bucks.
Name: Book 16

text: Less than a year ago, I saw the same figurine being sold for almost two hundred dollars.
Name: Book 16

text: A friend suggested I sell it or put it in a display case but it didnt seem right.
Name: Book 16

text: It was too personal for me to even think of selling it or treating it with special reverence except to keep it right where it was and close at hand to remind me of bygone days.
Name: Book 16

text: Where I have a figurine, Hagan has a sword.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not a beautiful weapon but it looks like it has seen plenty of use.
Name: Book 16

text: It was also in easy reach should Hagan need it.
Name: Book 16

text: All in all, it would have been perfect except for one or two minor details.
Name: Book 16

text: I start our little ritual in a vain attempt to distract him as Jennifer studies the two of us.
Name: Book 16

text: Ready for a fight, Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: Still hearing voices, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan laughs as he shifts his attention to Jennifer, looking the woman up and down.
Name: Book 16

text: Its good to hear the sound of laughter even if it is at my expense.
Name: Book 16

text: Count doesnt like to talk about his little valkyrie.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes afraid people might think hes crazy.
Name: Book 16

text: As crazy as a guy who thinks hes immortal, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer was going to find out sooner or later.
Name: Book 16

text: I just wish Hagans timing was a little better.
Name: Book 16

text: This would be a bad time to start doubting me.
Name: Book 16

text: I focus my thoughts inward as Hagan introduces himself to Jennifer.
Name: Book 16

text: It is how he thinks of me.
Name: Book 16

text: I really dont see myself as a wolf-riding chooser of the slain.
Name: Book 16

text: I laugh,    That makes two of us.
Name: Book 16

text: I wonder where he got that idea from.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas reply is interrupted by the sound of a stinging slap.
Name: Book 16

text: I glance over at my two friends.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is still smiling though his cheek is a little red.
Name: Book 16

text: Just what I thought, He says to Jennifer before turning his attention back to me.
Name: Book 16

text: So tell me why you brought a cop into my home and for her sake the answer better be good.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not that bad, I say with one of my more winning smiles.
Name: Book 16

text: It does nothing to appease the big man towering over the two of us.
Name: Book 16

text: You bring a cop to my house while there's a warrant out for my arrest and youre telling me that its not that bad.
Name: Book 16

text: I spare Jennifer a quick glance, hoping she doesnt say or do something stupid.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a cop, She says Im with the government.
Name: Book 16

text: The look I give her is different from the one Hagan gives her but for all intents and purposes the message is the same.
Name: Book 16

text: That makes a big difference, Hagan says.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre not going to win.
Name: Book 16

text: Just take your beating and get it over with,    Kara says,    Hagan dislikes Federal agents more than police.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not like shes here to arrest you or anything.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer is here to help us out with Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan goes on like he hasnt heard me.
Name: Book 16

text: Feds stink of mom and apple pie.
Name: Book 16

text: The only thing worse than a Fed is a spook, He pauses, giving Jennifer another more appraising look.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes not a spook is she.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer answers the question for me, ignoring my unspoken warning and Hagans anger.
Name: Book 16

text: No, Im with the Defense Intelligence Agency.
Name: Book 16

text: I knew it, he says with a scowl.
Name: Book 16

text: Any hope of winning this battle goes out the window as Hagan lets out a stream of curses in some forgotten tongue.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer doesnt flinch from his verbal onslaught.
Name: Book 16

text: In fact, she replies with a few choice insults and curses of her own.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs    I told you this was going to happen.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, they will calm down before Nerva arrives.
Name: Book 16

text: Ever the optimist.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva is late, as usual.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me time to diffuse things between Hagan and Jennifer.
Name: Book 16

text: He is one of those people you either love or hate.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no middle ground.
Name: Book 16

text: A lot of it has to do with Hagans attitude which can draw you in as easily as push you away.
Name: Book 16

text: If you take the time and effort to get to know him, you can get past all that and see him for who he is.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is Hagan usually doesnt let people get that close.
Name: Book 16

text: He is fond about talking about the perks of immortality.
Name: Book 16

text: Its rare that he mentions the downside.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a lonely sort of existence very few can take.
Name: Book 16

text: He admits you dont have a lot of friends because you outlive most of them.
Name: Book 16

text: In time, you become more and more reluctant to make new ones.
Name: Book 16

text: You build up walls to protect yourself.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont need to be immortal to do it.
Name: Book 16

text: Like me, Nerva didnt come alone.
Name: Book 16

text: She brought a guest with her.
Name: Book 16

text: He is the second minor detail I was referring to.
Name: Book 16

text: His kin call him Aleric the Strong, not because of his physical strength.
Name: Book 16

text: It is from his strength of will.
Name: Book 16

text: He is part arbiter, part diplomat, and all troubleshooter.
Name: Book 16

text: Though he doesnt exude power, Aleric is not one to underestimate.
Name: Book 16

text: Among the Fae, he is unique.
Name: Book 16

text: Long ago, the Fae split into two courts, the Seelie and the Unseelie.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seelie, or Blessed Court, is made up of the more benevolent Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats not to say they are all goody two shoes.
Name: Book 16

text: Far from it, they can be capricious and cruel when given reason.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie dont need a reason.
Name: Book 16

text: I wouldnt call them evil but you dont have to be evil to be bad news.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric exists apart from the two courts, free of the intrigue and politics, so he can mediate disputes between his kin fairly.
Name: Book 16

text: During times of crisis, he has the authority to make decisions on behalf of both courts.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes a good man to know and a bad one to cross.
Name: Book 16

text: Its why I need to speak to him.
Name: Book 16

text: Before any introductions can be made, Hagan takes the initiative.
Name: Book 16

text: Well, well, if it isnt the master race.
Name: Book 16

text: Even Kara wasnt prepared for that comment.
Name: Book 16

text: Its true the Fae see themselves as superior to mankind.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric is no different, though he usually keeps his opinion to himself.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric acknowledges the words and Hagan with a cold smile.
Name: Book 16

text: He isnt the least bit intimidated by the big man.
Name: Book 16

text: Its always a pleasure to see you, Elfkiller.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara mutters the word Vikings as if it were a curse.
Name: Book 16

text: It shouldnt surprise me.
Name: Book 16

text: Another perk of immortality seems to be there is never a shortage of enemies.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva gets over her surprise slightly faster than the rest of us.
Name: Book 16

text: I take it, the two of you have met, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: Not in person but his legend is known to all, Aleric replies.
Name: Book 16

text: Something you want to share with the rest of us.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan shrugs off the comment and question like water from a ducks back.
Name: Book 16

text: It was a long time ago.
Name: Book 16

text: The Fae have a long memory, Elfkiller, Aleric says.
Name: Book 16

text: I see the change in Hagans posture.
Name: Book 16

text: Before, I wasnt really worried he might hurt Jennifer or me.
Name: Book 16

text: It was all for show.
Name: Book 16

text: This time, its different.
Name: Book 16

text: He hears the threat in Alerics words.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is more than willing and able to do something violent.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a luxury we cant afford right now.
Name: Book 16

text: I need Alerics help if Im going to stop Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: That would be impossible if he ends up as another notch on Hagans belt.
Name: Book 16

text: Can we table this discussion for another time.
Name: Book 16

text: We have bigger fish to fry.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan doesnt say it but I know what he is thinking.
Name: Book 16

text: After this is all over, he will have words with Aleric.
Name: Book 16

text: From the look on the Faes face, he would be more than happy to oblige.
Name: Book 16

text: That is fine with me.
Name: Book 16

text: The two of them can go at each other on their own time.
Name: Book 16

text: I assume you want to discuss Lord Fitzgerald, Aleric doesnt give me a chance to interrupt him.
Name: Book 16

text: As I told Nerva, Im not about to turn over a member of the Unseelie court to her or anyone else unless they are guilty of high crimes.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva practically bolts from the couch where she was lounging.
Name: Book 16

text: That is regrettable, but alas not a high crime, Its not that Aleric is unmoved.
Name: Book 16

text: He is friends with Nerva and the two have known each other for years.
Name: Book 16

text: His hands are tied.
Name: Book 16

text: Fitzgerald is a noble and a member of the Unseelie Court.
Name: Book 16

text: He must be very well connected for Aleric to hold this close to the letter of the law.
Name: Book 16

text: If Meredith needed help, he would go as far up the food chain as he could.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone in Fitzgeralds position could probably get access to all sorts of magical resources.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone says it, even Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: Alerics eyes narrow for a moment as if he is about to walk into a trap.
Name: Book 16

text: He asks the question scholars and philosophers have asked since the dawn of time.
Name: Book 16

text: Then why am I here.
Name: Book 16

text: Sit back and relax I say more for Nervas sake than for Aleric.
Name: Book 16

text: Let me tell you a little story.
Name: Book 16

text: Slowly, but surely, Nerva relaxes as I spin my tale.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes not sure what I am up to but she is willing to trust me.
Name: Book 16

text: Fitzgerald hurt her and she wants him.
Name: Book 16

text: It reminds me of how badly I wanted Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: With any luck, she wont be disappointed.
Name: Book 16

text: I start at the beginning and tell Aleric everything.
Name: Book 16

text: The others have heard it already but it is all new to the Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: Alerics mood changes when I mention the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt like what he is hearing.
Name: Book 16

text: He likes it even less when I get to Merediths plan.
Name: Book 16

text: His expression darkens as he thinks of life in Merediths better world.
Name: Book 16

text: He, like most of the Fae, longs for the good old days when magic was strong.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is the price tag for such a return.
Name: Book 16

text: He interrupts me right before I tell him the juicy bit.
Name: Book 16

text: And Lord Fitzgerald is in league with this Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes and he isnt doing this for free, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: The Fae dont accept payment in coin.
Name: Book 16

text: They deal in boons and favors.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the currency of their realm.
Name: Book 16

text: They use it in their ever changing game of politics and intrigue.
Name: Book 16

text: In helping Meredith realize his dream, Fitzgerald is going to get something in return.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric knows the man.
Name: Book 16

text: He has a good idea what he would ask for.
Name: Book 16

text: I let his imagination run wild then I finish my tale.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith needs a place of power to cast his spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Does Fitzgerald have access to one.
Name: Book 16

text: Alerics silence is all the answer I need.
Name: Book 16

text: If Fitzgerald was doing this for the benefit of the Fae, he would have told someone at Court.
Name: Book 16

text: It would have gotten back to Aleric.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont have to be a genius or paranoid to come up with a number of reasons why he wouldnt want that to happen.
Name: Book 16

text: I was counting on it.
Name: Book 16

text: When Aleric speaks, he chooses his words with care.
Name: Book 16

text: I will have to investigate your claims thoroughly, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: If what you say is true, Fitzgerald will have much to answer for.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever his history with Aleric, he knows exactly what the Fae has in mind.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt see how this helps us.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes never had to deal with Aleric on this level.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes not about to let something like evidence or due process stand in his way if he thinks there is a credible threat to his people.
Name: Book 16

text: He believes what Ive told him.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes going to act quickly.
Name: Book 16

text: The question is how quickly.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer asks the question on my mind, And how long will that take.
Name: Book 16

text: I had nearly forgotten she was here.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer had been silent during my rehashing of events.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric replies, not missing a beat.
Name: Book 16

text: If he is linked to Meredith, Ill know it within the hour.
Name: Book 16

text: I just need to make a few calls.
Name: Book 16

text: I direct my thoughts and amusement inward to Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: It wouldnt be diplomatic to say them aloud.
Name: Book 16

text: Whether the evidence exists or not, Aleric will find something.
Name: Book 16

text: He isnt going to take any chances.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes you can be a little devious.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of replying, I focus on the conversation.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer still has questions, all of them important.
Name: Book 16

text: This one is of more interest to Nerva than me.
Name: Book 16

text: And what will happen to Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: she asks.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though Meredith is my prime concern, Fitzgerald has to be dealt with sooner or later.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be nice to know what Aleric plans to do regarding him.
Name: Book 16

text: Its clear he already has something in mind.
Name: Book 16

text: If he is guilty, his crimes would warrant exile or worse.
Name: Book 16

text: Banishment and exile are practically unheard of among the Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: They consider it the harshest possible sentence.
Name: Book 16

text: Many Fae would prefer death.
Name: Book 16

text: Not only would they be an outcast forced to find their own way through mortal society, they would have to do it without their powers.
Name: Book 16

text: Enemies could strike at them without fear of repercussions.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the closest thing to hell, a Fae could find on this Earth especially if he or she didnt have any money or resources squirreled away.
Name: Book 16

text: What could be worse than that.
Name: Book 16

text: I would personally hand him over to Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: We all turn to her.
Name: Book 16

text: Nervas smile is not particularly pleasant.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Four.
Name: Book 16

text: Space is at a premium.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer and Aleric both need privacy to make their phone calls.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric claims the bedroom.
Name: Book 16

text: As expected, it doesnt take him long to learn the truth.
Name: Book 16

text: He has a lot of contacts in the Unseelie and Seelie Courts.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a necessity for his job.
Name: Book 16

text: The time consuming part involves apprising the rulers of both courts about the situation.
Name: Book 16

text: They need to know whats going on before Aleric can act against Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: In the kitchen, Jennifer calls her people.
Name: Book 16

text: She wants them ready to move the moment we know where Meredith is.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure if that is a good idea or not but Im not going to argue with her.
Name: Book 16

text: She has a job to do.
Name: Book 16

text: That leaves me, Hagan, and Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: We sit in the living room where Hagan sharpens his sword.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes expecting the fight of his life and he wants to be ready for it.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva leans close to whisper against my neck.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone else has something to do.
Name: Book 16

text: How shall we ever pass the time.
Name: Book 16

text: Her close proximity and thoughts of entertaining ways to pass time make it harder to concentrate.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas hiss warns me of how far my thoughts are straying.
Name: Book 16

text: We dont have time, I say by way of apology.
Name: Book 16

text: And even if you did.
Name: Book 16

text: I think clean thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara mutters the word hussy before lapsing into silence.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is good enough not to laugh.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes, its almost as if he can hear Kara as clearly as I can.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva sighs in disappointment.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre right and Im not in the mood for a threesome.
Name: Book 16

text: The big man nearly cuts himself as he looks our way.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive never seen anyone shock Hagan before.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes him almost thirty seconds to realize Nerva is joking then the laughter comes.
Name: Book 16

text: It spreads like wildfire, lightening the mood and warming the heart.
Name: Book 16

text: Even Kara joins in, forgetting her dislike of Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: When Hagan regains control of himself, he asks a question.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, do you remember how we first met.
Name: Book 16

text: That was a long time ago, ancient history, I reply.
Name: Book 16

text: My theft of Hagans trademarked line gets a chuckle out of Nerva and a smile from Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: How could I forget.
Name: Book 16

text: Jesse James isnt my sort of place.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not the music, a mixture of country, honky tonk, and classic rock.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not the large crowd, though the bar is a bit more rowdy than my usual haunts.
Name: Book 16

text: The men and women who frequent Jesse James range from bikers to wannabes and outsiders looking to walk on the wild side.
Name: Book 16

text: Add to the mix the occasional celebrity who wants to be seen and the bachelorette parties that stop by for a last night of extreme entertainment.
Name: Book 16

text: Its definitely not the alcohol packed drinks that are served quickly and efficiently by the scantily-clad barmaids; though heaven help you if you decide not to tip.
Name: Book 16

text: Cheapskates soon learn there is a price to pay for their thriftiness.
Name: Book 16

text: The barmaids possess razor sharp wits and tongues to match along with a megaphone to call out an offender at a moments notice.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a combination of little things that put me on edge.
Name: Book 16

text: The abnormally long line to get in isnt helping matters.
Name: Book 16

text: I have to be in a certain mood to enjoy myself in a place like this.
Name: Book 16

text: Tonight is not one of those times.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if it were, Im working tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont have to do this,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure if I can get used to having her with me like this.
Name: Book 16

text: The link or connection we share allows me to hear her thoughts and sense her emotions.
Name: Book 16

text: My guardian angel is always close and in intimate contact but untouchable.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I like having her around, it feels weird having someone in your head talking to you.
Name: Book 16

text: Its also pretty frustrating when you consider the sort of thoughts I have about her.
Name: Book 16

text: Its what I want to do and Wendy needs help.
Name: Book 16

text: It was pure chance I had run into her.
Name: Book 16

text: We were both researching vampires in the library.
Name: Book 16

text: Wendy was in a talkative mood and I was more than happy to listen.
Name: Book 16

text: She was a bit unnerved by one of her customers last weekend.
Name: Book 16

text: The guy wanted to sleep with her but bartenders are used to fending off unwanted admirers.
Name: Book 16

text: So what made this one different.
Name: Book 16

text: When she looked into his eyes, she felt compelled to follow him back to his place.
Name: Book 16

text: A scuffle in the crowd distracted the man and Wendy came to her senses.
Name: Book 16

text: The following night, he showed up again.
Name: Book 16

text: This time she stayed away from him.
Name: Book 16

text: Later, she learned he had asked her co-workers a lot of questions about her, questions they answered for some strange reason.
Name: Book 16

text: It was enough to get her thinking about vampires.
Name: Book 16

text: I offered my help.
Name: Book 16

text: After all, I had some experience with this sort of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: It wasnt much but I was an expert compared to her.
Name: Book 16

text: The money and free drinks at Jesse James sealed the deal.
Name: Book 16

text: Truth be told, I would have done it for free.
Name: Book 16

text: The days of the Good Samaritan are over.
Name: Book 16

text: No one ever seems to do something for nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: Those that do are met with suspicion.
Name: Book 16

text: It was easier to take the money.
Name: Book 16

text: To be honest, I could use it.
Name: Book 16

text: I wasnt in danger of sleeping on the street but the extra few dollars would help.
Name: Book 16

text: A sense of uncertainty flickers across the link from Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: What if she is right.
Name: Book 16

text: I hadnt thought about that.
Name: Book 16

text: What if Wendy is right.
Name: Book 16

text: What if her stalker turns out to be a vampire.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not like I can call the cops or stake him if there is any trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: Sure, I could fight him but what happens after that.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of saying what I am thinking, I reply,    Ill think of something.
Name: Book 16

text: I did handle Nerva, didnt I.
Name: Book 16

text: I smile, hoping she can be fooled by my words.
Name: Book 16

text: What I get in return is not a smile but more like a murmur of discontent and barely suppressed anger.
Name: Book 16

text: She was less than pleased with how things turned out with Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: All in all, I thought I didnt do too badly.
Name: Book 16

text: It could have been a lot worse.
Name: Book 16

text: I know you want to help this woman but maybe you should take it slow.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre still new at this.
Name: Book 16

text: I shake my head.
Name: Book 16

text: Its too late for that.
Name: Book 16

text: I told her I would help and Im going to do just that.
Name: Book 16

text: My guardian angel lapses into silence as the bouncer asks for my ID.
Name: Book 16

text: Now I see why the line is so long tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes the only person working the door and proofing people.
Name: Book 16

text: Ordinarily, there are four or five bouncers to direct traffic and keep the peace.
Name: Book 16

text: My estimation of the place goes down a notch.
Name: Book 16

text: One man cant control a crowd like this no matter how dangerous or able he is, barring the use of firearms.
Name: Book 16

text: No wonder one of the bartenders is having problems with a stalker.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes a big man, bigger than me and Im no little leaguer.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not just his size, its also his attitude.
Name: Book 16

text: Like a warrior of old, confident in his abilities and more than willing to use them.
Name: Book 16

text: A stray thought flickers across the link from Kara, one of wonder and surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: It nearly causes me to drop my wallet.
Name: Book 16

text: Count Albritton, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: Is this for real.
Name: Book 16

text: You some kind of royalty or something.
Name: Book 16

text: Its just a name.
Name: Book 16

text: You know like Count Bassie or Nat King Cole.
Name: Book 16

text: He nods at that while continuing to scrutinize my ID.
Name: Book 16

text: Sure, its an uncommon name but it doesnt warrant this much attention.
Name: Book 16

text: So youre the joker Wendy hired.
Name: Book 16

text: You on the level or what.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont like his tone.
Name: Book 16

text: There is an unspoken threat, a promise of pain if I were to screw Wendy over.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant blame him for looking out for his friends.
Name: Book 16

text: I would do the same in his position.
Name: Book 16

text: I keep my voice friendly.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah but I doubt there will be any trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: It is a sound rich and full.
Name: Book 16

text: If there is, you stay out of the way and let me handle it.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, wondering how much Wendy has told him and give the answer I think he wants to hear.
Name: Book 16

text: I wont get in the way of your job.
Name: Book 16

text: You know, I thought you would be.
Name: Book 16

text: different.
Name: Book 16

text: I laugh; happy the first major obstacle of the night was handled so easily.
Name: Book 16

text: He was probably expecting some skinny pale faced kid or a nerdy bookworm type.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe he thought I would turn out to be some lecherous old Van Helsing type who was looking to score with Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: I step into the orderly chaos that is the Jesse James.
Name: Book 16

text: The place is packed.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes threading my way through the crowd a minor ordeal as I make my way over to the bar.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont bother Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: Im sure the blonde has seen me.
Name: Book 16

text: She has a job to do which means there is little time for socializing.
Name: Book 16

text: I order a beer and to my surprise, it comes in a can.
Name: Book 16

text: I guess it is managements way to limit the number of potential weapons in the place.
Name: Book 16

text: My next destination is the jukebox which has been set off to the side.
Name: Book 16

text: On a night like tonight, its turned off though drunks still pump quarters into it not realizing the bartenders are playing tapes and cds.
Name: Book 16

text: The regulars use it as a place to put their coats.
Name: Book 16

text: For me, its a nice spot to hang out in without being constantly bumped into while I nurse my beer.
Name: Book 16

text: It helps Im not a big beer drinker.
Name: Book 16

text: The one beer keeps me going for a while without drawing too much attention to myself.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant afford to get drunk and its a better alternative than ordering a coke.
Name: Book 16

text: As I watch the bar and the patrons, Kara murmurs something but I cant quite hear it.
Name: Book 16

text: I try to focus on her voice without losing sense of my surroundings.
Name: Book 16

text: She cuts in and out as if there is a bad cell phone connection.
Name: Book 16

text: She told me that in time, I wouldnt have this sort of trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: Its all a matter of practice and getting used to this.
Name: Book 16

text: The one word I catch from her is a name Hagan and the face of the bouncer.
Name: Book 16

text: Its close to last call when I can hear Kara clearly again.
Name: Book 16

text: The crowd has thinned out some but there are still a lot of people here.
Name: Book 16

text: I glance in the direction of the side door to see a man enter.
Name: Book 16

text: He is just like Wendy described him, not a bad looking guy.
Name: Book 16

text: What disturbs me is the way he entered the bar.
Name: Book 16

text: That door should have been locked.
Name: Book 16

text: Why do I say that.
Name: Book 16

text: With only one bouncer, you cant have more than one way into a bar.
Name: Book 16

text: It defeats the purpose of proofing people.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs,    Hes not a vampire.
Name: Book 16

text: I feel more disappointment than relief.
Name: Book 16

text: If he was one of the Fae or something else Kara would have mentioned it.
Name: Book 16

text: She also would have told me if he was a sorcerer.
Name: Book 16

text: That means Im off the hook.
Name: Book 16

text: Sure, I can get involved but I would do no better and probably worse than the authorities.
Name: Book 16

text: It also means I wont be getting paid and Wendy will have to deal with this some other way.
Name: Book 16

text: As I make my way over to the bar, I can understand her confusion and concern.
Name: Book 16

text: Up close, the guy looks less than wholesome.
Name: Book 16

text: He gives me the creeps and I dont know a thing about him.
Name: Book 16

text: Its in his eyes and the way he carries himself.
Name: Book 16

text: A kind of desperation that hints at missed opportunities.
Name: Book 16

text: He's at the end of his rope.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, stopping short of him when I notice Hagan approaching.
Name: Book 16

text: Somehow the big man must have known this guy was here.
Name: Book 16

text: Its more than I gave him credit for.
Name: Book 16

text: I know he wants to handle this and thats fine by me.
Name: Book 16

text: This is no longer my problem.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, I wont run out on Wendy till I talk to her.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me the chance to watch how Hagan handles the situation.
Name: Book 16

text: I admit I am curious about him.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara seems to know or recognize him but she hasnt told me anything about him.
Name: Book 16

text: This will be a good time to learn a little more about him, just in case.
Name: Book 16

text: What little I can hear from the conversation is exactly what I expect.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want any trouble, the stalker says.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if I didnt know what was going on, I wouldnt have believed him.
Name: Book 16

text: He was up to something and trying to hide it.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan doesnt buy it either.
Name: Book 16

text: He places down enough money to cover the mans drink and a tip for Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: You need to leave now.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagans tone makes it clear this is not a request.
Name: Book 16

text: It is an order and failure to comply will have dire consequences.
Name: Book 16

text: The other man looks first to Wendy then to the patrons around him for support as he tries to talk his way out of this.
Name: Book 16

text: I edge a little closer, placing myself next to Wendy though the bar still separates us.
Name: Book 16

text: The motion isnt lost on Hagan but he doesnt take his gaze off of the man in front of him.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas warning comes as a surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes using some sort of magic item.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont see or feel anything.
Name: Book 16

text: That comes as no surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: For a brief moment, I think Hagan is being too rough on the guy.
Name: Book 16

text: He just wants to talk to Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: After all, its a free country.
Name: Book 16

text: Im probably not the only one who thinks so.
Name: Book 16

text: The moment passes quickly and Kara breathes a sigh of relief.
Name: Book 16

text: The fog clears as I realize what has happened.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not the only one asking that question.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan must have felt something.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though the magic is strong enough to bend the mind and will, there are no flashy effects to dilute its power.
Name: Book 16

text: No wasted energy on special effects.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is quick to fill in the blanks for me.
Name: Book 16

text: You reflected the magic he was using against Wendy and Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: I did what.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have time to ask for further clarification.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is no dummy and he obviously has some experience with the supernatural, maybe more than me.
Name: Book 16

text: His fist rockets forward into the creeps face.
Name: Book 16

text: So much for the art of conversation.
Name: Book 16

text: Fortunately, violence is a universal language and Hagan appears to be well versed in its subtleties.
Name: Book 16

text: I might have handled things differently but Im not about to get in the way.
Name: Book 16

text: I let Hagan do his job.
Name: Book 16

text: He is the bouncer here.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyway, its not smart to get involved in a bar fight, even when youre on the same side as the bouncer.
Name: Book 16

text: From the reaction of the bartenders, its not the first time a fight has happened here.
Name: Book 16

text: They back away from the bar and out of reach of any patrons while one picks up a phone - probably to call the police.
Name: Book 16

text: The smarter patrons head for the door.
Name: Book 16

text: I can understand their sentiment.
Name: Book 16

text: Mistakes can happen and things can escalate out of control.
Name: Book 16

text: Usually, if a bouncer has to lay his hands on someone, they would be escorted out and that would be that.
Name: Book 16

text: This time things deviate from the script.
Name: Book 16

text: All hell starts to break loose.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone, maybe a friend of the guy, throws a punch at Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: Another man reaches into his pocket for something.
Name: Book 16

text: With a sick feeling, I realize the little talent Kara said I had just made this situation a lot uglier than it had to be.
Name: Book 16

text: The magic had to go somewhere when I reflected it.
Name: Book 16

text: In this case, it hit the people standing around me.
Name: Book 16

text: No other fight on this scale is as dangerous as a bar fight.
Name: Book 16

text: Were not talking about a scuffle where two patrons mix it up or a situation where a bouncer has to forcibly escort someone outside.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not the comedic sort of brawl you see on the old westerns.
Name: Book 16

text: No, this is the ugly violent reality where everyone around you is a potential enemy in a room filled with all manner of weapons.
Name: Book 16

text: I think about getting the hell out of there, but I am partly to blame for this.
Name: Book 16

text: I spare a quick glance at Hagan before moving to back him up.
Name: Book 16

text: I pray the man who reached into his pocket doesnt have a knife or a gun.
Name: Book 16

text: For what its worth, my prayers are answered.
Name: Book 16

text: Brass knuckles adorn his right hand.
Name: Book 16

text: Plenty of people have died from blunt force trauma and Im not confident of beating him in a head to head fight so I let him slip past me.
Name: Book 16

text: Hitting a man from behind is not particularly nice or heroic.
Name: Book 16

text: It does fit with my Keep Count Out of the Hospital plan.
Name: Book 16

text: It fits as well as the roll of quarters that happen to find their way into my hand.
Name: Book 16

text: The blow lands heavily.
Name: Book 16

text: My victim stumbles and falls to the sawdust covered floor.
Name: Book 16

text: Ordinarily, I wouldnt kick a man while he is down.
Name: Book 16

text: It isnt because of any misguided sense of honor.
Name: Book 16

text: When one foot leaves the ground, its easier to fall or be tripped.
Name: Book 16

text: I could take the high road and be a better man but Ive always liked to give rather than receive.
Name: Book 16

text: Anything this guy might want to give me after my sneak attack, I dont want.
Name: Book 16

text: A swift kick removes him and the brass knuckles from my growing list of things to worry about as more and more people get involved in the fight.
Name: Book 16

text: I put my back to the bar and stand by Hagans side.
Name: Book 16

text: The lunatic is actually smiling amid this carnage.
Name: Book 16

text: Its like he is having the time of his life.
Name: Book 16

text: Again, I have the image of a warrior from a bygone era ready to cut a swathe of destruction across a bloody battlefield.
Name: Book 16

text: This time it is from Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: I force it out of my mind and focus on the task at hand.
Name: Book 16

text: I do what I can and play Gray Mouser to his Fafhrd.
Name: Book 16

text: Though I lack the size, brute force, and smash mouth style with which Hagan approaches this fiasco, I make up for it in skill and the willingness to look for the things he might miss.
Name: Book 16

text: This arrangement makes life easier for Hagan, allowing him to deal with his numerous admirers.
Name: Book 16

text: I lose track of time.
Name: Book 16

text: My lungs are burning.
Name: Book 16

text: I am not hurt or wounded.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have a mark on me though my head begins to hurt.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes me seconds to realize the pain isnt from a blow I failed to dodge.
Name: Book 16

text: It is coming from Kara screaming into my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever she wants, it better be important.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan doesnt reply though he gives me a strange look.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara reply is heated causing me to stop in my tracks.
Name: Book 16

text: The big man saves me from getting my head bashed in by the guy I was fighting.
Name: Book 16

text: STOP HIM AND YOU STOP THIS.
Name: Book 16

text: I wince as the image of the guy who started this fills my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Why the hell didnt I think of that.
Name: Book 16

text: I totally forgot about him and Kara when things escalated.
Name: Book 16

text: I was so caught up in the moment I stopped thinking.
Name: Book 16

text: If Im going to be a paranormal investigator, I need to do better.
Name: Book 16

text: As long as hes in the picture, there is no way for us to win, not against these odds.
Name: Book 16

text: I also realize no one is attacking me.
Name: Book 16

text: Come to think of it, no one has attacked me unless I attacked them first.
Name: Book 16

text: That and Hagans help has gone a long way towards keeping me in one piece.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a chance and shift my attention away from the fight.
Name: Book 16

text: I find what and who I am looking for as a plan forms.
Name: Book 16

text: He is busy mumbling to himself and concentrating on something in his hand.
Name: Book 16

text: I wait for the right moment and Hagan gives it to me.
Name: Book 16

text: He drops a biker wielding a length of chain, temporarily making a hole in the crowd pressing around us.
Name: Book 16

text: I take it, ducking past Hagan and out of the fight.
Name: Book 16

text: I ignore the stream of obscenities Hagan tosses my way.
Name: Book 16

text: He probably thinks I am cutting and running.
Name: Book 16

text: Hopefully, so does everyone else.
Name: Book 16

text: No one stops me.
Name: Book 16

text: I get out the door but I dont stop running.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn the corner and come in through the side door.
Name: Book 16

text: It safer this way despite the extra time it takes me to get there.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have to fight through a wall of people to get to him.
Name: Book 16

text: It also has the benefit of surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: Who know what other tricks he might have up his sleeve.
Name: Book 16

text: The blow I deliver to the side of his head isnt enough to knock him out.
Name: Book 16

text: It does cause my quarters to go scattering about the bar as the roll finally comes apart in my hand.
Name: Book 16

text: It does have the desired effect.
Name: Book 16

text: His hold on the crowd breaks and they lose their willingness to fight.
Name: Book 16

text: I reach down and pry the pendant from his fingers while Hagan issues an ultimatum.
Name: Book 16

text: The words carry though he doesnt shout or scream.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyone who doesnt want a free trip to the hospital best leave now.
Name: Book 16

text: To emphasis his words, Hagan picks up the length of chain one of his attackers tried to use on him with no success.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt take long for the bar to clear out.
Name: Book 16

text: Those who were hurt are dragged out by friends or tossed out by Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: During which time I keep an eye on the guy.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt have anything else.
Name: Book 16

text: Good but now there is a bigger problem.
Name: Book 16

text: What do I do with this guy.
Name: Book 16

text: All my thoughts and concerns from earlier come back to haunt me.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not like I can have him arrested or anything.
Name: Book 16

text: He hasnt done anything the police will believe.
Name: Book 16

text: As it stands, he can have me arrested for assault.
Name: Book 16

text: After the last person leaves, Hagan offers a suggestion.
Name: Book 16

text: Is he kidding me.
Name: Book 16

text: I look up and quickly decide he is serious.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant believe this.
Name: Book 16

text: This isnt the dark ages.
Name: Book 16

text: You just dont execute people at the drop of the hat and thats exactly what this would be.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: If it was self-defense, I would have less of an issue, especially if it was me being defended, but this is murder.
Name: Book 16

text: I look past him to the bartenders.
Name: Book 16

text: All of them have disappeared except for Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: She stands there with her mouth hanging open in shock.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt believe this either.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs    You cant let him walk.
Name: Book 16

text: If you do, he will come for you.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes afraid right now but fear goes hand in hand with hatred.
Name: Book 16

text: Given a chance, hell try to repay me and Hagan back for this.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the look he gives Wendy that makes me shudder.
Name: Book 16

text: No, we cant let him walk, but there has to be another way.
Name: Book 16

text: If youre squeamish, take off and Ill handle it.
Name: Book 16

text: Can I let him kill this guy.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes but Im not going to.
Name: Book 16

text: One of the most precious things we have is life.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, I know youve heard it a thousand times.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not talking about his life.
Name: Book 16

text: I could care less if he had some sort of fatal accident.
Name: Book 16

text: After all the trouble he has caused, he deserves it.
Name: Book 16

text: No, Im talking about mine.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want to spend the rest of my life in jail.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if we were to get away with it, what would that do to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not interested in finding out.
Name: Book 16

text: This loser isnt worth it.
Name: Book 16

text: Killing is definitely something Im not going to contemplate unless there are no other options.
Name: Book 16

text: There is another way,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Wait, I say out loud while I direct the rest of my thoughts to Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: You can use the pendant to make him forget about all of this.
Name: Book 16

text: I smile, seeing where Kara is going with this.
Name: Book 16

text: I hadnt thought of that.
Name: Book 16

text: You mean I can erase his memory.
Name: Book 16

text: The magic of the pendant allows the holder to alter a persons mind.
Name: Book 16

text: You saw how it influenced everyone here.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, turning back to Hagan and Wendy.
Name: Book 16

text: This little snake is a mechanic, not a sorcerer.
Name: Book 16

text: All his magic is from this little trinket, I pried out of his hands.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan believes me but it doesnt change anything in his mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Whats to stop him from getting another one or something worse.
Name: Book 16

text: I hold up the pendant to Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: If he forgets about Wendy, magic and us, then the problem is solved.
Name: Book 16

text: She loses that deer in the headlights look while Hagan seems satisfied.
Name: Book 16

text: Can you do it.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes and its a better than killing him.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan doesnt agree with me but he doesnt argue the point.
Name: Book 16

text: I make a mental note to never get on this guys bad side while Kara guides me through what I need to do.
Name: Book 16

text: I take it slow and easy, keeping it simple.
Name: Book 16

text: That will do it.
Name: Book 16

text: He will forget all about Wendy and magic as well as you and Hagan.

text: As an afterthought, I add a few suggestions of my own with the last of the pendants power.

text: This guy needs help, so I tell him to go get some.

text: He might turn out the better for it.
Name: Book 16

text: I also tell him to give a little to charity each year.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone has to do it.
Name: Book 16

text: It might as well be him.
Name: Book 16

text: I would do it, but Im a little too selfish and cynical for that sort of thing.
Name: Book 16

text: It was a pretty nice piece of work for my first case.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan seems about to say something when someone bangs on the door to the apartment.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the sort of banging designed to get your attention, the kind that serves as a warning and prelude of things to come.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone wants inside and they arent going to take no for an answer.
Name: Book 16

text: Were all on our feet in an instant.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone outside yells, Open up.
Name: Book 16

text: This is the police.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Five.
Name: Book 16

text: Its always bad when the police are banging on your door.
Name: Book 16

text: At that point, you dont have a lot of options unless youve made extensive plans for just this sort of emergency.
Name: Book 16

text: My friends react instinctively.
Name: Book 16

text: They each pick the option that seems most logical to them.
Name: Book 16

text: In this situation, all of their responses are correct and all of them are wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer yells, Let me handle this, as she rushes into the room from the kitchen.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be smart to follow her lead.
Name: Book 16

text: As a DIA agent, she can smooth things over with the police.
Name: Book 16

text: The downside is the time.
Name: Book 16

text: While Jennifer straightens things out, the police would take everyone into custody.
Name: Book 16

text: It would take her time to get us released, time we dont have.
Name: Book 16

text: The polices arrival is no accident or coincidence.
Name: Book 16

text: They were sent here either by Meredith or Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: That means any delay works to their benefit and not ours.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagans reaction promises to save us a lot of time.
Name: Book 16

text: His sword clears leather.
Name: Book 16

text: He is ready to fight.
Name: Book 16

text: Violence is something Hagan excels at.
Name: Book 16

text: Im confident in his abilities to take down whoever is on the other side of the door.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, fighting the police is never a good idea.
Name: Book 16

text: It causes more problems than it's worth.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if youre justified in defending yourself, you still have to answer for doing so.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not an option.
Name: Book 16

text: These guys dont deserve to be cut down by Hagan for doing their job.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva opts for flight.
Name: Book 16

text: She is already opening a window to facilitate our escape.
Name: Book 16

text: Her choice is the middle ground between Hagan and Jennifers choices.
Name: Book 16

text: It would take time but not as much time as being locked up by the police and waiting for Jennifer to spring us.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not as fast as Hagans solution but it is far less violent.
Name: Book 16

text: I would be in favor of it except for one nagging detail.
Name: Book 16

text: Were on the fourth floor.
Name: Book 16

text: She and Hagan might be able to walk away from a fall this high.
Name: Book 16

text: The only place I would be going is back to the hospital or the morgue.
Name: Book 16

text: We have to fight,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Given a choice, she would have me avoid a fight and danger.
Name: Book 16

text: This time, she doesnt think there is a choice.
Name: Book 16

text: She shares my suspicion.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone sent the police here.
Name: Book 16

text: We cant waste time with them.
Name: Book 16

text: If that means people have to be hurt then she is fine with it.
Name: Book 16

text: I see another way.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric, we need you.
Name: Book 16

text: As the door shatters, Aleric emerges from the bedroom.
Name: Book 16

text: They dont bother with stun or gas grenades.
Name: Book 16

text: The police rely on speed and brute force.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer finds herself clubbed down before she can show her credentials.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats when they see Hagan and the sword.
Name: Book 16

text: They aim their weapons at him and yell for him to drop the sword.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not going to happen.
Name: Book 16

text: In another second, there will be blood.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric doesnt let that happen.
Name: Book 16

text: With a wave of his hand, he calls upon the glamour and his birthright to defuse things before they can get any worse.
Name: Book 16

text: The officers lower their weapons, looking confused.
Name: Book 16

text: They move about the apartment as if we dont exist for them.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: A disappointed Hagan lowers his sword as he realizes there will be no battle.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Nicely done, I say with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: For his part, Aleric nods at the compliment.
Name: Book 16
