text: I didnt know what he would do but it had to be better than chopping them to pieces.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, it couldnt have been easy for him.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what it cost him or how long he can maintain his spell.
Name: Book 16

text: To his credit, there isnt a hint of strain or tension in his voice as he speaks.
Name: Book 16

text: Fitzgerald has a holding in the Bronx.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not a residence, just a cave he discovered in Van Cortland Park.
Name: Book 16

text: I try and fail to keep my voice neutral.
Name: Book 16

text: A hint of dread creeps into my words.
Name: Book 16

text: Near the Yonkers border.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric confirms my fear.
Name: Book 16

text: That is very astute of you, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: He is there now with Meredith making preparations.
Name: Book 16

text: I should have seen it earlier,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a place of power.
Name: Book 16

text: We both should have seen this.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith knew about the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: It only stands to reason, he would know a little about its origins.
Name: Book 16

text: Its another little detail that fell by the wayside.
Name: Book 16

text: We should have had the place sealed up.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes me wonder what else we missed during those early cases.
Name: Book 16

text: And what do you plan to do about it.
Name: Book 16

text: Nothing more than what I have already done.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie have relinquished their claim on the cave and transferred ownership to Count.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems Lord Fitzgerald disagreed with the edict, The Fae Court is not a democracy.
Name: Book 16

text: They take a dim view of those who refuse royal edicts.
Name: Book 16

text: He has been disavowed.
Name: Book 16

text: You and your friends may deal with him accordingly when you go to claim your property.
Name: Book 16

text: Its my turn to ask a question.
Name: Book 16

text: Why not arrest him.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan answers for Aleric.
Name: Book 16

text: Because pointy ears doesnt want to risk any of his precious kin in a battle with Meredith or his pet.
Name: Book 16

text: I would have put it another way but essentially Hagan is correct.
Name: Book 16

text: I will not hazard my people against this Servitor unless there is no alternative, Aleric pauses to offer Hagan a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Unless you need me to fight your battles for you.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva steps between Aleric and Hagan before more than words can be exchanged.
Name: Book 16

text: When she leans close and speaks, Aleric forgets all about Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: Thank you and in a slightly lower voice she says, I take back all the things I was going to tell your girlfriend.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric doesnt give me a chance to ask what those things might be.
Name: Book 16

text: I will stay here and hold these gentlemen and their friends outside till you depart.
Name: Book 16

text: Just make sure you deal with Meredith and Lord Fitzgerald for this inconvenience.
Name: Book 16

text: No worries about that.
Name: Book 16

text: Just take care of Jennifer for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre not taking her with you.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes hurt and I dont know how badly.
Name: Book 16

text: Moving her might do more harm than good.
Name: Book 16

text: Anyway, shell be safer here.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer is a part of this now.
Name: Book 16

text: I feel bad about leaving her behind but she will be a lot safer with Aleric.
Name: Book 16

text: When she wakes up, she can come after us and coordinate things with the authorities.
Name: Book 16

text: To be honest, I didnt want a law enforcement or government agent with us when we confronted Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: This time there wasnt blood and violence.
Name: Book 16

text: When we meet Meredith, it will be a different story.
Name: Book 16

text: The three of us leave the apartment behind.
Name: Book 16

text: His voice is almost too soft to be heard.
Name: Book 16

text: Im gonna miss that place.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Six.
Name: Book 16

text: Things are moving faster than I like.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: Im sure Meredith feels the same way.
Name: Book 16

text: The pressure is on.
Name: Book 16

text: Both of us are acting quickly.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the only play either one of us has left.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive lost the element of surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: Alerics investigation tipped Meredith or Fitzgerald off.
Name: Book 16

text: The police were meant to delay us.
Name: Book 16

text: They cant be certain how much time it brought them.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith will have to cast his spell tonight.
Name: Book 16

text: Tomorrow will be too late.
Name: Book 16

text: He cant give me time to plan or gather allies.
Name: Book 16

text: Too many people, mundane and magical, want him.
Name: Book 16

text: Im in the same boat.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant give him time to cast his spell and awaken the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: If that happens, there wont be anything I can do except offer him my throat.
Name: Book 16

text: We both have to act now.
Name: Book 16

text: Were no longer racing against each other.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, we are racing towards each other.
Name: Book 16

text: The inevitable crash is not going to be pretty.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva is driving hard and fast, playing loose with the rules of the road.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not about to complain, were making good time.
Name: Book 16

text: In the back seat, Hagan looks out the rear window expecting pursuit.
Name: Book 16

text: The big man has been silent since we piled into Nervas car.
Name: Book 16

text: Something is on his mind.
Name: Book 16

text: I could ask him but he wont talk until he is good and ready.
Name: Book 16

text: The moment comes when we pass the Gracie Manor.
Name: Book 16

text: Do you have a plan.
Name: Book 16

text: The plan I have is an ugly misshapen thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Like some sort of Frankenstein monster, it is a jigsaw puzzle that still needs to be stitched together and electrified.
Name: Book 16

text: Its just pieces and fragments.
Name: Book 16

text: I could try and stall for time but my friends deserve better than that.
Name: Book 16

text: Hit fast, hit hard.
Name: Book 16

text: Take out Meredith and anyone in that cave before he can kill us.
Name: Book 16

text: When he realizes thats the extent of my plan, he just smiles and says, I like where your head is at.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva and Kara both make disgusted sounds that prove the two can actually agree from time to time.
Name: Book 16

text: This part of the park hasnt changed much.
Name: Book 16

text: I am looking forward to and dreading whats coming.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara takes my mind off of it for a moment.
Name: Book 16

text: She nestles comfortably in my thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: The cave isnt in sight from our vantage point but its image is burned into my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: If the Fae were interested in defending their holding, it would be a tough nut to crack.
Name: Book 16

text: Luckily, Aleric did us a favor when he had Fitzgerald disavowed.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone in his position would have retainers and bodyguards.
Name: Book 16

text: We no longer have to worry about them.
Name: Book 16

text: None would be willing to aid Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: The consequences would be too great.
Name: Book 16

text: Unfortunately, Meredith is still a sorcerer and he has the Servitor on his side.
Name: Book 16

text: My gift can keep me safe from magic but it can only do so much to protect me from his pet.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt know how much and I am not eager to find out.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan and Nerva wait for me to say something.
Name: Book 16

text: Neither one of them is a model of patience.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is spoiling for a fight.
Name: Book 16

text: He knew it would all come down to this when he first gave me the ring.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva wants to get this over with.
Name: Book 16

text: This is personal for her, as personal as it is for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever Fitzgerald did is way beyond him just casting a spell on her.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a stupid question.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is always ready for something like this and for a change Nerva is just as eager.
Name: Book 16

text: After we take out the Servitor, we can deal with Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not much of a plan  .
Name: Book 16

text: It is simple and far from elegant.
Name: Book 16

text: I wish I could come up with something better but Im out of ideas.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara doesnt voice an objection.
Name: Book 16

text: It wont work if we do it that way.
Name: Book 16

text: I look at him, waiting for an explanation.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not often he disagrees with a plan where he gets to do what he loves doing.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill handle the pet while you and Nerva deal with Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: It has to be this way.
Name: Book 16

text: We dont have a sorcerer and we cant give Meredith time to work his magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Im about to argue but I cant think of anything to say.
Name: Book 16

text: With no Dorward or Solomon, we have no one who can match Meredith in the magic department.
Name: Book 16

text: We give him enough time and he might be able to use it to get out of this or worse.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagans reasoning is sound but I dont like it.
Name: Book 16

text: I look to Nerva for an opinion.
Name: Book 16

text: Her expression remains carefully neutral.
Name: Book 16

text: From Kara, I get the sense she agrees with Hagan but is just as uneasy about it as I am.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever I do or say, I know they will back me up.
Name: Book 16

text: I go with my instincts and trust Hagans judgment.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have many friends.
Name: Book 16

text: I trust each one implicitly.
Name: Book 16

text: We do it your way.
Name: Book 16

text: You lead and Ill follow.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a brief moment when Kara seems to leave me and Hagan smiles.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the closest that I have ever seen him to being at peace.
Name: Book 16

text: The moment doesnt last long.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara flows back into my thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: What was that all about.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs, Just keeping a promise I made to him.
Name: Book 16

text: I still have some misgivings about splitting our strength but I cant think of a way around it without wasting time we dont have.
Name: Book 16

text: When we get to the cave, Ill head inside.
Name: Book 16

text: It isnt that big.
Name: Book 16

text: There wont be any place for Meredith to hide.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Out of sight from the city streets, we wait in the darkness.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure who has the best senses.
Name: Book 16

text: Its definitely not me.
Name: Book 16

text: I can barely make out the twisted trees around me.
Name: Book 16

text: I can only sense the danger that lies ahead.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths pet is here.
Name: Book 16

text: It waits somewhere ahead ready to devour us.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like the Fae have widened the trail.
Name: Book 16

text: Good, I wont have to worry about breaking my neck when Hagan gives the word.
Name: Book 16

text: It will be easier to navigate but no less perilous.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor will not let us by.
Name: Book 16

text: To get to Meredith, we have to get past it.
Name: Book 16

text: When Jennifer asked me how I can deal with this sort of stuff, I dodged the question.
Name: Book 16

text: It was easier to introduce her to the other side of magic.
Name: Book 16

text: That way she could find her own answer, the one that works for her.
Name: Book 16

text: My answer have always been, with a little help from my friends and, keep on moving forward.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: The word Now is barely out of Hagans mouth when he starts to move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: The big man takes the lead, pouring on the speed.
Name: Book 16

text: On my best day, I can sprint faster than Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: This isnt one of them.
Name: Book 16

text: My knee is still on the mend and I need to conserve my strength.
Name: Book 16

text: Im going to need to fight at the end of this run.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor coalesces around us to smother Hagans rush.
Name: Book 16

text: The ash grey cloud comes at us from every direction, even seeping out of the ground.
Name: Book 16

text: It smells worse than Meridiths building, bringing to mind trash day in the meat packing district during the height of summer.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva slows and I narrowly avoid slamming into her but Hagan doesnt stop or change course.
Name: Book 16

text: He deals with the horror the only way he knows how.
Name: Book 16

text: The draw is too quick for me to see in the darkness.
Name: Book 16

text: His sword flashes, cleaving the cloud as claws of smoke slash at him and shadowy tendrils seek to snare him.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagans sword does the impossible.
Name: Book 16

text: It cuts the Servitor.
Name: Book 16

text: The thing draws back in pain and surprise, clearing a path for us.
Name: Book 16

text: As it rises up behind us, the Servitor doesnt utter a sound.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no scream of pain or rage, no cry of frustration.
Name: Book 16

text: It is silent and implacable, already renewing its assault.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor flows after us, licking at our heels.
Name: Book 16

text: I see the crack.
Name: Book 16

text: The light shining from within the cave makes it easier to see.
Name: Book 16

text: Like the trail, it too has been widened and made easier to navigate.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan spins, placing his back to the opening while Nerva and I dart inside.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont like this but its the way Hagan wants to play it.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no time to wish him luck or say goodbye.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure he would hear it.
Name: Book 16

text: His attention is riveted on his opponent.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva yells and asks, Where to.
Name: Book 16

text: The cave is bigger than I remembered, lit by flickering torches.
Name: Book 16

text: At the rear of the cave, a tunnel beckons me deeper into the earth.
Name: Book 16

text: I point towards it and Nerva takes the lead.
Name: Book 16

text: I spare a moment to glance back at Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor pulls itself into a rough humanoid shape and towers over my friend.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the stuff of nightmares.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitors form is never at rest, always in motion like a dark miasma while at the same time being unsettling solid.
Name: Book 16

text: In this form, it is more disturbing and terrible than the cloud I have come to associate with it.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan must have seen me.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant do it.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant leave him alone against that thing but Hagan is right.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone has to deal with Meredith while he fights it.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara, can you help him.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes but.
Name: Book 16

text: I cut her off.
Name: Book 16

text: I know the rest of it.
Name: Book 16

text: She is about to say, but who will help you.
Name: Book 16

text: Go help Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: And Kara is gone.
Name: Book 16

text: The link is still there but it is a tenuous thing.
Name: Book 16

text: I curse and hurry to catch up to Nerva, running away from the image of Hagan rushing to meet his foe and the flash of claws and blood that proceed his screaming.
Name: Book 16

text: Down into the darkness we descend.
Name: Book 16

text: Was this passage always here or did the Fae dig it.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont need Karas senses or a spell to tell me this is the way to Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva slows her pace as the tunnel widens.
Name: Book 16

text: I brush past her into the cavern that opens before us.
Name: Book 16

text: There in the center of an inscription carved into the cold rock floor is Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: He stands there, as if he has been waiting all his life for this moment.
Name: Book 16

text: His singsong chant nearly falters when he notices our arrival.
Name: Book 16

text: Chalk one up to the big guy.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like Meredith was expecting the Servitor to buy him some time.
Name: Book 16

text: Its time to finish this.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a step forward when Nerva cries out a warning.
Name: Book 16

text: How many times can I be wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: This time, it is going to cost me.
Name: Book 16

text: I had forgotten about Fitzgerald.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie flashes me a sharp toothed smile as he darts towards me.
Name: Book 16

text: I am caught flatfooted and too close to avoid his sudden rush.
Name: Book 16

text: The knife in his hand catches the torchlight.
Name: Book 16

text: I have no doubts as to its sharpness.
Name: Book 16

text: There will be no avoiding its caress.
Name: Book 16

text: She slams into my attacker and the two go down in a heap.
Name: Book 16

text: They roll around, the knife rising and falling in counterpoint to the sound of flesh tearing and bones breaking.
Name: Book 16

text: I am about to go to Nervas aid when I realize Meredith has stopped chanting.
Name: Book 16

text: He finished his spell, whatever it was.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though Im not a sorcerer, I can feel the power of his spell as it takes shape.
Name: Book 16

text: There isnt time to stop it.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if I had the time, I dont know any spells to counter whatever he is doing.
Name: Book 16

text: The one thing I do know for certain is that Merediths spell doesnt have enough power to awaken the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, its powerful and partially backed by the energy of this place but not powerful enough.
Name: Book 16

text: It cant be the spell for awakening the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Its probably meant to take me and Nerva out.
Name: Book 16

text: Some guys never learn.
Name: Book 16

text: I brace myself for the impact, ready to use my gift, only to have the spell energy rush past me and out of the cave.
Name: Book 16

text: I get over myself and the surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith has done it to me again.
Name: Book 16

text: I have a flashback to my fight with the ogre.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems like the distant past.
Name: Book 16

text: I remember how G'rstaka hurt my knee.
Name: Book 16

text: More importantly, I remember how Meredith used him as a sacrifice.
Name: Book 16

text: What if he could do the same thing to the Servitor.
Name: Book 16

text: To sacrifice someone or something you need either a willing victim or the ability to destroy it utterly.
Name: Book 16

text: In the case of an unwilling victim, you need to be able to kill it.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor would be too powerful for Meredith to kill unless it was weakened.
Name: Book 16

text: Then it hits me.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan is doing just that.
Name: Book 16

text: He might also be a target for that spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Once more, I feel like Ive played into his hands.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont you ever get tired of failure.
Name: Book 16

text: His words make me flinch.
Name: Book 16

text: Was this what Hagan was afraid of.
Name: Book 16

text: While we fought the Servitor, Meredith would be free to do his little sacrifice and cast his ritual.
Name: Book 16

text: I can feel the rush of energy as Meredith makes a strangling motion with his hands.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor didnt make a sound in life.
Name: Book 16

text: In death, its sanity rending wail echoes down the tunnel.
Name: Book 16

text: Im out of time.
Name: Book 16

text: He has all the power he needs to awaken the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: I have to stop him but I dont know how.
Name: Book 16

text: Its Nervas pain wracked voice that motivates me.
Name: Book 16

text: She is still fighting and here I m standing around doing nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: It happens purely on instinct.
Name: Book 16

text: I use what Kara has taught me and all that I have learned about my gift.
Name: Book 16

text: I focus my will not at Meredith but at the energy around us.
Name: Book 16

text: He wants to use the power of this place and the Servitors sacrifice to awaken the Seven.
Name: Book 16

text: Touching the ring was bad enough, this is far worse.
Name: Book 16

text: The power of this place and the Servitors essence makes my skin crawl.
Name: Book 16

text: It feels like I am rotting away from the inside out but I dont stop.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith grunts in surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: He scrambles for a grip on his power before I can pull it from his grasp.
Name: Book 16

text: His curses fill the air as we play our complex game of tug of war.
Name: Book 16

text: He matches his knowledge and skill verses my gift and willpower.
Name: Book 16

text: Even with surprise on my side, its not enough.
Name: Book 16

text: My gift is perfect for this sort of battle but my inexperience is costing me.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive never tried to use it like this before.
Name: Book 16

text: I can delay Meredith but I cant stop him, not like this, not today.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt take him long to realize that.
Name: Book 16

text: He laughs at me.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith knows how close to winning he is.
Name: Book 16

text: Defeat is at most a minute away.
Name: Book 16

text: I remember an old saying  In a race against death, second place is someplace you dont want to be.
Name: Book 16

text: Second place might sound good but in the end, youre the one who lost.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant let that happen.
Name: Book 16

text: There is too much at stake.
Name: Book 16

text: I change tactics and do the unthinkable.
Name: Book 16

text: I stop fighting him.
Name: Book 16

text: I use my gift to reach far and wide for every bit of magic I can scrounge and then feed it into Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: I help him cast his spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Its like being in a warm cozy house while a blizzard rages outside.
Name: Book 16

text: Suddenly, some fool throws open the door for no apparent reason to let in the winter chill.
Name: Book 16

text: This time, Im the fool doing it.
Name: Book 16

text: I sense them awakening from their slumber.
Name: Book 16

text: Slow and lethargic, the Seven begin to rouse themselves ready to make themselves masters of this world.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith glows in triumph.
Name: Book 16

text: The excess energy bathes us both in liquid fire that flows between us.
Name: Book 16

text: With their awakening, magic becomes stronger giving me even more power to draw upon.
Name: Book 16

text: Sparks fly from his inscription.
Name: Book 16

text: His expression turns to fear and desperation as he realizes what I have done.
Name: Book 16

text: Its too much power for his purposes.
Name: Book 16

text: He is losing control and there is nothing he can do about it.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith wasnt ready for something like this.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive let go of the rope and he is flying backwards, out of control.
Name: Book 16

text: He is the one seconds from defeat and I cant help but smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Its small and petty to take pleasure in something like this but I can live with myself for it.
Name: Book 16

text: He, if any one does, deserves this end and it comes violently in a spectacular blaze of white fire.
Name: Book 16

text: The flame consumes body and soul.
Name: Book 16

text: The sound Meredith makes reminds me of the high pitched scream a lobster makes when tossed into a pot of boiling water.
Name: Book 16

text: No matter how painful it was for him, he got off lucky considering all the death and misery he was responsible for.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont savor my victory, otherwise it will be short lived.
Name: Book 16

text: I put Meredith and everything else out of my mind.
Name: Book 16

text: I focus on what I have to do.
Name: Book 16

text: There is only one chance at this.
Name: Book 16

text: If I get it wrong, Ill suffer the same fate as Meredith or worse.
Name: Book 16

text: I have two things going for me he doesnt have.
Name: Book 16

text: The world loses definition, disappearing from sight as I concentrate.
Name: Book 16

text: There is just the Bloodstone and the power flowing around me.
Name: Book 16

text: I take hold of them both.
Name: Book 16

text: The Bloodstone was made for this purpose.
Name: Book 16

text: It responds to my commands, eager to do my bidding.
Name: Book 16

text: All it needs is power and there is plenty of that around.
Name: Book 16

text: Even with my gift, it takes all my strength and will to hold onto the power without being consumed by it.
Name: Book 16

text: The taint that threatened to corrupt me is still there.
Name: Book 16

text: It burns me from the inside out, making the job that much more difficult.
Name: Book 16

text: The Bloodstone pulses in time to my heartbeat.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes all the power I am holding and stores it.
Name: Book 16

text: I take the next step.
Name: Book 16

text: I use the Bloodstone to undo the damage Meredith and I have done.
Name: Book 16

text: The old spell binding the Seven is gone, so I forge a new one.
Name: Book 16

text: I let my instincts guide me and use the ring to close the door we opened.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not a perfect solution.
Name: Book 16

text: I lack the knowledge and skill to put the Seven back to sleep.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont even try.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, I focus on the door to their prison.
Name: Book 16

text: I reinforce it with all the power in the Bloodstone so it will hold them at bay.
Name: Book 16

text: As I close and lock the door, one of the Seven, more awake than its fellows, makes a lunge forward.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know if it was quick enough or not.
Name: Book 16

text: I did the best I could do.
Name: Book 16

text: For the time being, its over.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seven are trapped once more.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Chapter Twenty Eight.
Name: Book 16

text: My awareness of the world around me returns.
Name: Book 16

text: I catch sight of Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes hurt, moving on autopilot right now.
Name: Book 16

text: Her smile, like her clothes, has seen better days.
Name: Book 16

text: I try not to notice just how much blood is on her and the bruises that mar her beauty.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes been punched, stabbed and slashed.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes me wonder how well Fitzgerald fared.
Name: Book 16

text: Then I see an arm that has been ripped out of its socket.
Name: Book 16

text: The knife is still clutched in its hand.
Name: Book 16

text: Its owner lies in a crumpled mass a dozen feet away.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont remember hearing Fitzgerald scream but he must have.
Name: Book 16

text: No one could take that sort of punishment and remain silent.
Name: Book 16

text: His remaining limbs are all in impossible angles and there is a ragged hole in his chest.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill check on Hagan while you finish up here, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: I watch her go, wondering what she means by that.
Name: Book 16

text: There is nothing more to do down here.
Name: Book 16

text: Fitzgerald and Meredith are dead.
Name: Book 16

text: She saw to the Fae and I took care of Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: His body is burned and blackened from the magic he was channeling.
Name: Book 16

text: It lies where he fell, in the center of his magic circle.
Name: Book 16

text: He has paid the price for his ambitions.
Name: Book 16

text: I am about to leave when I notice a wisp of smoke float up from the corpse.
Name: Book 16

text: A second later, there is another one.
Name: Book 16

text: With a start, I realize he is still alive.
Name: Book 16

text: After all this, Meredith is still alive and trying to speak.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know how or why.
Name: Book 16

text: Even worse, I dont know if I can put him out of his and my misery.
Name: Book 16

text: Im dying, He rasps.
Name: Book 16

text: It is so tempting to tell him to do it faster.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, I move closer to hear his last words.
Name: Book 16

text: I should gloat but I cant find it in me to do so.
Name: Book 16

text: I have no words for this man who has taught me to hate.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes not really speaking to me.
Name: Book 16

text: His words are to make his last moments more bearable.
Name: Book 16

text: It was never about the Bloodstone.
Name: Book 16

text: It was always about you and me, He makes a wet coughing sound that passes for laughter.
Name: Book 16

text: I couldnt have done it without you.
Name: Book 16

text: Together, we ushered in my new world.
Name: Book 16

text: They are awake and they wont rest until they are free.
Name: Book 16

text: I want to call him a liar.
Name: Book 16

text: They wont rest until they are free.
Name: Book 16

text: Its all a matter of when and how unless someone finds a way to put them to sleep again.
Name: Book 16

text: Merediths lips crack and split as he leers at me.
Name: Book 16

text: The Longest Road, youll walk it to stop them.
Name: Book 16

text: You will only find death at the end of your journey, His coughing continues, changing from humor to a death rattle.
Name: Book 16

text: I watch him die, just to make sure, then waste a few more seconds bidding farewell to Meredith.
Name: Book 16

text: When I am done spitting on his corpse, I realize Kara hasnt returned to me.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn and race up the tunnel, fearing the worse.
Name: Book 16

text: The Servitor is gone.
Name: Book 16

text: I find Hagan lying near the cave entrance in a pool of blood.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva sits close by him, cradling his head in her lap.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have any formal medical training but I know hes in a bad way.
Name: Book 16

text: Usually, its the bad guys who do the dying, not my friends.
Name: Book 16

text: Its funny in a tragic sort of way.
Name: Book 16

text: This all started with me getting the Bloodstone from Hagan.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like it is going to end that way.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is there, visible to the three of us as I crouch down next to my friend.
Name: Book 16

text: What do you say to someone who is dying.
Name: Book 16

text: How can you put into words all the things you feel in a sentence or two.
Name: Book 16

text: Hagan does it for me.
Name: Book 16

text: This was the battle I was looking for.
Name: Book 16

text: He takes his last breath with a smile and dies with no regrets.
Name: Book 16

text: I look up at Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: There are tears in her eyes.
Name: Book 16

text: I must escort Hagan to Vahalla,    She sees my expression and murmurs.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not what you think.
Name: Book 16

text: I will be back when I can.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod slowly, rising to kiss her softly.
Name: Book 16

text: I am sad to see her go but happy she will return.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill wait for you.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara shakes her head.
Name: Book 16

text: There is much to do.
Name: Book 16

text: You have to get moving.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 16

text: There are lessons you need to learn,    She smiles.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill catch up to you.
Name: Book 16

text: A final kiss then she and Hagan are gone.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva looks at me curiously before saying, So thats her, She smiles as I help her up.
Name: Book 16

text: Her injuries force her to lean on me for support.
Name: Book 16

text: No wonder youre so hard to corrupt.
Name: Book 16

text: We exit avoiding the police who are arriving on the scene.
Name: Book 16

text: Jennifer must have called them.
Name: Book 16

text: I think about phoning her then decide against it.
Name: Book 16

text: She has enough to do right now.
Name: Book 16

text: It will put off having to answer her questions.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not up to it right now.
Name: Book 16

text: All I want to do is go home and crash but I cant.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a lot to do.
Name: Book 16

text: My offer to drive earns me a dirty look from Nerva.
Name: Book 16

text: No one drives her mustang but her.
Name: Book 16

text: We drive to my place in silence.
Name: Book 16

text: She stays just under the speed limit and doesnt take any chances.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva just wants to get me home in one piece.
Name: Book 16

text: Its probably the safest she has even driven.
Name: Book 16

text: As we pull in, she breaks the silence.
Name: Book 16

text: I know that look, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: I flash Nerva a smile, hoping it is not as tired as I feel.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the best I can do in the present circumstances.
Name: Book 16

text: Im thinking about Hagan and what Kara said.
Name: Book 16

text: I have things to do.
Name: Book 16

text: Can you and Sol keep an eye on my place while Im gone.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva takes a hand off the wheel long enough to pinch me before replying.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, but youll owe me one, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: Will I ever get out of debt.
Name: Book 16

text: Not in this lifetime.
Name: Book 16

text: Nerva doesnt say good bye.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not her style.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, she steals a kiss.
Name: Book 16

text: Its almost enough to make me stick around longer.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont promise to keep in touch.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have to.
Name: Book 16

text: Weve been friends long enough to know Ill call when I can and shell answer when she can.
Name: Book 16

text: Who could ask for anything more.
Name: Book 16

text: As I climb the stairs up to my apartment, I think about my next move.
Name: Book 16

text: Meredith talked about the Longest Road.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what its all about.
Name: Book 16

text: I just know I need to learn more about it and the Seven before I decide on a course of action.
Name: Book 16

text: There will be others looking to follow in Merediths footsteps.
Name: Book 16

text: Something has to be done about them.
Name: Book 16

text: By the time I walk into my apartment, I know how and where to start.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt take long to pack a few things for the trip.
Name: Book 16

text: I planned for something like this a while back when I first got in trouble with the law.
Name: Book 16

text: I have enough cash left over from my last case to travel, but not in style.
Name: Book 16

text: Itll have to do.
Name: Book 16

text: When I leave my place, the sun is just coming up.
Name: Book 16

text: I can hear the birds singing.
Name: Book 16

text: It is morning and the dawn of a new day, maybe even a new era.
Name: Book 16

text: I have a lot of things to do and more importantly learn.
Name: Book 16

text: Whether the Longest Road is part of it or not remains to be seen.
Name: Book 16

text: I am almost to the corner when Jennifers car pulls up alongside of me.
Name: Book 16

text: Are you going to take me in or something.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a valid question.
Name: Book 16

text: I look into Jennifers eyes as she opens the door for me.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes telling the truth yet I hesitate.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know where things will take me or the dangers I might have to face.
Name: Book 16

text: Do I want to drag her along.
Name: Book 16

text: My knee makes the decision for me, riding is better than walking.
Name: Book 16

text: I slide into the passenger seat.
Name: Book 16

text: Where to.
Name: Book 16

text: she asks.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill think of something but west is as good a direction as any.
Name: Book 16

text: #  Bonus Story: The Path Taken.
Name: Book 16

text: Its good to be out of the city.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a thought and feeling echoed by my guardian angel.
Name: Book 16

text: Ever since I got back to from my trip, I have been out of sorts.
Name: Book 16

text: I tried to go back to my usual routine but it hasnt worked out.
Name: Book 16

text: Its like Ive been trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont worry, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre just adjusting to your new life.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas voice reassures me more than her words do.
Name: Book 16

text: All of my friends and co- workers were clueless.
Name: Book 16

text: He considered himself a shaman.
Name: Book 16

text: He wasnt pretentious about it.
Name: Book 16

text: I always respected his words, beliefs, and feelings while others looked down on them.
Name: Book 16

text: When I got back from Oklahoma, he knew there was something different about me.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt have to tell him about Kara or what happened on the road.
Name: Book 16

text: He just knew that I needed to find my way.
Name: Book 16

text: Orion said that he knew the perfect place for me to visit.
Name: Book 16

text: I wasnt quite so sure about that but there was no arguing with him.
Name: Book 16

text: Im less sure when I get off the bus.
Name: Book 16

text: This is the second bus trip this month that has led to the unexpected.
Name: Book 16

text: The bus stop is along a deserted and unwelcoming stretch of road.
Name: Book 16

text: The driver doesnt give me time to reconsider my decision.
Name: Book 16

text: The bus pulls off in a hurry, eager to continue on its way and leave me behind.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara makes a noise of discontent as we watch it go.
Name: Book 16

text: The next bus wouldnt be along till the morning.
Name: Book 16

text: It is close to sunset when I find what I am looking for.
Name: Book 16

text: The driveway is overgrown and stretched into the forest.
Name: Book 16

text: A battered wooden sign reads: Welcome to Stone Mountain.
Name: Book 16

text: Orion had given me a little history lesson before I left New York.
Name: Book 16

text: Back in the 30s and 40s, Stone Mountain was something of a winter hotspot.
Name: Book 16

text: Its location, close to the Hudson River and major roadways, made it easy to get to.
Name: Book 16

text: People would come from miles around to ski down one of the three trails here.
Name: Book 16

text: When World War II started, the place died.
Name: Book 16

text: People had more important things to do than ski.
Name: Book 16

text: Stone Mountain suffered a mortal wound that it never recovered from.
Name: Book 16

text: Some of Orions friends pooled their resources and brought the land.
Name: Book 16

text: Like the driveway, the area that was once the resorts parking lot is overgrown.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas voice is getting easier to hear especially with night approaching.
Name: Book 16

text: Her presence is something else that I need to make sense of.
Name: Book 16

text: I can hardly believe it sometimes.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats when I get the feeling we are not alone.
Name: Book 16

text: Good,    she says,    You can feel it too.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes me a moment to spot the slightly overweight man walking out of the forest.
Name: Book 16

text: There is nothing out of the ordinary about him except for his lack of clothing.
Name: Book 16

text: Its late November and he is dressed only in a simple dark brown vest and pants.
Name: Book 16

text: No shoes protect his feet yet he walks sure footed across the parking lot.
Name: Book 16

text: In his hands, a set of wooden pipes can be seen.
Name: Book 16

text: As he nears me, something changes.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever illusion was cloaking him wavers and dissipates.
Name: Book 16

text: His features dont change much, except for his eyes, which seem to twinkle and glitter in the darkening light.
Name: Book 16

text: The ears are now pointed though not enough to call attention away from his goat legs and hooves.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead of pants, he wears a loin cloth that matches his brown vest.
Name: Book 16

text: My voice sounds squeaky even to my own ears.
Name: Book 16

text: It gets a laugh out of my goat legged friend.
Name: Book 16

text: And you are pretty observant for one of your kind.
Name: Book 16

text: You may call me Nightbringer, he says.
Name: Book 16

text: And you can call me Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Is that a name or a title.
Name: Book 16

text: he asks with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Im a friend of Orion, I say, finally getting over some of my nervousness.
Name: Book 16

text: Ah, someone else with a strange name but not a stranger, Nightbringer turns and heads back into the woods.
Name: Book 16

text: If youre a friend of his, youre welcome to guest at my camp for as long as you like.
Name: Book 16

text: Just mind your manners, He warns.
Name: Book 16

text: Without another word, I follow Nightbringer deeper into the woods as Kara murmurs,    Hes right.
Name: Book 16

text: You need to be careful.
Name: Book 16

text: Orion wouldnt send us into danger without a warning,    I reply, careful to internalize my words.
Name: Book 16

text: He didnt tell you what you were getting into either.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, he doesnt know,    Kara pauses for a moment, as if she is taking a deep breath or figuring out the best way to tell me something.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, youre still new at this and the Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: They can be hard to deal with.
Name: Book 16

text: Hey, Im not quite helpless, you know.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer picks this moment to interrupt my talk with Kara with a question of his own.
Name: Book 16

text: So, how was it that you could see through my glamour.
Name: Book 16

text: Are you a sorcerer.
Name: Book 16

text: I answer with his question with one of my own The glamour.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the way we use magic.
Name: Book 16

text: We Fae can use it to shape the world around us and the perceptions of those who walk through our lands.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod, remembering all the stories about the Fae and their magic.
Name: Book 16

text: The story of Cinderella and how her fairy god mother turned a pumpkin into a carriage comes to mind.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats a good example of how glamour can be used.
Name: Book 16

text: It is their defense and protection in a world that is getting smaller every day,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: And how was I able to see through it.
Name: Book 16

text: Call it a gift.
Name: Book 16

text: A gift, I echo her words out loud before I realize I am doing it.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a mighty fine one, Nightbringer replies without missing a beat.
Name: Book 16

text: And be careful.
Name: Book 16

text: You dont want people to think youre crazy.
Name: Book 16

text: Sorry, Im still getting used to you being in my head.
Name: Book 16

text: The deeper we travel into the forest, the more magical it becomes.
Name: Book 16

text: The glamour hides these sights from unwelcome visitors but I see it in all its glory.
Name: Book 16

text: Colored lights of faerie fire paint the world in their unearthly glow.
Name: Book 16

text: The trees and plant life are more vivid in color.
Name: Book 16

text: It makes everything so much more beautiful.
Name: Book 16

text: As we step out into a clearing that is dominated by a fairy ring and large bonfire, I spot the inhabitants of this enchanted place.
Name: Book 16

text: Here, the evening festivities are well underway.
Name: Book 16

text: Elves mingle freely with the other Fae of Stone Mountain and their few human guests.
Name: Book 16

text: They come in all shapes and sizes.
Name: Book 16

text: Some are too beautiful for words, while others are grotesque beyond imagining.
Name: Book 16

text: It is enough to take my breath away.
Name: Book 16

text: This place is a safe haven and gathering place for the Seelie.
Name: Book 16

text: Please, enjoy yourself, Nightbringer says.
Name: Book 16

text: The satyr doesnt leave me to my own devices.
Name: Book 16

text: He takes his duty as host seriously.
Name: Book 16

text: He shows me around the camp site while Kara fills me in on some details about the Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: One people, they are divided into two courts.
Name: Book 16

text: The Seelie or Blessed Court is made up of the more benevolent Fae.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats not to say they were all goody two shoes.
Name: Book 16

text: Far from it, they can be capricious and cruel when given reason.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie dont need a reason.
Name: Book 16

text: I wouldnt call them evil but you dont have to be evil to be bad news.
Name: Book 16

text: Both courts have outposts and settlements scattered across the world.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, please watch what to say and do,    Kara doesnt wait for me to ask why.
Name: Book 16

text: Her advice would be sound for any occasion.
Name: Book 16

text: Intrigue is a game to them.
Name: Book 16

text: There is always some kind of plot going on.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be best not to be drawn into anything,    She warns.
Name: Book 16

text: After the tour, Nightbringer leaves me to attend to the other guests.
Name: Book 16

text: Throughout the night, he checks up on me or makes it a point to introduce me to another one of his guests.
Name: Book 16

text: Its all part of his roguish charm, even Kara finds herself enjoying the night.
Name: Book 16

text: A brownie offers me a drink from his flask.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a sip despite Karas warning.
Name: Book 16

text: The world spins for a moment before returning to normal.
Name: Book 16

text: I resolve never to do that again.
Name: Book 16

text: The stuff is worse than Lithuanian moonshine.
Name: Book 16

text: My insides will never be the same.
Name: Book 16

text: I step into the woods to collect myself as Kara chides me for my recklessness.
Name: Book 16

text: Thats when I hear a woman scream.
Name: Book 16

text: And just like that, I am plunging into the forest like some hero in a fantasy novel.
Name: Book 16

text: The screaming stops just as I find its source.
Name: Book 16

text: A woman, a beautiful one at that, leans against a tree trying to catch her breath.
Name: Book 16

text: Are you okay, I ask.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont have time to say or do anything else before Kara cries a warning.
Name: Book 16

text: Look out.
Name: Book 16

text: she yells.
Name: Book 16

text: I hear something behind me, the clopping of hooves moving fast.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no time to dodge so I just relax and prepare for the worst.
Name: Book 16

text: Yeah, I know it sounds strange.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe relax is the wrong word for what I do.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont let myself tense up.
Name: Book 16

text: Rigid and inflexible things tend to break when they get hit.
Name: Book 16

text: Less than a heartbeat later, something hard smashes into the small of my back with the impact of a wrecking ball.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive been kicked before but never like this.
Name: Book 16

text: Its powerful, reminding me of all those animal documentaries.
Name: Book 16

text: I roll forward with the force of the blow letting it carry me away from my attacker.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a little showy and not planned.
Name: Book 16

text: I somehow roll to my feet.
Name: Book 16

text: I even manage to spin around to face my opponent.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer charges me again, looking every bit as wild and dangerous as a drunken satyr can be.
Name: Book 16

text: As he launches another kick at me, he yells, Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know if its a battle cry or the girls name.
Name: Book 16

text: I could care less.
Name: Book 16

text: Out of habit, I block the kick even though Ive moved out of its path.
Name: Book 16

text: The lessons learned in karate class are put to use once more.
Name: Book 16

text: I return the favor, delivering a shin kick.
Name: Book 16

text: Its not one of my best moves.
Name: Book 16

text: Im more of a puncher than a kicker but my kick does land.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer still hasnt recovered from his own kick.
Name: Book 16

text: He is still off balance when mine lands.
Name: Book 16

text: It smacks him in the midsection causing him to double over in pain.
Name: Book 16

text: I am about to follow it up when the woman I came to rescue yells, Stop it, both of you.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes all my willpower not to throw the punch I was planning.
Name: Book 16

text: My heart is beating hard and fast like it always does when I fight.
Name: Book 16

text: Instead, I let go of the rush.
Name: Book 16

text: I hold my ground and wait.
Name: Book 16

text: If Nightbringer attacks, Ill defend myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara picks that moment to give me the bad news.
Name: Book 16

text: Keep in mind, were in the middle of an enchanted forest.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont think his friends will just let you walk out of here if you rough him up too badly.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre talking out loud again.
Name: Book 16

text: This man came to my aid, Nightbringer, The woman says.
Name: Book 16

text: Another voice, one I dont recognize, adds, And once more we see that you are not a proper host.
Name: Book 16

text: Is this is the way you treat your guests.
Name: Book 16

text: All of us turn to glance at the new speaker.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer spits the word, Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: The newcomer acknowledges his name with a slight bow.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalens smile troubles me.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know whats going on but I get the feeling that I am now in the middle of something.
Name: Book 16

text: For his part, Nightbringer ignores the Fae to see to the woman.
Name: Book 16

text: As the two of them talk, I look Kalen up and down.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a coldness to him.
Name: Book 16

text: He didnt come to Nightbringers camp to relax or enjoy himself.
Name: Book 16

text: He came to cause trouble.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara murmurs,    He is an Unselee.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown, repeating my earlier words.
Name: Book 16

text: This time I remember to internalize them.
Name: Book 16

text: Great, just great.
Name: Book 16

text: What else can go wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: They are full of questions and reproach.
Name: Book 16

text: The festive attitude of the night is replaced by business, politics and intrigue.
Name: Book 16

text: I try to figure out what is going on as they speak amongst themselves.
Name: Book 16

text: The woman picks this moment to approach me while Nightbringer leads his guest back to camp.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer apologizes for his actions, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: It would mean more coming from him but its alright, Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: This wasnt her fault.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no reason to take it out on her.
Name: Book 16

text: The woman smiles hesitantly but doesnt correct me.
Name: Book 16

text: It was just a misunderstanding, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: One engineered by Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, our home is in danger, She says.
Name: Book 16

text: I frown at Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: What do you mean in danger.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer attacked a guest without cause who he was honor bound to protect and shelter.
Name: Book 16

text: It is a serious offense among our kind, I nod, not understanding.
Name: Book 16

text: The satyr was only trying to protect Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn my thoughts inward to Kara, hoping she has answers for me.
Name: Book 16

text: She doesnt but Rook does shed more light on the situation.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen wishes to use this incident as an excuse to take control of our territory.
Name: Book 16

text: He has called for an Arbiter to settle the matter.
Name: Book 16

text: When you said engineered, what did you mean.
Name: Book 16

text: Did he make you scream.
Name: Book 16

text: It is something I cannot prove but it is my belief.
Name: Book 16

text: The timing was too convenient.
Name: Book 16

text: I had a vision.
Name: Book 16

text: Shes a seer,    Its not often that I hear or sense surprise from my guardian angel.
Name: Book 16

text: A flood of images and references flicker across the link.
Name: Book 16

text: People really cant see the future.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be too easy if everything was preordained and written in stone.
Name: Book 16

text: There will always be things that are out of our control.
Name: Book 16

text: You can call it luck, destiny or the universe conspiring against you.
Name: Book 16

text: The rest are all a product of our actions or inaction.
Name: Book 16

text: So where do seers and prophets fit in.
Name: Book 16

text: Its like dealing with your average stock market analyst.
Name: Book 16

text: He or she isnt always correct but the good ones can tell you what is most likely to happen with the market based on current events and trends.
Name: Book 16

text: At least, thats my take on the matter.
Name: Book 16

text: It remains to be seen if Im correct.
Name: Book 16

text: I shift my attention back to Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: What did you see.
Name: Book 16

text: I saw you, She says with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: We walk a short distance to the edge of a stream.
Name: Book 16

text: Here, in the darkness only lit by wisps of light, I study her gentle features.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know how to describe her.
Name: Book 16

text: To merely call Rook beautiful or attractive would be a disservice.
Name: Book 16

text: She is a living paradox.
Name: Book 16

text: Youthful while projecting a sense of timeless grace, her presence is commanding without being overpowering.
Name: Book 16

text: She is friendly and approachable yet reserved.
Name: Book 16

text: I find out her full name is Rook Half- Elven.
Name: Book 16

text: Her name and heritage set her apart from most people, even those who know who and what she is.
Name: Book 16

text: Unlike her elven kin, she wears her reddish brown hair short which does nothing to mar her looks.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, you have chosen your path even though you do not know it yet.
Name: Book 16

text: You have started a journey but you do not know your destination, She says in a grave voice.
Name: Book 16

text: And you are confusing me.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook offers me another smile before looking into the water.
Name: Book 16

text: When I speak of a vision, I can only put it into words that I can understand.
Name: Book 16

text: By the end of this weekend, you will know your path, though not where it will take you.
Name: Book 16

text: I direct my thoughts to Kara again Is she on the level.
Name: Book 16

text: I think she is telling you the truth about whatever it was she saw,    After a moment of hesitation, Kara adds,    She might not be telling you everything.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod slowly, focusing on Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: So why did you cry out.
Name: Book 16

text: A hint of red touches Rooks cheeks.
Name: Book 16

text: I cant help smiling as she averts her eyes from me.
Name: Book 16

text: I was not prepared to see so much.
Name: Book 16

text: Yet youve told me so little, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: I am also limited by what I can understand.
Name: Book 16

text: You are an enigma, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Somehow, I get the feeling there is much more to her vision than she is telling me.
Name: Book 16

text: I decide to shift the topic back to Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: If hes going to be trouble, I want to be prepared.
Name: Book 16

text: So, do you know what Kalen is up to.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook considers the water for a moment, still avoiding my gaze.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont press her.
Name: Book 16

text: I wait patiently for her to reply.
Name: Book 16

text: When she does, her voice is sad almost like she is in mourning already.
Name: Book 16

text: That is up to you.
Name: Book 16

text: By our laws, an Arbiter will come to settle your dispute with Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: If you pursue the matter, Nightbringer will lose the land.
Name: Book 16

text: It will be yours to claim, should you wish it.
Name: Book 16

text: I discard that notion immediately.
Name: Book 16

text: This was all a mistake, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not about to screw him or you over.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre a good man, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: The problem is Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: He will still use the incident to show Nightbringer is not fit to govern here.
Name: Book 16

text: He will challenge him to a duel, one he cannot win in his condition.
Name: Book 16

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 16

text: It should be a fair fight.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook shakes her head.
Name: Book 16

text: I am also a healer.
Name: Book 16

text: Your kick hurt Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: I think you might have broken one or two of his ribs.
Name: Book 16

text: He will be no match for Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie will kill him and take all that he holds dear.
Name: Book 16

text: Including Rook,    Kara says sadly.
Name: Book 16

text: No, not going to happen, This time I know my internal reply is being spoken out loud.
Name: Book 16

text: I wish to ask you a boon.
Name: Book 16

text: If you would save Nightbringer, pursue your claim.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen will not be able to touch him, She then touches my cheek and murmurs I would be in your debt.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe that is what she saw.
Name: Book 16

text: I find myself tempted by the offer and feelings.
Name: Book 16

text: I also find myself a little disgusted with myself.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive never taken advantage of a woman before.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not about to start now.
Name: Book 16

text: I need a new plan.
Name: Book 16

text: If its a duel, doesnt Nightbringer get to have a second to fight for him because he is unable.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not sure who will answer me first.
Name: Book 16

text: Im desperate for answers.
Name: Book 16

text: After his attack on you, no one would do such a thing.
Name: Book 16

text: He was clearly in the wrong.
Name: Book 16

text: If his guilt was in doubt, many would come to his aid.
Name: Book 16

text: Well, we better get back.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont do anything stupid,    Kara warns.
Name: Book 16

text: I assure her its already too late when I say Trust me.
Name: Book 16

text: The party is over.
Name: Book 16

text: More than few fix me with flat unfriendly gazes.
Name: Book 16

text: I am an outsider and part of the problem.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though it wasnt my fault, I am being used as a pawn in this game.
Name: Book 16

text: I get the impression some of Nightbringers friends might take it upon themselves to make sure I dont leave these woods alive.
Name: Book 16

text: That is when Kara points out a tall Fae who stands apart from the rest.
Name: Book 16

text: Excuse me, are you the Arbiter.
Name: Book 16

text: Its a guess on my part.
Name: Book 16

text: From his bearing, it would make sense, but why is he here now.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook thought it would take some time before he arrived.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, I am Aleric the Strong, The Fae replies.
Name: Book 16

text: There is no hint of a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: His name and title are said as if he were speaking a universal truth, not some idle bit of posturing.
Name: Book 16

text: There is a story to go with my title but you did not seek me out for that.
Name: Book 16

text: I thought it would take more time to summon an Arbiter.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric gives me a hard look, his eyes narrow slightly.
Name: Book 16

text: Yes, it would have taken longer but I happened to be in the neighborhood.
Name: Book 16

text: I guess it was fortunate for Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: More likely, it was part of Kalens plan.
Name: Book 16

text: I doubt Aleric is part of this.
Name: Book 16

text: If anyone ever looked incorruptible, its this man.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell stick to the letter and spirit of the law when it comes time to make a ruling.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell supervise Nightbringers murder in the guise of a duel.
Name: Book 16

text: Alerics next words confirm my suspicions and add a slight chill to the air.
Name: Book 16

text: I do not like being used.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen is safe from my wrath but you, my friend, are not.
Name: Book 16

text: What is it that you want.
Name: Book 16

text: he asks.
Name: Book 16

text: You think Im part of this set up.
Name: Book 16

text: His look says it all.
Name: Book 16

text: I take a moment to swallow my anger before continuing.
Name: Book 16

text: Im just curious about something.
Name: Book 16

text: If I dont press my claim, can I choose to be Nightbringers second.
Name: Book 16

text: The question catches Aleric by surprise.
Name: Book 16

text: He gives me another look, this one more appraising.
Name: Book 16

text: You could, but why would you want to.
Name: Book 16

text: It would be unheard of.
Name: Book 16

text: But it would be legal.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt know what I am up to.
Name: Book 16

text: Just like the Arbiter, I dont like being used.
Name: Book 16

text: Im going to set things right and get a little payback.
Name: Book 16

text: I might have been wrong in my assessment of you.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what you are planning but I wish you luck with it.
Name: Book 16

text: Youre going to need it,    Kara murmurs.
Name: Book 16

text: It doesnt take me long to find Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: He seems pleased with himself.
Name: Book 16

text: I make it my business to wreck his mood.
Name: Book 16

text: I hear Nightbringers fate is in my hands, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: This causes Kalen to give me a very unfriendly look.
Name: Book 16

text: You could put it that way.
Name: Book 16

text: What is it that you want.
Name: Book 16

text: You have nothing to offer me.
Name: Book 16

text: I direct my question to Kara,    A boon.
Name: Book 16

text: What is he talking about.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara is quick to give me an answer.
Name: Book 16

text: It was as if she had been waiting for this question all night.
Name: Book 16

text: The Fae dont accept payment in coin.
Name: Book 16

text: They deal in boons and favors.
Name: Book 16

text: For them, a whispered word or favor is more valuable than wealth.
Name: Book 16

text: The more people who owe you, the more power you have in their little games.
Name: Book 16

text: A boon from the right person can be very useful.
Name: Book 16

text: If you say you owe a Fae, he or she will collect one day.
Name: Book 16

text: I wouldnt feel right about handing over my land once I claim it.
Name: Book 16

text: Only with effort does Kalen get his voice under control again.
Name: Book 16

text: You cant do that, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems like a nice place to build a house, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara laughs at that.
Name: Book 16

text: She didnt expect me to say that.
Name: Book 16

text: She thought I would take a more direct approach.
Name: Book 16

text: Sometimes she forgets, I like to use my brain before my brawn.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen seems beside himself with anger.
Name: Book 16

text: He didnt really plan on me pressing my claim.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe he intended to be the one Nightbringer attacked.
Name: Book 16

text: Whatever the case may be, his plan is now in danger.
Name: Book 16

text: I suppose I could just give the land to whomever I chose, even back to Nightbringer, Now, I smile.
Name: Book 16

text: Its the sort of expression a used car salesman tried to use on me once.
Name: Book 16

text: It gets my point across.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelies hands open and close as if he wishes they were throttling me.
Name: Book 16

text: You would make a mockery of our laws, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: I would, but I doubt Aleric would allow such a thing.
Name: Book 16

text: Then again, he might just get repay Kalen.
Name: Book 16

text: Someone did that already when they set Nightbringer up.
Name: Book 16

text: Course, if you have a different idea.
Name: Book 16

text: I am all ears.
Name: Book 16

text: Ah, I get it now.
Name: Book 16

text: You want to make a deal.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen pauses, raising his voice so that all can hear our bargain.
Name: Book 16

text: Any agreement would be useless without witnesses or a way to enforce our deal.
Name: Book 16

text: I can see offering you a boon in return for letting me deal with Nightbringer concerning his attack on you.
Name: Book 16

text: I reply in an equally loud voice Ill let you present your case to the Arbiter, if that is what you mean.
Name: Book 16

text: It is, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: Then we shouldnt have a problem.
Name: Book 16

text: I say using the same smile from earlier.
Name: Book 16

text: No sooner than we finish shaking hands does Kara say,    I hope you know what you are doing.
Name: Book 16

text: You just doomed Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: Before I can fill Kara in on the rest of my plan, someone spins me around.
Name: Book 16

text: I see the look of shock and betrayal on Rooks face before her slap rocks my world.
Name: Book 16

text: You have chosen your path, base one, She screams, before storming off to rejoin Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen watches her go, leering at her retreating figure.
Name: Book 16

text: I will keep her out of trouble once Nightbringer is dead.
Name: Book 16

text: The half elven will be too busy to think of you.
Name: Book 16

text: Only if I screw up,    I murmur to Kara.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen doesnt waste any time calling out Nightbringer for his attack on me.
Name: Book 16

text: I see the expression on the satyrs face.
Name: Book 16

text: He has no choice but to accept.
Name: Book 16

text: Honor and pride demand it.
Name: Book 16

text: I let him do what he has to do then I do what I have to do.
Name: Book 16

text: I raise my voice so that I can be heard by the crowd present.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill be Nightbringers second.
Name: Book 16

text: I am rewarded with chaos and mayhem.
Name: Book 16

text: It takes Aleric several minutes to restore order.
Name: Book 16

text: Only Kara knew what I was planning.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric had a good idea but he wasnt sure I would go through with it.
Name: Book 16

text: No one else, not even the seer, had forseen this.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen is furious with righteous indignation.
Name: Book 16

text: I resist the urge to laugh.
Name: Book 16

text: You honorless gutless cur.
Name: Book 16

text: And why is that.
Name: Book 16

text: Because I wont let you butcher Nightbringer under the pretense of a duel.
Name: Book 16

text: Hes hurt and in no shape to fight you.
Name: Book 16

text: It is the only honorable thing to do, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: And what of your word.
Name: Book 16

text: His tone is low and dangerous.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont try to keep the anger out of my voice.
Name: Book 16

text: I said I would let you press charges on my behalf.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt promise anything else.
Name: Book 16

text: If you wanted something more, you should have said so.
Name: Book 16

text: That stops Kalen in his tracks.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like this round goes to me.
Name: Book 16

text: Well played, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: The smile he gives me is chilling.
Name: Book 16

text: Then again, maybe not.
Name: Book 16

text: If you want to throw your life away in a duel against me then so be it.
Name: Book 16

text: Wait, the duel doesnt have to be to the death, Nightbringer says.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me time to close my mouth.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt think this part through.
Name: Book 16

text: If Kalen was willing to kill one of his own kind for this land and Rook, he would have no problems killing an outsider like me.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont kid yourself, Nightbringer, Kalen says.
Name: Book 16

text: We both know I was going to kill you, even this uppity mortal knew that.
Name: Book 16

text: A pity he wanted to be clever.
Name: Book 16

text: Hell die in your place as a lesson to anyone else who seeks to get the better of me.
Name: Book 16

text: Isnt there something like a choice of weapons.
Name: Book 16

text: Choose any weapon you like, fool, He sneers.
Name: Book 16

text: I will be able to use all my powers and abilities to destroy you.
Name: Book 16

text: Your crude physical talents will do you no good, mortal.
Name: Book 16

text: The battle will be tomorrow afternoon in the light of day.
Name: Book 16

text: It will give both of you time to prepare.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen frowns, not liking this one bit.
Name: Book 16

text: He is ready and eager to kill me now.
Name: Book 16

text: With a shrug, he relents.
Name: Book 16

text: It will give the mortal time to make peace with his misbegotten maker or to flee.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, doing so will mean I win by forfeit.
Name: Book 16

text: Dont worry your pretty little head about that, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: I plan on sticking around.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook and Nightbringer just stare at me as I unroll my sleeping bag.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer is the first to voice his thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: Why am I fighting him or why didnt I just keep it between us.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill let you decide which question to answer friend, he says.
Name: Book 16

text: You have to deal with this guy here and now.
Name: Book 16

text: Some problems cant be left to fester.
Name: Book 16

text: Theyll only get worse, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: I see, Nightbringer says with a smile.
Name: Book 16

text: You think like a warrior.
Name: Book 16

text: Meaning not enough,    Kara mutters across the link.
Name: Book 16

text: I need to get some rest.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook leans over to plant a kiss on my cheek on the spot where she slapped me.
Name: Book 16

text: Count, I am so sorry.
Name: Book 16

text: I didnt know what you were about.
Name: Book 16

text: You are risking a great deal.
Name: Book 16

text: I hope you know what youre doing.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone keeps asking me that.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not going to let Kalen murder me.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara grumbles across our link,    He might not give you a choice.
Name: Book 16

text: Breakfast is filled with talk.
Name: Book 16

text: As I eat what could be my last meal, Nightbringer goes over the rules.
Name: Book 16

text: It seems pretty clear cut.
Name: Book 16

text: Still, I have a question.
Name: Book 16

text: If by some chance, I gain the upper hand, can I force him to surrender without killing him.
Name: Book 16

text: Maybe, but Kalen might force the issue to save face.
Name: Book 16

text: Of course, his kin would not be able to seek vengeance against you, not openly.
Name: Book 16

text: They will probably send an assassin or five to kill you.
Name: Book 16

text: So I need to get him to surrender or kill him and insure his family wont assassinate me.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer cant help but chuckle as he says, Yeah, good luck with that.
Name: Book 16

text: Any other good news.
Name: Book 16

text: No, though I am curious why you are taking a wood staff into battle and not some weapon of cold iron.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont want to kill him and Im better with a staff than I am with knives or swords.
Name: Book 16

text: Its your funeral, He says.
Name: Book 16

text: Thanks for your support, I reply evenly.
Name: Book 16

text: As we head to the dueling grounds, a small impish looking creature approaches us.
Name: Book 16

text: Care to make a wager on the battle.
Name: Book 16

text: it asks.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer shakes his head, giving me a warning look.
Name: Book 16

text: What would we bet.
Name: Book 16

text: Years of service, it says.
Name: Book 16

text: I try not to sound too amused.
Name: Book 16

text: How would I pay up if Kalen kills me.
Name: Book 16

text: Hehehe, where there is a will there is a way, It replies with an expression that really creeps me out.
Name: Book 16

text: Ill pass, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer slaps me on the back.
Name: Book 16

text: I think its your first this weekend.
Name: Book 16

text: As Aleric explains the rules, Kalen doesnt even bother to select a weapon to bring with him into battle.
Name: Book 16

text: I listen even though Ive heard this all from Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: Halfway thru the explanation, I say, Um, can we skip to the rules that have nothing to do with magic.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not a sorcerer or anything like that.
Name: Book 16

text: For the second time in twenty four hours, I shock everyone around me.
Name: Book 16

text: Before, they thought I was a little crazy.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, they dont know what to think.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen asks Aleric, Is there anything in our laws against killing the mentally handicapped.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric shakes his head as he leaves the circle where our combat is to take place.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen wastes no time.
Name: Book 16

text: Im surprised he didnt make some sort of grandiose speech.
Name: Book 16

text: He just wants this over and done with.
Name: Book 16

text: The glamour Kalen throws against my senses and reality would be enough to frighten someone to death.
Name: Book 16

text: Everyone can feel its power rushing out towards me, warping the confines of the circle.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know how Nightbringer would have coped with such an attack.
Name: Book 16

text: The magic washes over me like a tidal wave.
Name: Book 16

text: I feel the world sway but only for a moment.
Name: Book 16

text: The glamour breaks against my power.
Name: Book 16

text: It looks like I am on a roll.
Name: Book 16

text: For the third time, I shock everyone.
Name: Book 16

text: I wasnt sure my gift would protect me.
Name: Book 16

text: It was a risk, one Kara didnt think we should take.
Name: Book 16

text: Even though I survived Kalens attack, I never want to go through something like that again.
Name: Book 16

text: Who knows, in time he might be able to overwhelm my gift.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont give it to him.
Name: Book 16

text: I charge forward, lunging with my staff.
Name: Book 16

text: Im not as good with weapons as I am with my bare hands so Im careful.
Name: Book 16

text: I use what I hope is the right amount of force to drive the air from his lungs.
Name: Book 16

text: As he doubles over, I swing the staff in a tight arc to crack him on the side of the head.
Name: Book 16

text: Its hard enough to send him down but not hard enough to crack bone or draw blood.
Name: Book 16

text: You can kill someone with a stick or club as easily as you can with a knife.
Name: Book 16

text: I can hear everyone yelling while Aleric shouts for order.
Name: Book 16

text: Out the corner of my eye, Rook and Nightbringer hug one another.
Name: Book 16

text: There is just one last thing to do.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen, yield, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: The Unseelie spits up at me.
Name: Book 16

text: He spits the word Never at me, followed by another glamour.
Name: Book 16

text: This one is not a powerful as the first.
Name: Book 16

text: It does no better than his last spell.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen, you owe me a boon.
Name: Book 16

text: I ask that you surrender and well be square.
Name: Book 16

text: I look down at Kalen as he curses my name but he cant refuse.
Name: Book 16

text: He is bound by the law and his word.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont know what the penalty for refusing a boon is.
Name: Book 16

text: It is probably worse than death.
Name: Book 16

text: Kalen mutters, I yield.
Name: Book 16

text: I turn from him to wave to Rook and Nightbringer.
Name: Book 16

text: They are laughing and cheering for me.
Name: Book 16

text: It feels good, then the cheering turns to cries of warning.
Name: Book 16

text: I glance back at Kalen who is still lying where I left him.
Name: Book 16

text: The Fae rips two blades of grass from the ground and flings them at me.
Name: Book 16

text: In midair, his Glamour turns them to knives.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara screams,    Move.
Name: Book 16

text: but I dont.
Name: Book 16

text: Ive proven that his spells cant hurt me.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, it is my turn to be surprised.
Name: Book 16

text: One of the knives buries itself in my shoulder.
Name: Book 16

text: The other lodges between two ribs.
Name: Book 16

text: Kara continues to scream at me as I tumble into the darkness.
Name: Book 16

text: You are very lucky my friend, Nightbringer smiles down at me.
Name: Book 16

text: You would have died if it werent for Rook.
Name: Book 16

text: I ask even though I remember the knives thudding into me.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas voice is soft but tinged with anger.
Name: Book 16

text: Y   our gift has limits, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: This is one of them.
Name: Book 16

text: Most magic wont be able to touch you but things created by magic are still dangerous.
Name: Book 16

text: You have to be careful.
Name: Book 16

text: You have to trust me.
Name: Book 16

text: We couldnt use the glamour to heal you.
Name: Book 16

text: It took all of Rooks skills to have any kind of effect on you, Nightbringer says.
Name: Book 16

text: Your gift is a double edged sword.
Name: Book 16

text: That is the other price for your power.
Name: Book 16

text: It works against all magic, not just the stuff trying to harm you,    Kara says.
Name: Book 16

text: I nod slowly, closing my eyes as Nightbringer continues.
Name: Book 16

text: It took a lot out of her to save you.
Name: Book 16

text: You owe Rook your life but dont say that,    Kara murmurs.
Name: Book 16

text: I doubt she would use the words to enslave you but its best to be careful.
Name: Book 16

text: Thank you, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: No Count, it is I who should be thanking you.
Name: Book 16

text: This land is ours now and forever.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric used Kalens actions to get the Unseelie to relinquish all claim to it.
Name: Book 16

text: It was the least they could do since one of the royal household tried to murder you.
Name: Book 16

text: I wince at that.
Name: Book 16

text: You didnt know Kalen was one of their Princes.
Name: Book 16

text: I see, Now the comment about assassins makes sense.
Name: Book 16

text: Killing a nobody in a duel is one thing, killing a prince is a different story.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer catches my look.
Name: Book 16

text: You wont have to worry about him or his kin.
Name: Book 16

text: Aleric was quite put out over the whole matter and Kalens bad form.
Name: Book 16

text: The Arbiter hopes you will forgive and forget this matter.
Name: Book 16

text: He would be in your debt.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, I need to get home.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont think I can survive any more rest and relaxation, I say.
Name: Book 16

text: In time Count, Rook still needs to finish her work on you before youre fit enough for travel.
Name: Book 16

text: Just rest and get better.
Name: Book 16

text: I was wrong about the path you had chosen, Rook says.
Name: Book 16

text: I shrug off her words.
Name: Book 16

text: She had apologized to me far too many times.
Name: Book 16

text: If it werent for her I would be dead.
Name: Book 16

text: I murmur, That was my fault.
Name: Book 16

text: You didnt know me.
Name: Book 16

text: If I were in your place, I would have thought the same thing.
Name: Book 16

text: She lets it go.
Name: Book 16

text: As the days and nights pass in her and Nightbringers company, they tend my wounds and I want for nothing.
Name: Book 16

text: I spend the days resting in a bed of flowers and the nights enjoying music under the stars.
Name: Book 16

text: Finally, its time to go home.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer stays at the camp to tidy up.
Name: Book 16

text: He doesnt like saying goodbye.
Name: Book 16

text: It gives me the chance to speak to Rook again as she leads me back to the road.
Name: Book 16

text: You are very lucky.
Name: Book 16

text: Not everyone can live the life they want, Rook says.
Name: Book 16

text: Youve chosen a hard path and the role you have chosen to play has made it harder.
Name: Book 16

text: And what role is that.
Name: Book 16

text: I still dont know.
Name: Book 16

text: Nightbringer would call it the path of heroism, but your role is less and more than that.
Name: Book 16

text: I lack the words to describe it but I hope it leads you to happiness.
Name: Book 16

text: Even if it doesnt, could I have made any other choice than the one I did.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook laughs at that.
Name: Book 16

text: And still be who you are.
Name: Book 16

text: Now, I understand part of what I saw.
Name: Book 16

text: And what part was that.
Name: Book 16

text: This, She leans close, drawing me into an embrace that warms me body and soul.
Name: Book 16

text: In an instant, I know her and Nightbringer in ways I had not dreamed of possible.
Name: Book 16

text: Instinctively, I know it is their gift to me.
Name: Book 16

text: It means I am forever in their hearts and thoughts.
Name: Book 16

text: You have our thanks and friendship, Count.
Name: Book 16

text: Dream of us, we will dream of you, She murmurs.
Name: Book 16

text: Reluctantly, she lets me go.
Name: Book 16

text: I step out from the woods and onto the side of the road.
Name: Book 16

text: Right on time, my bus pulls up in front of me.
Name: Book 16

text: I dont bother looking back or waving goodbye.
Name: Book 16

text: Rook is already gone.
Name: Book 16

text: You could go back and join them,    Kara says    You would be welcome there.
Name: Book 16

text: No, I cant stay there.
Name: Book 16

text: I need to go forward, I say it out loud, not caring who hears me.
Name: Book 16

text: With that said, I climb onto the bus.
Name: Book 16

text: This little vacation has pointed me in the direction I want to go.
Name: Book 16

text: I like helping people.
Name: Book 16

text: I might be able to do that here but there are people back home who could use my help more.
Name: Book 16

text: They know even less than about the supernatural.
Name: Book 16

text: Im going to do just that from now one.
Name: Book 16

text: Its what I want to do.
Name: Book 16

text: Karas fills my mind with warmth.
Name: Book 16

text: The idea appeals to her too.
Name: Book 16

text: Her silent agreement makes it and the world feel right for the first time in weeks.
Name: Book 16

text: * About the Author.

text: Its given him a very diverse skill set which has come in handy on numerous occasions.
Name: Book 16

text: His interests include the martial arts, costuming, travel, gaming and just having fun.

text: He enjoys meeting and talking to people with similar interests.

Name: Book 16

Name: Book 16

text: With his only allies --an ex-cop turned criminal and a bartending medical student--Tyler is plunged into the middle of a mystery and comes face to face with the darker side of the broadcasting industry.
